Abdominales.name: 3/4 Abdominales
Abdominales.instructions:
Acuéstese en el suelo y asegure sus pies. Las piernas deben estar dobladas a la altura de las rodillas.
Coloque las manos detrás o a un lado de la cabeza. Comenzarás de espaldas al suelo. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Flexiona las caderas y la columna vertebral para elevar el torso hacia las rodillas.
En la parte superior de la contracción, el torso debe estar perpendicular al suelo. Invierta el movimiento, bajando solo ¾ del camino.
Repita la cantidad recomendada de repeticiones.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie down on the floor and secure your feet. Your legs should be bent at the knees.
Place your hands behind or to the side of your head. You will begin with your back on the ground. This will be your starting position.
Flex your hips and spine to raise your torso toward your knees.
At the top of the contraction your torso should be perpendicular to the ground. Reverse the motion, going only ¾ of the way down.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie down on the Suelo and secure your feet. Your Piernas should be bent at the knees. Place your hands behind or to the Lateral of your head. You will begin with your Espalda on the ground. This will be your starting position. Flex your Caderas and spine to Elevación your torso toward your knees. At the top of the contraction your torso should be perpendicular to the ground. Inverso the motion, going only ¾ of the way down. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Ab Crunch Máquina
Abdominales.instructions:
Select a light resistance and sit down on the ab machine placing your feet under the pads provided and grabbing the top handles. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle as you rest the triceps on the pads provided. This will be your starting position.
At the same time, begin to lift the legs up as you crunch your upper torso. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Be sure to use a slow and controlled motion. Concentrate on using your abs to move the weight while relaxing your legs and feet.
After a second pause, slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Select a light resistance and sit down on the ab machine placing your feet under the pads provided and grabbing the top handles. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle as you rest the triceps on the pads provided. This will be your starting position.
At the same time, begin to lift the legs up as you crunch your upper torso. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Be sure to use a slow and controlled motion. Concentrate on using your abs to move the weight while relaxing your legs and feet.
After a second pause, slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Select a light resistance and sit down on the ab Máquina placing your feet under the pads provided and grabbing the top handles. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle as you rest the Tríceps on the pads provided. This will be your starting position. At the same time, begin to lift the Piernas up as you Crunch your upper torso. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Be sure to use a sBajo and controlled motion. Concentrate on using your abs to move the weight while relaxing your Piernas and feet. After a second pause, sBajoly return to the starting position as you breathe in. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Rueda Abdominal
Abdominales.instructions:
Hold the Ab Roller with both hands and kneel on the floor.
Now place the ab roller on the floor in front of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a kneeling push up position). This will be your starting position.
Slowly roll the ab roller straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the floor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and keep your abs tight at all times.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Hold the Ab Roller with both hands and kneel on the floor.
Now place the ab roller on the floor in front of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a kneeling push up position). This will be your starting position.
Slowly roll the ab roller straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the floor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and keep your abs tight at all times.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Hold the Rueda Abdominal with both hands and kneel on the Suelo. Now place the Rueda Abdominal on the Suelo in Frontal of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a Arrodillado Flexión position). This will be your starting position. SBajoly roll the Rueda Abdominal straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the Suelo with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement. After a pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go sBajoly and keep your abs tight at all times.

Abdominales.name: Advanced Pesa Rusa Windmill
Abdominales.instructions:
Limpie y presione una pesa rusa por encima de la cabeza con un brazo.
Manteniendo la pesa rusa bloqueada en todo momento, empuja tu trasero en la dirección de la pesa rusa bloqueada. Mantenga el brazo que no funciona detrás de la espalda y gire los pies en un ángulo de cuarenta y cinco grados desde el brazo con la pesa rusa.
Bájate lo más posible.
Haga una pausa por un segundo e invierta el movimiento para volver a la posición inicial.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Clean and press a kettlebell overhead with one arm.
Keeping the kettlebell locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out kettlebell. Keep the non-working arm behind your back and turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the kettlebell.
Lower yourself as far as possible.
Pause for a second and reverse the motion back to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Cargada and Press a Pesa Rusa Sobre la Cabeza with Un Brazo. Keeping the Pesa Rusa locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out Pesa Rusa. Keep the non-working arm behind your Espalda and turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the Pesa Rusa. Bajoer yourself as far as possible. Pause for a second and Inverso the motion Espalda to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Air Bike
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. For this exercise, you will need to put your hands beside your head. Be careful however to not strain with the neck as you perform it. Now lift your shoulders into the crunch position.
Bring knees up to where they are perpendicular to the floor, with your lower legs parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Now simultaneously, slowly go through a cycle pedal motion kicking forward with the right leg and bringing in the knee of the left leg. Bring your right elbow close to your left knee by crunching to the side, as you breathe out.
Go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Crunch to the opposite side as you cycle your legs and bring closer your left elbow to your right knee and exhale.
Continue alternating in this manner until all of the recommended repetitions for each side have been completed.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. For this exercise, you will need to put your hands beside your head. Be careful however to not strain with the neck as you perform it. Now lift your shoulders into the crunch position.
Bring knees up to where they are perpendicular to the floor, with your lower legs parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Now simultaneously, slowly go through a cycle pedal motion kicking forward with the right leg and bringing in the knee of the left leg. Bring your right elbow close to your left knee by crunching to the side, as you breathe out.
Go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Crunch to the opposite side as you cycle your legs and bring closer your left elbow to your right knee and exhale.
Continue alternating in this manner until all of the recommended repetitions for each side have been completed.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie flat on the Suelo with your Bajoer Espalda Pressed to the ground. For this exercise, you will need to put your hands beLateral your head. Be careful however to not strain with the neck as you perform it. Now lift your Hombros into the Crunch position. Bring knees up to where they are perpendicular to the Suelo, with your Bajoer Piernas parallel to the Suelo. This will be your starting position. Now simultaneously, sBajoly go through a cycle pedal motion kicking forward with the right Pierna and bringing in the knee of the left Pierna. Bring your right elbow close to your left knee by Crunching to the Lateral, as you breathe out. Go Espalda to the initial position as you breathe in. Crunch to the opposite Lateral as you cycle your Piernas and bring closer your left elbow to your right knee and exhale. Continue Alternando in this manner until all of the recommended repetitions for each Lateral have been completed.

Abdominales.name: Tacones de Tacón Alternativos
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie on the floor with the knees bent and the feet on the floor around 18-24 inches apart. Your arms should be extended by your side. This will be your starting position.
Crunch over your torso forward and up about 3-4 inches to the right side and touch your right heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement.
Now go back slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Now crunch over your torso forward and up around 3-4 inches to the left side and touch your left heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement and then go back to the starting position as you inhale. Now that both heels have been touched, that is considered 1 repetition.
Continue alternating sides in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor with the knees bent and the feet on the floor around 18-24 inches apart. Your arms should be extended by your side. This will be your starting position.
Crunch over your torso forward and up about 3-4 inches to the right side and touch your right heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement.
Now go back slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Now crunch over your torso forward and up around 3-4 inches to the left side and touch your left heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement and then go back to the starting position as you inhale. Now that both heels have been touched, that is considered 1 repetition.
Continue alternating sides in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo with the knees bent and the feet on the Suelo around 18-24 inches apart. Your arms should be extended by your Lateral. This will be your starting position. Crunch over your torso forward and up about 3-4 inches to the right Lateral and touch your right heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement. Now go Espalda sBajoly to the starting position as you inhale. Now Crunch over your torso forward and up around 3-4 inches to the left Lateral and touch your left heel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement and then go Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Now that both heels have been touched, that is conLateralred 1 repetition. Continue Alternando Laterals in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.

Abdominales.name: Barra Ab Rollout
Abdominales.instructions:
For this exercise you will need to get into a pushup position, but instead of having your hands of the floor, you will be grabbing on to an Olympic barbell (loaded with 5-10 lbs on each side) instead. This will be your starting position.
While keeping a slight arch on your back, lift your hips and roll the barbell towards your feet as you exhale. Tip: As you perform the movement, your glutes should be coming up, you should be keeping the abs tight and should maintain your back posture at all times. Also your arms should be staying perpendicular to the floor throughout the movement. If you don't, you will work out your shoulders and back more than the abs.
After a second contraction at the top, start to roll the barbell back forward to the starting position slowly as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
For this exercise you will need to get into a pushup position, but instead of having your hands of the floor, you will be grabbing on to an Olympic barbell (loaded with 5-10 lbs on each side) instead. This will be your starting position.
While keeping a slight arch on your back, lift your hips and roll the barbell towards your feet as you exhale. Tip: As you perform the movement, your glutes should be coming up, you should be keeping the abs tight and should maintain your back posture at all times. Also your arms should be staying perpendicular to the floor throughout the movement. If you don't, you will work out your shoulders and back more than the abs.
After a second contraction at the top, start to roll the barbell back forward to the starting position slowly as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: For this exercise you will need to get into a pushup position, but instead of having your hands of the Suelo, you will be grabbing on to an Olympic Barra (loaded with 5-10 lbs on each Lateral) instead. This will be your starting position. While keeping a slight arch on your Espalda, lift your Caderas and roll the Barra towards your feet as you exhale. Tip: As you perform the movement, your Glúteos should be coming up, you should be keeping the abs tight and should maintain your Espalda posture at all times. Also your arms should be staying perpendicular to the Suelo throughout the movement. If you don't, you will work out your Hombros and Espalda more than the abs. After a second contraction at the top, start to roll the Barra Espalda forward to the starting position sBajoly as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Barra Ab Rollout - On Knees
Abdominales.instructions:
Hold an Olympic barbell loaded with 5-10lbs on each side and kneel on the floor.
Now place the barbell on the floor in front of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a kneeling push up position). This will be your starting position.
Slowly roll the barbell straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the floor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a second pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and keep your abs tight at all times.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Hold an Olympic barbell loaded with 5-10lbs on each side and kneel on the floor.
Now place the barbell on the floor in front of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a kneeling push up position). This will be your starting position.
Slowly roll the barbell straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the floor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a second pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and keep your abs tight at all times.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Hold an Olympic Barra loaded with 5-10lbs on each Lateral and kneel on the Suelo. Now place the Barra on the Suelo in Frontal of you so that you are on all your hands and knees (as in a Arrodillado Flexión position). This will be your starting position. SBajoly roll the Barra straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the Suelo with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement. After a second pause at the stretched position, start pulling yourself Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go sBajoly and keep your abs tight at all times.

Abdominales.name: Barra Rollout From Bench
Abdominales.instructions:
Coloque una barra cargada en el suelo, cerca del final de un banco. Arrodíllate con ambas piernas en el banco y agarra la barra con un agarre medio a estrecho. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Para comenzar, extiéndase a través de las caderas para hacer rodar lentamente la barra hacia adelante. A medida que se despliega, flexione el hombro para hacer rodar la barra por encima de la cabeza. Asegúrese de que sus brazos permanezcan extendidos durante todo el movimiento.
Cuando la barra se haya movido lo más hacia adelante posible, vuelva a la posición inicial.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Place a loaded barbell on the ground, near the end of a bench. Kneel with both legs on the bench, and take a medium to narrow grip on the barbell. This will be your starting position.
To begin, extend through the hips to slowly roll the bar forward. As you roll out, flex the shoulder to roll the bar above your head. Ensure that your arms remain extended throughout the movement.
When the bar has been moved as far forward as possible, return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Place a loaded Barra on the ground, near the end of a bench. Kneel with both Piernas on the bench, and take a medium to narRemo grip on the Barra. This will be your starting position. To begin, extend through the Caderas to sBajoly roll the bar forward. As you roll out, flex the Hombro to roll the bar above your head. Ensure that your arms remain extended throughout the movement. When the bar has been moved as far forward as possible, return to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Barra Lateral Bend
Abdominales.instructions:
Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck). Your feet should be shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck). Your feet should be shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Stand up straight while holding a Barra placed on the Espalda of your Hombros (slightly beBajo the neck). Your feet should be Hombro width apart. This will be your starting position. While keeping your Espalda straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the Lateral. Then hold for a second and come Espalda up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary. Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Bent-knee Cadera Elevación
Abdominales.instructions:
Lay flat on the floor with your arms next to your sides.
Now bend your knees at around a 75 degree angle and lift your feet off the floor by around 2 inches.
Using your lower abs, bring your knees in towards you as you maintain the 75 degree angle bend in your legs. Continue this movement until you raise your hips off of the floor by rolling your pelvis backward. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the end of the movement your knees will be over your chest.
Squeeze your abs at the top of the movement for a second and then return to the starting position slowly as you breathe in. Tip: Maintain a controlled motion at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lay flat on the floor with your arms next to your sides.
Now bend your knees at around a 75 degree angle and lift your feet off the floor by around 2 inches.
Using your lower abs, bring your knees in towards you as you maintain the 75 degree angle bend in your legs. Continue this movement until you raise your hips off of the floor by rolling your pelvis backward. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the end of the movement your knees will be over your chest.
Squeeze your abs at the top of the movement for a second and then return to the starting position slowly as you breathe in. Tip: Maintain a controlled motion at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lay flat on the Suelo with your arms next to your Laterals. Now bend your knees at around a 75 degree angle and lift your feet off the Suelo by around 2 inches. Using your Bajoer abs, bring your knees in towards you as you maintain the 75 degree angle bend in your Piernas. Continue this movement until you Elevación your Caderas off of the Suelo by rolling your pelvis Espaldaward. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the end of the movement your knees will be over your Pecho. Squeeze your abs at the top of the movement for a second and then return to the starting position sBajoly as you breathe in. Tip: Maintain a controlled motion at all times. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Prensa Doblada
Abdominales.instructions:
Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so. This will be your starting position.
Begin my leaning to the side opposite the kettlebell, continuing until you are able to touch the ground with your free hand, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell. As you do so, press the weight vertically be extending through the elbow, keeping your arm perpendicular to the ground.
Return to an upright position, with the kettlebell above your head. Return the kettlebell to the shoulder and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Clean a kettlebell to your shoulder. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebell towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so. This will be your starting position.
Begin my leaning to the side opposite the kettlebell, continuing until you are able to touch the ground with your free hand, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell. As you do so, press the weight vertically be extending through the elbow, keeping your arm perpendicular to the ground.
Return to an upright position, with the kettlebell above your head. Return the kettlebell to the shoulder and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Cargada a Pesa Rusa to your Hombro. Cargada the Pesa Rusa to your Hombros by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you Elevación the Pesa Rusa towards your Hombro. The Muñeca should rotate as you do so. This will be your starting position. Begin my leaning to the Lateral opposite the Pesa Rusa, continuing until you are able to touch the ground with your free hand, keeping your eyes on the Pesa Rusa. As you do so, Press the weight vertically be extending through the elbow, keeping your arm perpendicular to the ground. Return to an Vertical position, with the Pesa Rusa above your head. Return the Pesa Rusa to the Hombro and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Bosu Ball Polea Crunch With Lateral Bends
Abdominales.instructions:
Connect a standard handle to each arm of a cable machine, and position them in the most downward position.
Grab a Bosu Ball and position it in front and center of the cable machine.
Lie down on the Bosu Ball with the small of your back arched around the ball. Your rear end should be close to the floor without touching it.
With both hands, reach back and grab the handle of each cable.
With your feet positioned in a wide stance, extend your arms straight out in front of you and in between your knees. Your hands should be at knee level.
Keep your arms straight and in-line with the upward angle of the cable. Elevate your torso in a crunching motion without dropping or bending your arms.
Maintain the rigid position with your arms. Slowly descend back to the starting position with your back arched around the Bosu Ball and your abdominals elongated.
Repeat the same series of movements to failure.
Once you reach failure, keep your abs tight and raise your torso into plank position so your back is elevated off the Bosu Ball.
Lower your arms down to your side; keep them straight. Start doing alternating side bends; reach for your heels! This finishing movement will focus on your obliques.
Abdominales.name_en: Bosu Ball Cable Crunch With Side Bends
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Connect a standard handle to each arm of a cable machine, and position them in the most downward position.
Grab a Bosu Ball and position it in front and center of the cable machine.
Lie down on the Bosu Ball with the small of your back arched around the ball. Your rear end should be close to the floor without touching it.
With both hands, reach back and grab the handle of each cable.
With your feet positioned in a wide stance, extend your arms straight out in front of you and in between your knees. Your hands should be at knee level.
Keep your arms straight and in-line with the upward angle of the cable. Elevate your torso in a crunching motion without dropping or bending your arms.
Maintain the rigid position with your arms. Slowly descend back to the starting position with your back arched around the Bosu Ball and your abdominals elongated.
Repeat the same series of movements to failure.
Once you reach failure, keep your abs tight and raise your torso into plank position so your back is elevated off the Bosu Ball.
Lower your arms down to your side; keep them straight. Start doing alternating side bends; reach for your heels! This finishing movement will focus on your obliques.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Connect a Estándar handle to each arm of a Polea Máquina, and position them in the most downward position. Grab a Bosu Ball and position it in Frontal and center of the Polea Máquina. Lie down on the Bosu Ball with the small of your Espalda arched around the ball. Your Posterior end should be close to the Suelo without touching it. With both hands, reach Espalda and grab the handle of each Polea. With your feet positioned in a wide stance, extend your arms straight out in Frontal of you and in between your knees. Your hands should be at knee level. Keep your arms straight and in-line with the upward angle of the Polea. Elevate your torso in a Crunching motion without dropping or bending your arms. Maintain the rigid position with your arms. SBajoly descend Espalda to the starting position with your Espalda arched around the Bosu Ball and your Abdominals elongated. Repeat the same series of movements to failure. Once you reach failure, keep your abs tight and Elevación your torso into Plancha position so your Espalda is elevated off the Bosu Ball. Bajoer your arms down to your Lateral; keep them straight. Start doing Alternando Lateral bends; reach for your heels! This finishing movement will focus on your obliques.

Abdominales.name: Bottoms Up
Abdominales.instructions:
Comience acostándose boca arriba en el suelo. Las piernas deben estar rectas y los brazos a los lados. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Para realizar el movimiento, mete las rodillas hacia el pecho flexionando las caderas y las rodillas. A continuación, extiende las piernas directamente sobre ti para que queden perpendiculares al suelo. Gira y eleva la pelvis para levantar los glúteos del suelo.
Después de una breve pausa, vuelva a la posición inicial.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms at your side. This will be your starting position.
To perform the movement, tuck the knees toward your chest by flexing the hips and knees. Following this, extend your legs directly above you so that they are perpendicular to the ground. Rotate and elevate your pelvis to raise your glutes from the floor.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Begin by Recostado on your Espalda on the ground. Your Piernas should be straight and your arms at your Lateral. This will be your starting position. To perform the movement, tuck the knees toward your Pecho by flexing the Caderas and knees. FolBajoing this, extend your Piernas directly above you so that they are perpendicular to the ground. Rotate and elevate your pelvis to Elevación your Glúteos from the Suelo. After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Butt-ups
Abdominales.instructions:
Begin a pushup position but with your elbows on the ground and resting on your forearms. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle.
Arch your back slightly out rather than keeping your back completely straight.
Raise your glutes toward the ceiling, squeezing your abs tightly to close the distance between your ribcage and hips. The end result will be that you'll end up in a high bridge position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lower back down slowly to your starting position as you breathe in. Tip: Don't let your back sag downwards.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Begin a pushup position but with your elbows on the ground and resting on your forearms. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle.
Arch your back slightly out rather than keeping your back completely straight.
Raise your glutes toward the ceiling, squeezing your abs tightly to close the distance between your ribcage and hips. The end result will be that you'll end up in a high bridge position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lower back down slowly to your starting position as you breathe in. Tip: Don't let your back sag downwards.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Begin a pushup position but with your elbows on the ground and resting on your foPosteriorms. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degree angle. Arch your Espalda slightly out rather than keeping your Espalda completely straight. Elevación your Glúteos toward the ceiling, squeezing your abs tightly to close the distance between your ribcage and Caderas. The end result will be that you'll end up in a Alto bridge position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Bajoer Espalda down sBajoly to your starting position as you breathe in. Tip: Don't let your Espalda sag downwards. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Polea Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Kneel below a high pulley that contains a rope attachment.
Grasp cable rope attachment and lower the rope until your hands are placed next to your face.
Flex your hips slightly and allow the weight to hyperextend the lower back. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist as you contract the abs so that the elbows travel towards the middle of the thighs. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you keep constant tension on the abs throughout the movement. Also, do not choose a weight so heavy that the lower back handles the brunt of the work.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Kneel below a high pulley that contains a rope attachment.
Grasp cable rope attachment and lower the rope until your hands are placed next to your face.
Flex your hips slightly and allow the weight to hyperextend the lower back. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist as you contract the abs so that the elbows travel towards the middle of the thighs. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you keep constant tension on the abs throughout the movement. Also, do not choose a weight so heavy that the lower back handles the brunt of the work.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Kneel beBajo a Alto pulley that contains a rope attachment. Grasp Polea rope attachment and Bajoer the rope until your hands are placed next to your face. Flex your Caderas slightly and alBajo the weight to hyperextend the Bajoer Espalda. This will be your starting position. With the Caderas stationary, flex the waist as you contract the abs so that the elbows travel towards the middle of the tAltos. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second. SBajoly return to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you keep constant tension on the abs throughout the movement. Also, do not choose a weight so heavy that the Bajoer Espalda handles the brunt of the work. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Polea Judo Flip
Abdominales.instructions:
Connect a rope attachment to a tower, and move the cable to the lowest pulley position. Stand with your side to the cable with a wide stance, and grab the rope with both hands.
Twist your body away from the pulley as you bring the rope over your shoulder like you're performing a judo flip.
Shift your weight between your feet as you twist and crunch forward, pulling the cable downward.
Return to the starting position and repeat until failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Connect a rope attachment to a tower, and move the cable to the lowest pulley position. Stand with your side to the cable with a wide stance, and grab the rope with both hands.
Twist your body away from the pulley as you bring the rope over your shoulder like you're performing a judo flip.
Shift your weight between your feet as you twist and crunch forward, pulling the cable downward.
Return to the starting position and repeat until failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Connect a rope attachment to a tower, and move the Polea to the Bajoest pulley position. Stand with your Lateral to the Polea with a wide stance, and grab the rope with both hands. Twist your body away from the pulley as you bring the rope over your Hombro like you're performing a judo flip. Shift your weight between your feet as you twist and Crunch forward, pulling the Polea downward. Return to the starting position and repeat until failure. Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite Lateral.

Abdominales.name: Polea Inverso Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Connect an ankle strap attachment to a low pulley cable and position a mat on the floor in front of it.
Sit down with your feet toward the pulley and attach the cable to your ankles.
Lie down, elevate your legs and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle. Your legs and the cable should be aligned. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are.
With your hands behind your head, bring your knees inward to your torso and elevate your hips off the floor.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controlled manner drop your hips and bring your legs back to the starting 90-degree angle. You should still have tension on your abs in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Connect an ankle strap attachment to a low pulley cable and position a mat on the floor in front of it.
Sit down with your feet toward the pulley and attach the cable to your ankles.
Lie down, elevate your legs and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle. Your legs and the cable should be aligned. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are.
With your hands behind your head, bring your knees inward to your torso and elevate your hips off the floor.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controlled manner drop your hips and bring your legs back to the starting 90-degree angle. You should still have tension on your abs in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Connect an ankle strap attachment to a Bajo pulley Polea and position a mat on the Suelo in Frontal of it. Sit down with your feet toward the pulley and attach the Polea to your ankles. Lie down, elevate your Piernas and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle. Your Piernas and the Polea should be aligned. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are. With your hands behind your head, bring your knees inward to your torso and elevate your Caderas off the Suelo. Pause for a moment and in a sBajo and controlled manner drop your Caderas and bring your Piernas Espalda to the starting 90-degree angle. You should still have tension on your abs in the resting position. Repeat the same movement to failure.

Abdominales.name: Polea Giro Rusos
Abdominales.instructions:
Connect a standard handle attachment, and position the cable to a middle pulley position.
Lie on a stability ball perpendicular to the cable and grab the handle with one hand. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable.
Grab the handle with both hands and fully extend your arms above your chest. You hands should be directly in-line with the pulley. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are.
Keep your hips elevated and abs engaged. Rotate your torso away from the pulley for a full-quarter rotation. Your body should be flat from head to knees.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controlled manner reset to the starting position. You should still have side tension on the cable in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Connect a standard handle attachment, and position the cable to a middle pulley position.
Lie on a stability ball perpendicular to the cable and grab the handle with one hand. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable.
Grab the handle with both hands and fully extend your arms above your chest. You hands should be directly in-line with the pulley. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are.
Keep your hips elevated and abs engaged. Rotate your torso away from the pulley for a full-quarter rotation. Your body should be flat from head to knees.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controlled manner reset to the starting position. You should still have side tension on the cable in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Connect a Estándar handle attachment, and position the Polea to a middle pulley position. Lie on a stability ball perpendicular to the Polea and grab the handle with one hand. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the Polea. Grab the handle with both hands and fully extend your arms above your Pecho. You hands should be directly in-line with the pulley. If not, adjust the pulley up or down until they are. Keep your Caderas elevated and abs engaged. Rotate your torso away from the pulley for a full-quarter rotation. Your body should be flat from head to knees. Pause for a moment and in a sBajo and controlled manner reset to the starting position. You should still have Lateral tension on the Polea in the resting position. Repeat the same movement to failure. Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite Lateral.

Abdominales.name: Polea Sentado Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Seat on a flat bench with your back facing a high pulley.
Grasp the cable rope attachment with both hands (with the palms of the hands facing each other) and place your hands securely over both shoulders. Tip: Allow the weight to hyperextend the lower back slightly. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist so the elbows travel toward the hips. Breathe out as you perform this step.
As you inhale, go back to the initial position slowly.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Seat on a flat bench with your back facing a high pulley.
Grasp the cable rope attachment with both hands (with the palms of the hands facing each other) and place your hands securely over both shoulders. Tip: Allow the weight to hyperextend the lower back slightly. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist so the elbows travel toward the hips. Breathe out as you perform this step.
As you inhale, go back to the initial position slowly.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Seat on a flat bench with your Espalda facing a Alto pulley. Grasp the Polea rope attachment with both hands (with the palms of the hands facing each other) and place your hands securely over both Hombros. Tip: AlBajo the weight to hyperextend the Bajoer Espalda slightly. This will be your starting position. With the Caderas stationary, flex the waist so the elbows travel toward the Caderas. Breathe out as you perform this step. As you inhale, go Espalda to the initial position sBajoly. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Capullos
Abdominales.instructions:
Comience acostándose boca arriba en el suelo. Las piernas deben estar rectas y los brazos extendidos detrás de la cabeza. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Para realizar el movimiento, mete las rodillas hacia el pecho, girando la pelvis para levantar los glúteos del suelo. Al hacerlo, flexiona la columna vertebral, llevando los brazos hacia atrás sobre la cabeza para realizar un movimiento crujiente simultáneo.
Después de una breve pausa, vuelva a la posición inicial.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms extended behind your head. This will be your starting position.
To perform the movement, tuck the knees toward your chest, rotating your pelvis to lift your glutes from the floor. As you do so, flex the spine, bringing your arms back over your head to perform a simultaneous crunch motion.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Begin by Recostado on your Espalda on the ground. Your Piernas should be straight and your arms extended behind your head. This will be your starting position. To perform the movement, tuck the knees toward your Pecho, rotating your pelvis to lift your Glúteos from the Suelo. As you do so, flex the spine, bringing your arms Espalda over your head to perform a simultaneous Crunch motion. After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Cross-body Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie flat on your back and bend your knees about 60 degrees.
Keep your feet flat on the floor and place your hands loosely behind your head. This will be your starting position.
Now curl up and bring your right elbow and shoulder across your body while bring your left knee in toward your left shoulder at the same time. Reach with your elbow and try to touch your knee. Exhale as you perform this movement. Tip: Try to bring your shoulder up towards your knee rather than just your elbow and remember that the key is to contract the abs as you perform the movement; not just to move the elbow.
Now go back down to the starting position as you inhale and repeat with the left elbow and the right knee.
Continue alternating in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie flat on your back and bend your knees about 60 degrees.
Keep your feet flat on the floor and place your hands loosely behind your head. This will be your starting position.
Now curl up and bring your right elbow and shoulder across your body while bring your left knee in toward your left shoulder at the same time. Reach with your elbow and try to touch your knee. Exhale as you perform this movement. Tip: Try to bring your shoulder up towards your knee rather than just your elbow and remember that the key is to contract the abs as you perform the movement; not just to move the elbow.
Now go back down to the starting position as you inhale and repeat with the left elbow and the right knee.
Continue alternating in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie flat on your Espalda and bend your knees about 60 degrees. Keep your feet flat on the Suelo and place your hands loosely behind your head. This will be your starting position. Now Curl up and bring your right elbow and Hombro across your body while bring your left knee in toward your left Hombro at the same time. Reach with your elbow and try to touch your knee. Exhale as you perform this movement. Tip: Try to bring your Hombro up towards your knee rather than just your elbow and remember that the key is to contract the abs as you perform the movement; not just to move the elbow. Now go Espalda down to the starting position as you inhale and repeat with the left elbow and the right knee. Continue Alternando in this manner until all prescribed repetitions are done.

Abdominales.name: Crunch - Hands Sobre la Cabeza
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie on the floor with your back flat and knees bent with around a 60-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves.
Keep your feet flat on the floor and stretch your arms overhead with your palms crossed. This will be your starting position.
Curl your upper body forward and bring your shoulder blades just off the floor. At all times, keep your arms aligned with your head, neck and shoulder. Don't move them forward from that position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor with your back flat and knees bent with around a 60-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves.
Keep your feet flat on the floor and stretch your arms overhead with your palms crossed. This will be your starting position.
Curl your upper body forward and bring your shoulder blades just off the floor. At all times, keep your arms aligned with your head, neck and shoulder. Don't move them forward from that position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo with your Espalda flat and knees bent with around a 60-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves. Keep your feet flat on the Suelo and stretch your arms Sobre la Cabeza with your palms crossed. This will be your starting position. Curl your upper body forward and bring your Hombro blades just off the Suelo. At all times, keep your arms aligned with your head, neck and Hombro. Don't move them forward from that position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second. SBajoly Bajoer down to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Crunch - Piernas On Exercise Ball
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie flat on your back with your feet resting on an exercise ball and your knees bent at a 90 degree angle.
Place your feet three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.
Place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
Push the small of your back down in the floor in order to better isolate your abdominal muscles. This will be your starting position.
Begin to roll your shoulders off the floor and continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back. Your shoulders should come up off the floor only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the floor. Breathe out as you execute this portion of the movement. Squeeze your abdominals hard at the top of the contraction and hold for a second. Tip: Focus on a slow, controlled movement. Refrain from using momentum at any time.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie flat on your back with your feet resting on an exercise ball and your knees bent at a 90 degree angle.
Place your feet three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.
Place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
Push the small of your back down in the floor in order to better isolate your abdominal muscles. This will be your starting position.
Begin to roll your shoulders off the floor and continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back. Your shoulders should come up off the floor only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the floor. Breathe out as you execute this portion of the movement. Squeeze your abdominals hard at the top of the contraction and hold for a second. Tip: Focus on a slow, controlled movement. Refrain from using momentum at any time.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie flat on your Espalda with your feet resting on an exercise ball and your knees bent at a 90 degree angle. Place your feet three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch. Place your hands lightly on either Lateral of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head. Push the small of your Espalda down in the Suelo in order to better isolate your Abdominal Muslos. This will be your starting position. Begin to roll your Hombros off the Suelo and continue to push down as hard as you can with your Bajoer Espalda. Your Hombros should come up off the Suelo only about four inches, and your Bajoer Espalda should remain on the Suelo. Breathe out as you execute this portion of the movement. Squeeze your Abdominals hard at the top of the contraction and hold for a second. Tip: Focus on a sBajo, controlled movement. Refrain from using momentum at any time. SBajoly go Espalda down to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Crunches
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground, or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle. If you are resting your feet on a bench, place them three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.
Now place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
While pushing the small of your back down in the floor to better isolate your abdominal muscles, begin to roll your shoulders off the floor.
Continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back as you contract your abdominals and exhale. Your shoulders should come up off the floor only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the floor. At the top of the movement, contract your abdominals hard and keep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on slow, controlled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum.
After the one second contraction, begin to come down slowly again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground, or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle. If you are resting your feet on a bench, place them three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.
Now place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
While pushing the small of your back down in the floor to better isolate your abdominal muscles, begin to roll your shoulders off the floor.
Continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back as you contract your abdominals and exhale. Your shoulders should come up off the floor only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the floor. At the top of the movement, contract your abdominals hard and keep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on slow, controlled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum.
After the one second contraction, begin to come down slowly again to the starting position as you inhale.

Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie flat on your Espalda with your feet flat on the ground, or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle. If you are resting your feet on a bench, place them three to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch. Now place your hands lightly on either Lateral of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head. While pushing the small of your Espalda down in the Suelo to better isolate your Abdominal Muslos, begin to roll your Hombros off the Suelo. Continue to push down as hard as you can with your Bajoer Espalda as you contract your Abdominals and exhale. Your Hombros should come up off the Suelo only about four inches, and your Bajoer Espalda should remain on the Suelo. At the top of the movement, contract your Abdominals hard and keep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on sBajo, controlled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum. After the one second contraction, begin to come down sBajoly again to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Insecto Muerto
Abdominales.instructions:
Begin lying on your back with your hands extended above you toward the ceiling.
Bring your feet, knees, and hips up to 90 degrees.
Exhale hard to bring your ribcage down and flatten your back onto the floor, rotating your pelvis up and squeezing your glutes. Hold this position throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the exercise by extending one leg, straightening the knee and hip to bring the leg just above the ground.
Maintain the position of your lumbar and pelvis as you perform the movement, as your back is going to want to arch.
Stay tight and return the working leg to the starting position.
Repeat on the opposite side, alternating until the set is complete.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Begin lying on your back with your hands extended above you toward the ceiling.
Bring your feet, knees, and hips up to 90 degrees.
Exhale hard to bring your ribcage down and flatten your back onto the floor, rotating your pelvis up and squeezing your glutes. Hold this position throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the exercise by extending one leg, straightening the knee and hip to bring the leg just above the ground.
Maintain the position of your lumbar and pelvis as you perform the movement, as your back is going to want to arch.
Stay tight and return the working leg to the starting position.
Repeat on the opposite side, alternating until the set is complete.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Begin Recostado on your Espalda with your hands extended above you toward the ceiling. Bring your feet, knees, and Caderas up to 90 degrees. Exhale hard to bring your ribcage down and flatten your Espalda onto the Suelo, rotating your pelvis up and squeezing your Glúteos. Hold this position throughout the movement. This will be your starting position. Initiate the exercise by extending one Pierna, straightening the knee and Cadera to bring the Pierna just above the ground. Maintain the position of your lumbar and pelvis as you perform the movement, as your Espalda is going to want to arch. Stay tight and return the working Pierna to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite Lateral, Alternando until the set is complete.

Abdominales.name: Declinado Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down.
Now place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
While pushing the small of your back down in the bench to better isolate your abdominal muscles, begin to roll your shoulders off it.
Continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back as you contract your abdominals and exhale. Your shoulders should come up off the bench only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the bench. At the top of the movement, contract your abdominals hard and keep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on slow, controlled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum.
After the one second contraction, begin to come down slowly again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down.
Now place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
While pushing the small of your back down in the bench to better isolate your abdominal muscles, begin to roll your shoulders off it.
Continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back as you contract your abdominals and exhale. Your shoulders should come up off the bench only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the bench. At the top of the movement, contract your abdominals hard and keep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on slow, controlled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum.
After the one second contraction, begin to come down slowly again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Secure your Piernas at the end of the Declinado bench and lie down. Now place your hands lightly on either Lateral of your head keeping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head. While pushing the small of your Espalda down in the bench to better isolate your Abdominal Muslos, begin to roll your Hombros off it. Continue to push down as hard as you can with your Bajoer Espalda as you contract your Abdominals and exhale. Your Hombros should come up off the bench only about four inches, and your Bajoer Espalda should remain on the bench. At the top of the movement, contract your Abdominals hard and keep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on sBajo, controlled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum. After the one second contraction, begin to come down sBajoly again to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Declinado Oblique Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.
Raise your upper body off the bench until your torso is about 35-45 degrees if measured from the floor.
Put one hand beside your head and the other on your thigh. This will be your starting position.
Raise your upper body slowly from the starting position while turning your torso to the left. Continue crunching up as you exhale until your right elbow touches your left knee. Hold this contracted position for a second. Tip: Focus on keeping your abs tight and keeping the movement slow and controlled.
Lower your body back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
After completing one set on the right for the recommended amount of repetitions, switch to your left side. Tip: Focus on really twisting your torso and feeling the contraction when you are in the up position.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.
Raise your upper body off the bench until your torso is about 35-45 degrees if measured from the floor.
Put one hand beside your head and the other on your thigh. This will be your starting position.
Raise your upper body slowly from the starting position while turning your torso to the left. Continue crunching up as you exhale until your right elbow touches your left knee. Hold this contracted position for a second. Tip: Focus on keeping your abs tight and keeping the movement slow and controlled.
Lower your body back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
After completing one set on the right for the recommended amount of repetitions, switch to your left side. Tip: Focus on really twisting your torso and feeling the contraction when you are in the up position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Secure your Piernas at the end of the Declinado bench and sBajoly lay down on the bench. Elevación your upper body off the bench until your torso is about 35-45 degrees if measured from the Suelo. Put one hand beLateral your head and the other on your tAlto. This will be your starting position. Elevación your upper body sBajoly from the starting position while turning your torso to the left. Continue Crunching up as you exhale until your right elbow touches your left knee. Hold this contracted position for a second. Tip: Focus on keeping your abs tight and keeping the movement sBajo and controlled. Bajoer your body Espalda down sBajoly to the starting position as you inhale. After completing one set on the right for the recommended amount of repetitions, switch to your left Lateral. Tip: Focus on really twisting your torso and feeling the contraction when you are in the up position.

Abdominales.name: Declinado Inverso Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie on your back on a decline bench and hold on to the top of the bench with both hands. Don't let your body slip down from this position.
Hold your legs parallel to the floor using your abs to hold them there while keeping your knees and feet together. Tip: Your legs should be fully extended with a slight bend on the knee. This will be your starting position.
While exhaling, move your legs towards the torso as you roll your pelvis backwards and you raise your hips off the bench. At the end of this movement your knees will be touching your chest.
Hold the contraction for a second and move your legs back to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie on your back on a decline bench and hold on to the top of the bench with both hands. Don't let your body slip down from this position.
Hold your legs parallel to the floor using your abs to hold them there while keeping your knees and feet together. Tip: Your legs should be fully extended with a slight bend on the knee. This will be your starting position.
While exhaling, move your legs towards the torso as you roll your pelvis backwards and you raise your hips off the bench. At the end of this movement your knees will be touching your chest.
Hold the contraction for a second and move your legs back to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie on your Espalda on a Declinado bench and hold on to the top of the bench with both hands. Don't let your body slip down from this position. Hold your Piernas parallel to the Suelo using your abs to hold them there while keeping your knees and feet together. Tip: Your Piernas should be fully extended with a slight bend on the knee. This will be your starting position. While exhaling, move your Piernas towards the torso as you roll your pelvis Espaldawards and you Elevación your Caderas off the bench. At the end of this movement your knees will be touching your Pecho. Hold the contraction for a second and move your Piernas Espalda to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Double Pesa Rusa Windmill
Abdominales.instructions:
Place a kettlebell in front of your front foot and clean and press a kettlebell overhead with your opposite arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.
Keeping the kettlebell locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out kettlebell. Turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the locked out kettlebell.
Bending at the hip to one side, sticking your butt out, slowly lean until you can retrieve the kettlebell from the floor. Keep your eyes on the kettlebell that you hold over your head at all times.
Pause for a second after retrieving the kettlebell from the ground and reverse the motion back to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Place a kettlebell in front of your front foot and clean and press a kettlebell overhead with your opposite arm. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.
Keeping the kettlebell locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out kettlebell. Turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the locked out kettlebell.
Bending at the hip to one side, sticking your butt out, slowly lean until you can retrieve the kettlebell from the floor. Keep your eyes on the kettlebell that you hold over your head at all times.
Pause for a second after retrieving the kettlebell from the ground and reverse the motion back to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Place a Pesa Rusa in Frontal of your Frontal foot and Cargada and Press a Pesa Rusa Sobre la Cabeza with your opposite arm. Cargada the Pesa Rusa to your Hombro by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you pull the Pesa Rusa towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñeca as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. Keeping the Pesa Rusa locked out at all times, push your butt out in the direction of the locked out Pesa Rusa. Turn your feet out at a forty-five degree angle from the arm with the locked out Pesa Rusa. Bending at the Cadera to one Lateral, sticking your butt out, sBajoly lean until you can retrieve the Pesa Rusa from the Suelo. Keep your eyes on the Pesa Rusa that you hold over your head at all times. Pause for a second after retrieving the Pesa Rusa from the ground and Inverso the motion Espalda to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Mancuerna Lateral Bend
Abdominales.instructions:
Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on the left hand (palms facing the torso) as you have the right hand holding your waist. Your feet should be placed at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then change hands.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on the left hand (palms facing the torso) as you have the right hand holding your waist. Your feet should be placed at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then change hands.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Stand up straight while holding a Mancuerna on the left hand (palms facing the torso) as you have the right hand holding your waist. Your feet should be placed at Hombro width. This will be your starting position. While keeping your Espalda straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as possible. Breathe in as you bend to the Lateral. Then hold for a second and come Espalda up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Keep the rest of the body stationary. Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then cColgadoe hands.

Abdominales.name: Codo A Rodilla
Abdominales.instructions:
Acuéstate en el suelo, cruzando la pierna derecha sobre la rodilla izquierda doblada. Coloca las manos detrás de la cabeza, comenzando con los omóplatos en el suelo. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Realice el movimiento flexionando la columna vertebral y girando el torso para llevar el codo izquierdo a la rodilla derecha.
Vuelva a la posición inicial y repita el movimiento durante el número deseado de repeticiones antes de cambiar de lado.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor, crossing your right leg across your bent left knee. Clasp your hands behind your head, beginning with your shoulder blades on the ground. This will be your starting position.
Perform the motion by flexing the spine and rotating your torso to bring the left elbow to the right knee.
Return to the starting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo, crossing your right Pierna across your bent left knee. Clasp your hands behind your head, beginning with your Hombro blades on the ground. This will be your starting position. Perform the motion by flexing the spine and rotating your torso to bring the left elbow to the right knee. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching Laterals.

Abdominales.name: Ejercicio de Crujido de la Pelota
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie on an exercise ball with your lower back curvature pressed against the spherical surface of the ball. Your feet should be bent at the knee and pressed firmly against the floor. The upper torso should be hanging off the top of the ball. The arms should either be kept alongside the body or crossed on top of your chest as these positions avoid neck strains (as opposed to the hands behind the back of the head position).
Lower your torso into a stretch position keeping the neck stationary at all times. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist by contracting the abdominals and curl the shoulders and trunk upward until you feel a nice contraction on your abdominals. The arms should simply slide up the side of your legs if you have them at the side or just stay on top of your chest if you have them crossed. The lower back should always stay in contact with the ball. Exhale as you perform this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie on an exercise ball with your lower back curvature pressed against the spherical surface of the ball. Your feet should be bent at the knee and pressed firmly against the floor. The upper torso should be hanging off the top of the ball. The arms should either be kept alongside the body or crossed on top of your chest as these positions avoid neck strains (as opposed to the hands behind the back of the head position).
Lower your torso into a stretch position keeping the neck stationary at all times. This will be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist by contracting the abdominals and curl the shoulders and trunk upward until you feel a nice contraction on your abdominals. The arms should simply slide up the side of your legs if you have them at the side or just stay on top of your chest if you have them crossed. The lower back should always stay in contact with the ball. Exhale as you perform this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie on an exercise ball with your Bajoer Espalda curvature Pressed against the spherical surface of the ball. Your feet should be bent at the knee and Pressed firmly against the Suelo. The upper torso should be Colgadoing off the top of the ball. The arms should either be kept alongLateral the body or crossed on top of your Pecho as these positions avoid neck strains (as opposed to the hands behind the Espalda of the head position). Bajoer your torso into a stretch position keeping the neck stationary at all times. This will be your starting position. With the Caderas stationary, flex the waist by contracting the Abdominals and Curl the Hombros and trunk upward until you feel a nice contraction on your Abdominals. The arms should simply slide up the Lateral of your Piernas if you have them at the Lateral or just stay on top of your Pecho if you have them crossed. The Bajoer Espalda should always stay in contact with the ball. Exhale as you perform this movement and hold the contraction for a second. As you inhale, go Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Pelota de Ejercicio Pull-in
Abdominales.instructions:
Place an exercise ball nearby and lay on the floor in front of it with your hands on the floor shoulder width apart in a push-up position.
Now place your lower shins on top of an exercise ball. Tip: At this point your legs should be fully extended with the shins on top of the ball and the upper body should be in a push-up type of position being supported by your two extended arms in front of you. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your back completely straight and the upper body stationary, pull your knees in towards your chest as you exhale, allowing the ball to roll forward under your ankles. Squeeze your abs and hold that position for a second.
Now slowly straighten your legs, rolling the ball back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Place an exercise ball nearby and lay on the floor in front of it with your hands on the floor shoulder width apart in a push-up position.
Now place your lower shins on top of an exercise ball. Tip: At this point your legs should be fully extended with the shins on top of the ball and the upper body should be in a push-up type of position being supported by your two extended arms in front of you. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your back completely straight and the upper body stationary, pull your knees in towards your chest as you exhale, allowing the ball to roll forward under your ankles. Squeeze your abs and hold that position for a second.
Now slowly straighten your legs, rolling the ball back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Place an exercise ball nearby and lay on the Suelo in Frontal of it with your hands on the Suelo Hombro width apart in a push-up position. Now place your Bajoer shins on top of an exercise ball. Tip: At this point your Piernas should be fully extended with the shins on top of the ball and the upper body should be in a push-up type of position being supported by your two extended arms in Frontal of you. This will be your starting position. While keeping your Espalda completely straight and the upper body stationary, pull your knees in towards your Pecho as you exhale, alBajoing the ball to roll forward under your ankles. Squeeze your abs and hold that position for a second. Now sBajoly straighten your Piernas, rolling the ball Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Flat Bench Pierna Pull-in
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie on an exercise mat or a flat bench with your legs off the end.
Place your hands either under your glutes with your palms down or by the sides holding on to the bench (or with palms down by the side on an exercise mat). Also extend your legs straight out. This will be your starting position.
Bend your knees and pull your upper thighs into your midsection as you breathe out. Continue this movement until your knees are near your chest. Hold the contracted position for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie on an exercise mat or a flat bench with your legs off the end.
Place your hands either under your glutes with your palms down or by the sides holding on to the bench (or with palms down by the side on an exercise mat). Also extend your legs straight out. This will be your starting position.
Bend your knees and pull your upper thighs into your midsection as you breathe out. Continue this movement until your knees are near your chest. Hold the contracted position for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie on an exercise mat or a flat bench with your Piernas off the end. Place your hands either under your Glúteos with your palms down or by the Laterals holding on to the bench (or with palms down by the Lateral on an exercise mat). Also extend your Piernas straight out. This will be your starting position. Bend your knees and pull your upper tAltos into your midsection as you breathe out. Continue this movement until your knees are near your Pecho. Hold the contracted position for a second. As you breathe in, sBajoly return to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
