Connect a standard handle on a tower, and move the cable to the lowest pulley position.
With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your feet positioned shoulder width apart, squat down and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended.
In one motion, pull the handle up and across your body until your arms are in a fully-extended position above your head.
Keep your back straight and your arms close to your body as you pivot your back foot and straighten your legs to get a full range of motion.
Retract your arms and then your body. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Connect a Estándar handle on a tower, and move the Polea to the Bajoest pulley position. With your Lateral to the Polea, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the Polea. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the Polea. With your feet positioned Hombro width apart, Sentadilla down and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended. In one motion, pull the handle up and across your body until your arms are in a fully-extended position above your head. Keep your Espalda straight and your arms close to your body as you pivot your Espalda foot and straighten your Piernas to get a full range of motion. Retract your arms and then your body. Return to the neutral position in a sBajo and controlled manner. Repeat to failure. Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite Lateral.

Abdominales.name: De Pie Polea Wood Chop
Abdominales.instructions:
Connect a standard handle to a tower, and move the cable to the highest pulley position.
With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your feet positioned shoulder width apart, reach upward with your other hand and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended.
In one motion, pull the handle down and across your body to your front knee while rotating your torso.
Keep your back and arms straight and core tight while you pivot your back foot and bend your knees to get a full range of motion.
Maintain your stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Connect a standard handle to a tower, and move the cable to the highest pulley position.
With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your feet positioned shoulder width apart, reach upward with your other hand and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended.
In one motion, pull the handle down and across your body to your front knee while rotating your torso.
Keep your back and arms straight and core tight while you pivot your back foot and bend your knees to get a full range of motion.
Maintain your stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controlled manner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite side.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Connect a Estándar handle to a tower, and move the Polea to the Altoest pulley position. With your Lateral to the Polea, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be approximately arm's length away from the pulley, with the tension of the weight on the Polea. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the Polea. With your feet positioned Hombro width apart, reach upward with your other hand and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should still be fully extended. In one motion, pull the handle down and across your body to your Frontal knee while rotating your torso. Keep your Espalda and arms straight and core tight while you pivot your Espalda foot and bend your knees to get a full range of motion. Maintain your stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a sBajo and controlled manner. Repeat to failure. Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the opposite Lateral.

Abdominales.name: Estiramiento Lateral de Pie
Abdominales.instructions:
Tome una postura ligeramente más ancha que la distancia de la cadera con las rodillas ligeramente flexionadas.
Coloque la mano derecha sobre la cadera derecha para apoyar la columna vertebral.
Levanta el brazo izquierdo en línea vertical y coloca la mano izquierda detrás de la cabeza. Manténgalo allí mientras inclina el torso hacia la derecha.
Mantenga su peso distribuido uniformemente entre ambas piernas (no se apoye en la cadera izquierda). Cambie de lado.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Take a slightly wider than hip distance stance with your knees slightly bent.
Place your right hand on your right hip to support the spine.
Raise your left arm in a vertical line and place your left hand behind your head. Keep it there as you incline your torso to the right.
Keep your weight evenly distributed between both legs (don't lean into your left hip). Switch sides.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Take a slightly wider than Cadera distance stance with your knees slightly bent. Place your right hand on your right Cadera to support the spine. Elevación your left arm in a vertical line and place your left hand behind your head. Keep it there as you Inclinado your torso to the right. Keep your weight evenly distributed between both Piernas (don't lean into your left Cadera). Switch Laterals.

Abdominales.name: De Pie Rope Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Fije una cuerda a una polea alta y seleccione un peso adecuado.
Párese de espaldas a la torre del cable. Tome la cuerda con ambas manos sobre los hombros, sosteniéndola contra la parte superior del pecho. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Realice el movimiento flexionando la columna vertebral, aplastando el peso lo más que pueda.
Mantenga la contracción máxima por un momento antes de volver a la posición inicial.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Attach a rope to a high pulley and select an appropriate weight.
Stand with your back to the cable tower. Take the rope with both hands over your shoulders, holding it to your upper chest. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by flexing the spine, crunching the weight down as far as you can.
Hold the peak contraction for a moment before returning to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Attach a rope to a Alto pulley and select an appropriate weight. Stand with your Espalda to the Polea tower. Take the rope with both hands over your Hombros, holding it to your upper Pecho. This will be your starting position. Perform the movement by flexing the spine, Crunching the weight down as far as you can. Hold the peak contraction for a moment before returning to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Aspiradora Estomacal
Abdominales.instructions:
To begin, stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart from each other. Place your hands on your hips. This is the starting position.
Now slowly inhale as much air as possible and then start to exhale as much as possible while bringing your stomach in as much as possible and hold this position. Try to visualize your navel touching your backbone.
One isometric contraction is around 20 seconds. During the 20 second hold, try to breathe normally. Then inhale and bring your stomach back to the starting position.
Once you have practiced this exercise, try to perform this exercise for longer than 20 seconds. Tip: You can work your way up to 40-60 seconds.
Repeat for the recommended amount of sets.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
To begin, stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart from each other. Place your hands on your hips. This is the starting position.
Now slowly inhale as much air as possible and then start to exhale as much as possible while bringing your stomach in as much as possible and hold this position. Try to visualize your navel touching your backbone.
One isometric contraction is around 20 seconds. During the 20 second hold, try to breathe normally. Then inhale and bring your stomach back to the starting position.
Once you have practiced this exercise, try to perform this exercise for longer than 20 seconds. Tip: You can work your way up to 40-60 seconds.
Repeat for the recommended amount of sets.
Abdominales.instructions_es: To begin, stand straight with your feet Hombro width apart from each other. Place your hands on your Caderas. This is the starting position. Now sBajoly inhale as much air as possible and then start to exhale as much as possible while bringing your stomach in as much as possible and hold this position. Try to visualize your navel touching your Espaldabone. One isometric contraction is around 20 seconds. During the 20 second hold, try to breathe normally. Then inhale and bring your stomach Espalda to the starting position. Once you have practiced this exercise, try to perform this exercise for longer than 20 seconds. Tip: You can work your way up to 40-60 seconds. Repeat for the recommended amount of sets.

Abdominales.name: Supine One-arm Sobre la Cabeza Thremo
Abdominales.instructions:
Acuéstate en el suelo boca arriba con las rodillas dobladas. Sostenga la pelota con una mano, extendiendo el brazo completamente detrás de su cabeza. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Inicie el movimiento en el hombro, lanzando la pelota directamente hacia adelante mientras se sienta, tratando de alcanzar la distancia máxima.
La pelota se puede lanzar a un compañero o rebotar en una pared.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lay on the ground on your back with your knees bent. Hold the ball with one hand, extending the arm fully behind your head. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement at the shoulder, throwing the ball directly forward of you as you sit up, attempting to go for maximum distance.
The ball can be thrown to a partner or bounced off of a wall.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lay on the ground on your Espalda with your knees bent. Hold the ball with one hand, extending the arm fully behind your head. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement at the Hombro, thRemoing the ball directly forward of you as you sit up, attempting to go for maximum distance. The ball can be thRemon to a partner or bounced off of a wall.

Abdominales.name: Lanzamiento por Encima de la Cabeza
Abdominales.instructions:
Acuéstate en el suelo boca arriba con las rodillas dobladas.
Sostenga la pelota con ambas manos, extendiendo los brazos completamente detrás de su cabeza. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Inicie el movimiento en el hombro, lanzando la pelota directamente hacia adelante mientras se sienta, tratando de alcanzar la distancia máxima.
La pelota se puede lanzar a un compañero o rebotar en una pared.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lay on the ground on your back with your knees bent.
Hold the ball with both hands, extending the arms fully behind your head. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement at the shoulder, throwing the ball directly forward of you as you sit up, attempting to go for maximum distance.
The ball can be thrown to a partner or bounced off of a wall.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lay on the ground on your Espalda with your knees bent. Hold the ball with both hands, extending the arms fully behind your head. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement at the Hombro, thRemoing the ball directly forward of you as you sit up, attempting to go for maximum distance. The ball can be thRemon to a partner or bounced off of a wall.

Abdominales.name: Fallout Suspendido
Abdominales.instructions:
Adjust the straps so the handles are at an appropriate height, below waist level.
Begin standing and grasping the handles. Lean into the straps, moving to an incline push-up position. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, lean further into the suspension straps, bringing your body closer to the ground, allowing your shoulders to extend, raising your arms up and over your head.
Maintain a neutral spine and keep the rest of your body straight, your shoulders being the only joints allowed to move.
Pause during the peak contraction, and then return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Adjust the straps so the handles are at an appropriate height, below waist level.
Begin standing and grasping the handles. Lean into the straps, moving to an incline push-up position. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, lean further into the suspension straps, bringing your body closer to the ground, allowing your shoulders to extend, raising your arms up and over your head.
Maintain a neutral spine and keep the rest of your body straight, your shoulders being the only joints allowed to move.
Pause during the peak contraction, and then return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Adjust the straps so the handles are at an appropriate height, beBajo waist level. Begin De Pie and grasping the handles. Lean into the straps, moving to an Inclinado push-up position. This will be your starting position. Keeping your arms straight, lean further into the suspension straps, bringing your body closer to the ground, alBajoing your Hombros to extend, raising your arms up and over your head. Maintain a neutral spine and keep the rest of your body straight, your Hombros being the only joints alBajoed to move. Pause during the peak contraction, and then return to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Suspended Inverso Crunch
Abdominales.instructions:
Secure a set of suspension straps with the handles hanging about a foot off of the ground. Move yourself into a pushup plank position facing away from the rack.
Place your feet into the handles. You should maintain a straight posture, not allowing the hips to sag. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the knees and hips, drawing the knees to your torso. As you do so, anteriorly tilt your pelvis, allowing your spine to flex.
At the top of the controlled motion, return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Secure a set of suspension straps with the handles hanging about a foot off of the ground. Move yourself into a pushup plank position facing away from the rack.
Place your feet into the handles. You should maintain a straight posture, not allowing the hips to sag. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the knees and hips, drawing the knees to your torso. As you do so, anteriorly tilt your pelvis, allowing your spine to flex.
At the top of the controlled motion, return to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Secure a set of suspension straps with the handles Colgadoing about a foot off of the ground. Move yourself into a pushup Plancha position facing away from the rack. Place your feet into the handles. You should maintain a straight posture, not alBajoing the Caderas to sag. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement by flexing the knees and Caderas, drawing the knees to your torso. As you do so, anteriorly tilt your pelvis, alBajoing your spine to flex. At the top of the controlled motion, return to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Toqueadores de Dedos
Abdominales.instructions:
To begin, lie down on the floor or an exercise mat with your back pressed against the floor. Your arms should be lying across your sides with the palms facing down.
Your legs should be touching each other. Slowly elevate your legs up in the air until they are almost perpendicular to the floor with a slight bend at the knees. Your feet should be parallel to the floor.
Move your arms so that they are fully extended at a 45 degree angle from the floor. This is the starting position.
While keeping your lower back pressed against the floor, slowly lift your torso and use your hands to try and touch your toes. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise.
Slowly begin to lower your torso and arms back down to the starting position while inhaling. Remember to keep your arms straight out pointing towards your toes.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
To begin, lie down on the floor or an exercise mat with your back pressed against the floor. Your arms should be lying across your sides with the palms facing down.
Your legs should be touching each other. Slowly elevate your legs up in the air until they are almost perpendicular to the floor with a slight bend at the knees. Your feet should be parallel to the floor.
Move your arms so that they are fully extended at a 45 degree angle from the floor. This is the starting position.
While keeping your lower back pressed against the floor, slowly lift your torso and use your hands to try and touch your toes. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise.
Slowly begin to lower your torso and arms back down to the starting position while inhaling. Remember to keep your arms straight out pointing towards your toes.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: To begin, lie down on the Suelo or an exercise mat with your Espalda Pressed against the Suelo. Your arms should be Recostado across your Laterals with the palms facing down. Your Piernas should be touching each other. SBajoly elevate your Piernas up in the air until they are almost perpendicular to the Suelo with a slight bend at the knees. Your feet should be parallel to the Suelo. Move your arms so that they are fully extended at a 45 degree angle from the Suelo. This is the starting position. While keeping your Bajoer Espalda Pressed against the Suelo, sBajoly lift your torso and use your hands to try and touch your toes. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise. SBajoly begin to Bajoer your torso and arms Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Remember to keep your arms straight out pointing towards your toes. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Rotación del Torso
Abdominales.instructions:
Párese erguido sosteniendo una pelota de ejercicio con ambas manos. Extiende los brazos para que la pelota quede recta frente a ti. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Gira el torso hacia un lado, manteniendo los ojos en la pelota mientras te mueves. Ahora, gira de nuevo en la dirección opuesta. Repita de 10 a 20 repeticiones.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Stand upright holding an exercise ball with both hands. Extend your arms so the ball is straight out in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Rotate your torso to one side, keeping your eyes on the ball as you move. Now, rotate back to the opposite direction. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Stand Vertical holding an exercise ball with both hands. Extend your arms so the ball is straight out in Frontal of you. This will be your starting position. Rotate your torso to one Lateral, keeping your eyes on the ball as you move. Now, rotate Espalda to the opposite direction. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Crunch con Flexión
Abdominales.instructions:
To begin, lie down on the floor or an exercise mat with your back pressed against the floor. Your arms should be lying across your sides with the palms facing down.
Your legs should be crossed by wrapping one ankle around the other. Slowly elevate your legs up in the air until your thighs are perpendicular to the floor with a slight bend at the knees. Note: Your knees and toes should be parallel to the floor as opposed to the thighs.
Move your arms from the floor and cross them so they are resting on your chest. This is the starting position.
While keeping your lower back pressed against the floor, slowly lift your torso. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise.
Slowly begin to lower your torso back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
To begin, lie down on the floor or an exercise mat with your back pressed against the floor. Your arms should be lying across your sides with the palms facing down.
Your legs should be crossed by wrapping one ankle around the other. Slowly elevate your legs up in the air until your thighs are perpendicular to the floor with a slight bend at the knees. Note: Your knees and toes should be parallel to the floor as opposed to the thighs.
Move your arms from the floor and cross them so they are resting on your chest. This is the starting position.
While keeping your lower back pressed against the floor, slowly lift your torso. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise.
Slowly begin to lower your torso back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: To begin, lie down on the Suelo or an exercise mat with your Espalda Pressed against the Suelo. Your arms should be Recostado across your Laterals with the palms facing down. Your Piernas should be crossed by wrapping one ankle around the other. SBajoly elevate your Piernas up in the air until your tAltos are perpendicular to the Suelo with a slight bend at the knees. Note: Your knees and toes should be parallel to the Suelo as opposed to the tAltos. Move your arms from the Suelo and cross them so they are resting on your Pecho. This is the starting position. While keeping your Bajoer Espalda Pressed against the Suelo, sBajoly lift your torso. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise. SBajoly begin to Bajoer your torso Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Weighted Ball Lateral Bend
Abdominales.instructions:
To begin, lie down on an exercise ball with your left side of the torso (waist, hips and shoulder) pressed against the ball.
Your feet should be on the floor while your legs are crossed and hanging from the ball. Hold a weighted plate with your right hand directly to the right side of your head. Tip: Make sure the smooth side of the plate is resting against your head.
Place your left arm across your torso so that your palm is on your obliques. There should be a right angle between your left forearm and upper arm. This is the starting position.
Raise the side of your torso up by laterally flexing at the waist while exhaling.
Hold the contraction for a second and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch sides and repeat the exercise.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
To begin, lie down on an exercise ball with your left side of the torso (waist, hips and shoulder) pressed against the ball.
Your feet should be on the floor while your legs are crossed and hanging from the ball. Hold a weighted plate with your right hand directly to the right side of your head. Tip: Make sure the smooth side of the plate is resting against your head.
Place your left arm across your torso so that your palm is on your obliques. There should be a right angle between your left forearm and upper arm. This is the starting position.
Raise the side of your torso up by laterally flexing at the waist while exhaling.
Hold the contraction for a second and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch sides and repeat the exercise.
Abdominales.instructions_es: To begin, lie down on an exercise ball with your left Lateral of the torso (waist, Caderas and Hombro) Pressed against the ball. Your feet should be on the Suelo while your Piernas are crossed and Colgadoing from the ball. Hold a weighted Disco with your right hand directly to the right Lateral of your head. Tip: Make sure the smooth Lateral of the Disco is resting against your head. Place your left arm across your torso so that your palm is on your obliques. There should be a right angle between your left foPosteriorm and upper arm. This is the starting position. Elevación the Lateral of your torso up by Laterally flexing at the waist while exhaling. Hold the contraction for a second and sBajoly Bajoer yourself Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Switch Laterals and repeat the exercise.

Abdominales.name: Crujidos Ponderados
Abdominales.instructions:
Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle.
Hold a weight to your chest, or you may hold it extended above your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, exhale and slowly begin to roll your shoulders off the floor. Your shoulders should come up off the floor about 4 inches while your lower back remains on the floor.
At the top of the movement, flex your abdominals and hold for a brief pause.
Then inhale and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle.
Hold a weight to your chest, or you may hold it extended above your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, exhale and slowly begin to roll your shoulders off the floor. Your shoulders should come up off the floor about 4 inches while your lower back remains on the floor.
At the top of the movement, flex your abdominals and hold for a brief pause.
Then inhale and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Lie flat on your Espalda with your feet flat on the ground or resting on a bench with your knees bent at a 90 degree angle. Hold a weight to your Pecho, or you may hold it extended above your torso. This will be your starting position. Now, exhale and sBajoly begin to roll your Hombros off the Suelo. Your Hombros should come up off the Suelo about 4 inches while your Bajoer Espalda remains on the Suelo. At the top of the movement, flex your Abdominals and hold for a brief pause. Then inhale and sBajoly Bajoer yourself Espalda down to the starting position.

Abdominales.name: Weighted Abdominaless - With Bandas
Abdominales.instructions:
Start out by strapping the bands around the base of the decline bench. Place the handles towards the inside of the decline bench so that when lying down, you can reach for both of them.
Position your legs through the decline machine until they are secured. Now reach for the exercise bands with both hands. Use a pronated (palms forward) grip to grasp the handles. Position them near your collar bone and rotate your wrist to a neutral grip (palms facing the torso). Note: Your arms should remain stationary throughout the exercise. This is the starting position.
Move your torso upward until your upper body is perpendicular to the floor while exhaling. Hold the contraction for a second and lower your upper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Start out by strapping the bands around the base of the decline bench. Place the handles towards the inside of the decline bench so that when lying down, you can reach for both of them.
Position your legs through the decline machine until they are secured. Now reach for the exercise bands with both hands. Use a pronated (palms forward) grip to grasp the handles. Position them near your collar bone and rotate your wrist to a neutral grip (palms facing the torso). Note: Your arms should remain stationary throughout the exercise. This is the starting position.
Move your torso upward until your upper body is perpendicular to the floor while exhaling. Hold the contraction for a second and lower your upper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Start out by strapping the Bandas around the base of the Declinado bench. Place the handles towards the inLateral of the Declinado bench so that when Recostado down, you can reach for both of them. Position your Piernas through the Declinado Máquina until they are secured. Now reach for the exercise Bandas with both hands. Use a pronated (palms forward) grip to grasp the handles. Position them near your collar bone and rotate your Muñeca to a Agarre Neutro (palms facing the torso). Note: Your arms should remain stationary throughout the exercise. This is the starting position. Move your torso upward until your upper body is perpendicular to the Suelo while exhaling. Hold the contraction for a second and Bajoer your upper body Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Abdominales.name: Sprints de Viento
Abdominales.instructions:
Cuelgue de una barra de dominadas con un agarre pronado. Los brazos y las piernas deben estar extendidos. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Comienza levantando rápidamente una rodilla lo más alto que puedas. No balancee el cuerpo ni las piernas. 3
Invertir inmediatamente el movimiento, devolviendo esa pierna a la posición inicial. Al mismo tiempo, levante la rodilla opuesta lo más alto posible.
Continúe alternando entre las piernas hasta que el conjunto esté completo.
Abdominales.instructions_en:
Hang from a pull-up bar using a pronated grip. Your arms and legs should be extended. This will be your starting position.
Begin by quickly raising one knee as high as you can. Do not swing your body or your legs. 3
Immediately reverse the motion, returning that leg to the starting position. Simultaneously raise the opposite knee as high as possible.
Continue alternating between legs until the set is complete.
Abdominales.instructions_es: Colgado from a pull-up bar using a pronated grip. Your arms and Piernas should be extended. This will be your starting position. Begin by quickly raising one knee as Alto as you can. Do not swing your body or your Piernas. 3 Immediately Inverso the motion, returning that Pierna to the starting position. Simultaneously Elevación the opposite knee as Alto as possible. Continue Alternando between Piernas until the set is complete.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Martillo Alternativo
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:

The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up with your torso Vertical and a Mancuerna in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso. The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position. While holding the upper arm stationary, Curl the right weight forward while contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your Bíceps is fully contracted and the Mancuernas are at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the Bíceps. Tip: Only the foPosteriorms should move. SBajoly begin to bring the Mancuernas Espalda to starting position as your breathe in. Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition. Continue Alternando in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl con Mancuernas Inclinado Alternativo
Bíceps.instructions:
Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. Tip: Keep the elbows close to the torso.This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. As you do so, rotate the hand so that the palm is facing up. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbell back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length. Tip: Keep the elbows close to the torso.This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. As you do so, rotate the hand so that the palm is facing up. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbell back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.

Bíceps.instructions_es: Sit down on an Banca Inclinada with a Mancuerna in each hand being held at arms length. Tip: Keep the elbows close to the torso.This will be your starting position. While holding the upper arm stationary, Curl the right weight forward while contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out. As you do so, rotate the hand so that the palm is facing up. Continue Alternando in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Barbilla
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at a shoulder-width grip. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and the elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at a shoulder-width grip. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and the elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up with your torso Vertical while holding a Barra at a Hombro-width grip. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and the elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position. While holding the upper arms stationary, Curl the weights forward while contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the foPosteriorms should move. Continue the movement until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the bar is at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the Bíceps hard. SBajoly begin to bring the bar Espalda to starting position as your breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Rizos de Barbilla Recostados Contra Una Inclinación
Bíceps.instructions:
Lie against an incline bench, with your arms holding a barbell and hanging down in a horizontal line. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weight up as high as you can while squeezing the biceps. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Do not swing the arms.
After a second contraction, slowly go back to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you go all of the way down.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.name_en: Barbell Curls Lying Against An Incline
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Lie against an incline bench, with your arms holding a barbell and hanging down in a horizontal line. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weight up as high as you can while squeezing the biceps. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Do not swing the arms.
After a second contraction, slowly go back to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you go all of the way down.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Lie against an Banca Inclinada, with your arms holding a Barra and Colgadoing down in a horizontal line. This will be your starting position. While keeping the upper arms stationary, Curl the weight up as Alto as you can while squeezing the Bíceps. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Only the foPosteriorms should move. Do not swing the arms. After a second contraction, sBajoly go Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you go all of the way down. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Brachialis-smr
Bíceps.instructions:
Acuéstese de lado, con la parte superior del brazo contra el rodillo de espuma. La parte superior del brazo debe estar más o menos alineada con su cuerpo, con la parte exterior del bíceps presionada contra el rodillo de espuma.
Levanta las caderas del suelo, apoyando el peso en el brazo y en los pies. Mantenga pulsado durante 10-30 segundos y, a continuación, cambie de lado.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Lie on your side, with your upper arm against the foam roller. The upper arm should be more or less aligned with your body, with the outside of the bicep pressed against the foam roller.
Raise your hips off of the floor, supporting your weight on your arm and on your feet. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Lie on your Lateral, with your upper arm against the foam roller. The upper arm should be more or less aligned with your body, with the outLateral of the bicep Pressed against the foam roller. Elevación your Caderas off of the Suelo, supporting your weight on your arm and on your feet. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and then switch Laterals.

Bíceps.name: Rizos de Martillo de Cable - Fijación de Cuerda
Bíceps.instructions:
Attach a rope attachment to a low pulley and stand facing the machine about 12 inches away from it.
Grasp the rope with a neutral (palms-in) grip and stand straight up keeping the natural arch of the back and your torso stationary.
Put your elbows in by your side and keep them there stationary during the entire movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move; not your upper arms. This will be your starting position.
Using your biceps, pull your arms up as you exhale until your biceps touch your forearms. Tip: Remember to keep the elbows in and your upper arms stationary.
After a 1 second contraction where you squeeze your biceps, slowly start to bring the weight back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Attach a rope attachment to a low pulley and stand facing the machine about 12 inches away from it.
Grasp the rope with a neutral (palms-in) grip and stand straight up keeping the natural arch of the back and your torso stationary.
Put your elbows in by your side and keep them there stationary during the entire movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move; not your upper arms. This will be your starting position.
Using your biceps, pull your arms up as you exhale until your biceps touch your forearms. Tip: Remember to keep the elbows in and your upper arms stationary.
After a 1 second contraction where you squeeze your biceps, slowly start to bring the weight back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Attach a rope attachment to a Bajo pulley and stand facing the Máquina about 12 inches away from it. Grasp the rope with a neutral (palms-in) grip and stand straight up keeping the natural arch of the Espalda and your torso stationary. Put your elbows in by your Lateral and keep them there stationary during the entire movement. Tip: Only the foPosteriorms should move; not your upper arms. This will be your starting position. Using your Bíceps, pull your arms up as you exhale until your Bíceps touch your foPosteriorms. Tip: Remember to keep the elbows in and your upper arms stationary. After a 1 second contraction where you squeeze your Bíceps, sBajoly start to bring the weight Espalda to the original position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Cable Preacher Curl
Bíceps.instructions:
Place a preacher bench about 2 feet in front of a pulley machine.
Attach a straight bar to the low pulley.
Sit at the preacher bench with your elbow and upper arms firmly on top of the bench pad and have someone hand you the bar from the low pulley.
Grab the bar and fully extend your arms on top of the preacher bench pad. This will be your starting position.
Now start pilling the weight up towards your shoulders and squeeze the biceps hard at the top of the movement. Exhale as you perform this motion. Also, hold for a second at the top.
Now slowly lower the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Place a preacher bench about 2 feet in front of a pulley machine.
Attach a straight bar to the low pulley.
Sit at the preacher bench with your elbow and upper arms firmly on top of the bench pad and have someone hand you the bar from the low pulley.
Grab the bar and fully extend your arms on top of the preacher bench pad. This will be your starting position.
Now start pilling the weight up towards your shoulders and squeeze the biceps hard at the top of the movement. Exhale as you perform this motion. Also, hold for a second at the top.
Now slowly lower the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Place a Predicador bench about 2 feet in Frontal of a pulley Máquina. Attach a straight bar to the Bajo pulley. Sit at the Predicador bench with your elbow and upper arms firmly on top of the bench pad and have someone hand you the bar from the Bajo pulley. Grab the bar and fully extend your arms on top of the Predicador bench pad. This will be your starting position. Now start pilling the weight up towards your Hombros and squeeze the Bíceps hard at the top of the movement. Exhale as you perform this motion. Also, hold for a second at the top. Now sBajoly Bajoer the weight to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl Ez-bar de Agarre Cerrado con Banda
Bíceps.instructions:
Attach a band to each end of the bar. Take the bar, placing a foot on the middle of the band. Stand upright with a narrow, supinated grip on the EZ bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the upper arms in place, flex the elbows to execute the curl. Exhale as the weight is lifted.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Attach a band to each end of the bar. Take the bar, placing a foot on the middle of the band. Stand upright with a narrow, supinated grip on the EZ bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the upper arms in place, flex the elbows to execute the curl. Exhale as the weight is lifted.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Attach a Banda to each end of the bar. Take the bar, placing a foot on the middle of the Banda. Stand Vertical with a narRemo, supinated grip on the EZ bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position. While keeping the upper arms in place, flex the elbows to execute the Curl. Exhale as the weight is lifted. Continue the movement until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the bar is at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the Bíceps hard. SBajoly begin to bring the bar Espalda to starting position as your breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Barra Ez de Agarre Cerrado
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up with your torso upright while holding an E-Z Curl Bar at the closer inner handle. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand up with your torso upright while holding an E-Z Curl Bar at the closer inner handle. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up with your torso Vertical while holding an E-Z Curl Bar at the closer inner handle. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This will be your starting position. While holding the upper arms stationary, Curl the weights forward while contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the foPosteriorms should move. Continue the movement until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the bar is at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeeze the Bíceps hard. SBajoly begin to bring the bar Espalda to starting position as your breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Barbilla de Pie de Agarre Apretado
Bíceps.instructions:
Hold a barbell with both hands, palms up and a few inches apart.
Stand with your torso straight and your head up. Your feet should be about shoulder width and your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position. Tip: You will keep your upper arms and elbows stationary throughout the movement.
Curl the bar up in a semicircular motion until the forearms touch your biceps. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and contract your biceps hard for a second at the top. Tip: Avoid bending the back or using swinging motions as you lift the weight. Only the forearms should move.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Hold a barbell with both hands, palms up and a few inches apart.
Stand with your torso straight and your head up. Your feet should be about shoulder width and your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position. Tip: You will keep your upper arms and elbows stationary throughout the movement.
Curl the bar up in a semicircular motion until the forearms touch your biceps. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and contract your biceps hard for a second at the top. Tip: Avoid bending the back or using swinging motions as you lift the weight. Only the forearms should move.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Hold a Barra with both hands, palms up and a few inches apart. Stand with your torso straight and your head up. Your feet should be about Hombro width and your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position. Tip: You will keep your upper arms and elbows stationary throughout the movement. Curl the bar up in a semicircular motion until the foPosteriorms touch your Bíceps. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and contract your Bíceps hard for a second at the top. Tip: Avoid bending the Espalda or using swinging motions as you lift the weight. Only the foPosteriorms should move. SBajoly go Espalda down to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Rizos de Concentración
Bíceps.instructions:
Sit down on a flat bench with one dumbbell in front of you between your legs. Your legs should be spread with your knees bent and feet on the floor.
Use your right arm to pick the dumbbell up. Place the back of your right upper arm on the top of your inner right thigh. Rotate the palm of your hand until it is facing forward away from your thigh. Tip: Your arm should be extended and the dumbbell should be above the floor. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Tip: At the top of the movement make sure that the little finger of your arm is higher than your thumb. This guarantees a good contraction. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in. Caution: Avoid swinging motions at any time.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Then repeat the movement with the left arm.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Sit down on a flat bench with one dumbbell in front of you between your legs. Your legs should be spread with your knees bent and feet on the floor.
Use your right arm to pick the dumbbell up. Place the back of your right upper arm on the top of your inner right thigh. Rotate the palm of your hand until it is facing forward away from your thigh. Tip: Your arm should be extended and the dumbbell should be above the floor. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Tip: At the top of the movement make sure that the little finger of your arm is higher than your thumb. This guarantees a good contraction. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in. Caution: Avoid swinging motions at any time.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Then repeat the movement with the left arm.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Sit down on a flat bench with one Mancuerna in Frontal of you between your Piernas. Your Piernas should be spread with your knees bent and feet on the Suelo. Use your right arm to pick the Mancuerna up. Place the Espalda of your right upper arm on the top of your inner right tAlto. Rotate the palm of your hand until it is facing forward away from your tAlto. Tip: Your arm should be extended and the Mancuerna should be above the Suelo. This will be your starting position. While holding the upper arm stationary, Curl the weights forward while contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out. Only the foPosteriorms should move. Continue the movement until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the Mancuernas are at Hombro level. Tip: At the top of the movement make sure that the little finger of your arm is Altoer than your thumb. This guarantees a good contraction. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the Bíceps. SBajoly begin to bring the Mancuernas Espalda to starting position as your breathe in. Caution: Avoid swinging motions at any time. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Then repeat the movement with the left arm.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Martillo de Cuerpo Cruzado
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand. Your hands should be down at your side with your palms facing in.
While keeping your palms facing in and without twisting your arm, curl the dumbbell of the right arm up towards your left shoulder as you exhale. Touch the top of the dumbbell to your shoulder and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbell along the same path as you inhale and then repeat the same movement for the left arm.
Continue alternating in this fashion until the recommended amount of repetitions is performed for each arm.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand. Your hands should be down at your side with your palms facing in.
While keeping your palms facing in and without twisting your arm, curl the dumbbell of the right arm up towards your left shoulder as you exhale. Touch the top of the dumbbell to your shoulder and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbell along the same path as you inhale and then repeat the same movement for the left arm.
Continue alternating in this fashion until the recommended amount of repetitions is performed for each arm.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up straight with a Mancuerna in each hand. Your hands should be down at your Lateral with your palms facing in. While keeping your palms facing in and without twisting your arm, Curl the Mancuerna of the right arm up towards your left Hombro as you exhale. Touch the top of the Mancuerna to your Hombro and hold the contraction for a second. SBajoly Bajoer the Mancuerna along the same path as you inhale and then repeat the same movement for the left arm. Continue Alternando in this fashion until the recommended amount of repetitions is performed for each arm.

Bíceps.name: Arrastre Curl
Bíceps.instructions:
Grab a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing forward) and get your elbows close to your torso and back. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl the bar up while keeping the elbows to the back as you "Drag" the bar up by keeping it in contact with your torso. Tip: As you can see, you will not be keeping the elbows pinned to your sides, but instead you will be bringing them back. Also, do not lift your shoulders.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you keep the bar in contact with the torso at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Grab a barbell with a supinated grip (palms facing forward) and get your elbows close to your torso and back. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl the bar up while keeping the elbows to the back as you "Drag" the bar up by keeping it in contact with your torso. Tip: As you can see, you will not be keeping the elbows pinned to your sides, but instead you will be bringing them back. Also, do not lift your shoulders.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you keep the bar in contact with the torso at all times.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Grab a Barra with a supinated grip (palms facing forward) and get your elbows close to your torso and Espalda. This will be your starting position. As you exhale, Curl the bar up while keeping the elbows to the Espalda as you "Arrastre" the bar up by keeping it in contact with your torso. Tip: As you can see, you will not be keeping the elbows pinned to your Laterals, but instead you will be bringing them Espalda. Also, do not lift your Hombros. SBajoly go Espalda to the starting position as you keep the bar in contact with the torso at all times. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Bíceps Alternativo con Mancuernas
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand (torso upright) with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso and the palms of your hand should be facing your thighs.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight as you rotate the palm of the hands until they are facing forward. At this point continue contracting the biceps as you breathe out until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbell back to the starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Remember to twist the palms back to the starting position (facing your thighs) as you come down.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand (torso upright) with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso and the palms of your hand should be facing your thighs.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight as you rotate the palm of the hands until they are facing forward. At this point continue contracting the biceps as you breathe out until your biceps is fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbell back to the starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Remember to twist the palms back to the starting position (facing your thighs) as you come down.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand (torso Vertical) with a Mancuerna in each hand held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso and the palms of your hand should be facing your tAltos. While holding the upper arm stationary, Curl the right weight as you rotate the palm of the hands until they are facing forward. At this point continue contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out until your Bíceps is fully contracted and the Mancuernas are at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the Bíceps. Tip: Only the foPosteriorms should move. SBajoly begin to bring the Mancuerna Espalda to the starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Remember to twist the palms Espalda to the starting position (facing your tAltos) as you come down. Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition. Continue Alternando in this manner for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Bíceps con Mancuernas
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up straight with a Mancuerna in each hand at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position. Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, exhale and Curl the weights while contracting your Bíceps. Continue to Elevación the weights until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the Mancuernas are at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your Bíceps. Then, inhale and sBajoly begin to Bajoer the Mancuernas Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl Inclinado con Mancuernas
Bíceps.instructions:
Grab a dumbbell on each hand and lie face down on an incline bench with your shoulders near top of the incline. Your knees can rest on the seat or your legs can be straddled to the sides (my preferred way).
Let your arms extend and hang naturally in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the floor.
Now keep your elbows in by your side and face the palms forward. This will be your starting position.
Raise the dumbbells by contracting the biceps until your arms are fully flexed. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and ensure that only the forearms move. The upper arms should remain stationary at all times.
Lower the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Grab a dumbbell on each hand and lie face down on an incline bench with your shoulders near top of the incline. Your knees can rest on the seat or your legs can be straddled to the sides (my preferred way).
Let your arms extend and hang naturally in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the floor.
Now keep your elbows in by your side and face the palms forward. This will be your starting position.
Raise the dumbbells by contracting the biceps until your arms are fully flexed. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and ensure that only the forearms move. The upper arms should remain stationary at all times.
Lower the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Grab a Mancuerna on each hand and lie face down on an Banca Inclinada with your Hombros near top of the Inclinado. Your knees can rest on the seat or your Piernas can be straddled to the Laterals (my preferred way). Let your arms extend and Colgado naturally in Frontal of you so that they are perpendicular to the Suelo. Now keep your elbows in by your Lateral and face the palms forward. This will be your starting position. Elevación the Mancuernas by contracting the Bíceps until your arms are fully flexed. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and ensure that only the foPosteriorms move. The upper arms should remain stationary at all times. Bajoer the Mancuernas until your arms are fully extended. Repeat for the recommended amount of times.

Bíceps.name: Curl con Barra Ez
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle. The palms of your hands should be facing forward and slightly tilted inward due to the shape of the bar. Keep your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps. Focus on only moving your forearms.
Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the top contracted position for a moment and squeeze the biceps.
Then inhale and slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle. The palms of your hands should be facing forward and slightly tilted inward due to the shape of the bar. Keep your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps. Focus on only moving your forearms.
Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the top contracted position for a moment and squeeze the biceps.
Then inhale and slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up straight while holding an EZ Curl bar at the wide outer handle. The palms of your hands should be facing forward and slightly tilted inward due to the shape of the bar. Keep your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position. Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and Curl the weights forward while contracting the Bíceps. Focus on only moving your foPosteriorms. Continue to Elevación the weight until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the bar is at Hombro level. Hold the top contracted position for a moment and squeeze the Bíceps. Then inhale and sBajoly Bajoer the bar Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Flexor Inclinado Curls con Mancuernas
Bíceps.instructions:
Hold the dumbbell towards the side farther from you so that you have more weight on the side closest to you. (This can be done for a good effect on all bicep dumbbell exercises). Now do a normal incline dumbbell curl, but keep your wrists as far back as possible so as to neutralize any stress that is placed on them.
Sit on an incline bench that is angled at 45-degrees while holding a dumbbell on each hand.
Let your arms hang down on your sides, with the elbows in, and turn the palms of your hands forward with the thumbs pointing away from the body. Tip: You will keep this hand position throughout the movement as there should not be any twisting of the hands as they come up. This will be your starting position.
Curl up the two dumbbells at the same time until your biceps are fully contracted and exhale. Tip: Do not swing the arms or use momentum. Keep a controlled motion at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second at the top.
As you inhale, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Hold the dumbbell towards the side farther from you so that you have more weight on the side closest to you. (This can be done for a good effect on all bicep dumbbell exercises). Now do a normal incline dumbbell curl, but keep your wrists as far back as possible so as to neutralize any stress that is placed on them.
Sit on an incline bench that is angled at 45-degrees while holding a dumbbell on each hand.
Let your arms hang down on your sides, with the elbows in, and turn the palms of your hands forward with the thumbs pointing away from the body. Tip: You will keep this hand position throughout the movement as there should not be any twisting of the hands as they come up. This will be your starting position.
Curl up the two dumbbells at the same time until your biceps are fully contracted and exhale. Tip: Do not swing the arms or use momentum. Keep a controlled motion at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second at the top.
As you inhale, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Hold the Mancuerna towards the Lateral farther from you so that you have more weight on the Lateral closest to you. (This can be done for a good effect on all bicep Mancuerna exercises). Now do a normal Inclinado Mancuerna Curl, but keep your Muñecas as far Espalda as possible so as to neutralize any stress that is placed on them. Sit on an Banca Inclinada that is angled at 45-degrees while holding a Mancuerna on each hand. Let your arms Colgado down on your Laterals, with the elbows in, and turn the palms of your hands forward with the thumbs pointing away from the body. Tip: You will keep this hand position throughout the movement as there should not be any twisting of the hands as they come up. This will be your starting position. Curl up the two Mancuernas at the same time until your Bíceps are fully contracted and exhale. Tip: Do not swing the arms or use momentum. Keep a controlled motion at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second at the top. As you inhale, sBajoly go Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Rizos de Martillo
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, while holding your upper arm stationary, exhale and curl the weight forward while contracting the biceps. Continue to raise the weight until the biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Focus on keeping the elbow stationary and only moving your forearm.
After the brief pause, inhale and slowly begin the lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position.
Now, while holding your upper arm stationary, exhale and curl the weight forward while contracting the biceps. Continue to raise the weight until the biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze the biceps. Tip: Focus on keeping the elbow stationary and only moving your forearm.
After the brief pause, inhale and slowly begin the lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand up with your torso Vertical and a Mancuerna on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso. The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This will be your starting position. Now, while holding your upper arm stationary, exhale and Curl the weight forward while contracting the Bíceps. Continue to Elevación the weight until the Bíceps are fully contracted and the Mancuerna is at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze the Bíceps. Tip: Focus on keeping the elbow stationary and only moving your foPosteriorm. After the brief pause, inhale and sBajoly begin the Bajoer the Mancuernas Espalda down to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Rizos de Cable Altos
Bíceps.instructions:
Stand between a couple of high pulleys and grab a handle in each arm. Position your upper arms in a way that they are parallel to the floor with the palms of your hands facing you. This will be your starting position.
Curl the handles towards you until they are next to your ears. Make sure that as you do so you flex your biceps and exhale. The upper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Hold for a second in the contracted position as you squeeze the biceps.
Slowly bring back the arms to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:

Bíceps.instructions_es: Stand between a couple of Alto pulleys and grab a handle in each arm. Curl the handles towards you until they are next to your ears. Make sure that as you do so you flex your Bíceps and exhale. The upper arms should remain stationary and only the foPosteriorms should move. Hold for a second in the contracted position as you squeeze the Bíceps. SBajoly bring Espalda the arms to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl Inclinado con Mancuernas
Bíceps.instructions:
Sit back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position.
While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.

Bíceps.instructions_es: Sit Espalda on an Banca Inclinada with a Mancuerna in each hand held at arms length. Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This will be your starting position. While holding the upper arm stationary, Curl the weights forward while contracting the Bíceps as you breathe out. Only the foPosteriorms should move. Continue the movement until your Bíceps are fully contracted and the Mancuernas are at Hombro level. Hold the contracted position for a second. SBajoly begin to bring the Mancuernas Espalda to starting position as your breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Bíceps.name: Curl Martillo Inclinado
Bíceps.instructions:
Siéntate en un banco inclinado con una mancuerna en cada mano. Debes presionarlo firmemente contra su espalda con los pies juntos. Deja que las mancuernas cuelguen rectas a tu lado, sujetándolas con un agarre neutro. Esta será tu posición inicial.
Inicie el movimiento flexionando el codo, tratando de mantener la parte superior del brazo inmóvil.
Continúe hasta la parte superior del movimiento y haga una pausa, luego regrese lentamente a la posición inicial.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Seat yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. You should pressed firmly against he back with your feet together. Allow the dumbbells to hang straight down at your side, holding them with a neutral grip. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing at the elbow, attempting to keep the upper arm stationary.
Continue to the top of the movement and pause, then slowly return to the start position.
Bíceps.instructions_es: Seat yourself on an Banca Inclinada with a Mancuerna in each hand. You should Pressed firmly against he Espalda with your feet together. AlBajo the Mancuernas to Colgado straight down at your Lateral, holding them with a Agarre Neutro. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement by flexing at the elbow, attempting to keep the upper arm stationary. Continue to the top of the movement and pause, then sBajoly return to the start position.

Bíceps.name: Curl de Bíceps Interno Inclinado
Bíceps.instructions:
Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie back on an incline bench.
The dumbbells should be at arm's length hanging at your sides and your palms should be facing out. This will be your starting position.
Now as you exhale curl the weight outward and up while keeping your forearms in line with your side deltoids. Continue the curl until the dumbbells are at shoulder height and to the sides of your deltoids. Tip: The end of the movement should look similar to a double biceps pose.
After a second contraction at the top of the movement, start to inhale and slowly lower the weights back to the starting position using the same path used to bring them up.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Bíceps.instructions_en:
Hold a dumbbell in each hand and lie back on an incline bench.
The dumbbells should be at arm's length hanging at your sides and your palms should be facing out. This will be your starting position.
Now as you exhale curl the weight outward and up while keeping your forearms in line with your side deltoids. Continue the curl until the dumbbells are at shoulder height and to the sides of your deltoids. Tip: The end of the movement should look similar to a double biceps pose.
