Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Sit on the Máquina and place your toes on the Bajoer portion of the platform provided with the heels extending off. Choose the toe positioning of your choice (forward, in, or out) as per the beginning of this chapter. Place your Bajoer tAltos under the lever pad, which will need to be adjusted according to the height of your tAltos. Now place your hands on top of the lever pad in order to prevent it from slipping forward. Lift the lever slightly by pushing your heels up and release the safety bar. This will be your starting position. SBajoly Bajoer your heels by bending at the ankles until the calves are fully stretched. Inhale as you perform this movement. Elevación the heels by extending the ankles as Alto as possible as you contract the calves and breathe out. Hold the top contraction for a second. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Gemelos.name: Seated Calf Stretch
Gemelos.instructions:
Sit up straight on an exercise mat.
Bend one knee and put that foot on the floor to stabilize the torso.
Straighten your other leg and flex your ankle.
Using a band, towel, or your hand if you can reach, pull the toes toward you. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Sit up straight on an exercise mat.
Bend one knee and put that foot on the floor to stabilize the torso.
Straighten your other leg and flex your ankle.
Using a band, towel, or your hand if you can reach, pull the toes toward you. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Sit up straight on an exercise mat. Bend one knee and put that foot on the Suelo to stabilize the torso. Straighten your other Pierna and flex your ankle. Using a Banda, towel, or your hand if you can reach, pull the toes toward you. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch Laterals.

Gemelos.name: Elevación de Gemelos en Step
Gemelos.instructions:
Place a block or weight plate below the bar on the Smith machine. Set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step onto the plates with the balls of your feet and place the bar on the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with both hands facing forward. Rotate the bar to unrack it. This will be your starting position.
Raise your heels as high as possible by pushing off of the balls of your feet, flexing your calf at the top of the contraction. Your knees should remain extended. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Return slowly to the starting position as you breathe in while lowering your heels.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Place a block or weight plate below the bar on the Smith machine. Set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step onto the plates with the balls of your feet and place the bar on the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with both hands facing forward. Rotate the bar to unrack it. This will be your starting position.
Raise your heels as high as possible by pushing off of the balls of your feet, flexing your calf at the top of the contraction. Your knees should remain extended. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Return slowly to the starting position as you breathe in while lowering your heels.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Place a Bloque or weight Disco beBajo the bar on the MultiPower. Set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step onto the Discos with the balls of your feet and place the bar on the Espalda of your Hombros. Take the bar with both hands facing forward. Rotate the bar to unrack it. This will be your starting position. Elevación your heels as Alto as possible by pushing off of the balls of your feet, flexing your Gemelo at the top of the contraction. Your knees should remain extended. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go Espalda down. Return sBajoly to the starting position as you breathe in while Bajoering your heels. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Gemelos.name: Multipower Inverso Gemelo Elevacións
Gemelos.instructions:
Adjust the barbell on the smith machine to fit your height and align a raised platform right under the bar.
Stand on the platform with the heels of your feet secured on top of it with the balls of your feet extending off it. Position your toes facing forward with a shoulder width stance.
Now, place your shoulders under the barbell while maintaining the foot positioning described and push the barbell up by extending your hips and knees until your torso is standing erect. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position. Tip: The barbell on your back is only for balance purposes.
Raise the balls of your feet as you breathe out by extending your toes as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering the balls of your feet and toes.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Adjust the barbell on the smith machine to fit your height and align a raised platform right under the bar.
Stand on the platform with the heels of your feet secured on top of it with the balls of your feet extending off it. Position your toes facing forward with a shoulder width stance.
Now, place your shoulders under the barbell while maintaining the foot positioning described and push the barbell up by extending your hips and knees until your torso is standing erect. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position. Tip: The barbell on your back is only for balance purposes.

Slowly go back down to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering the balls of your feet and toes.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Adjust the Barra on the MultiPower to fit your height and align a Elevaciónd platform right under the bar. Stand on the platform with the heels of your feet secured on top of it with the balls of your feet extending off it. Position your toes facing forward with a Hombro width stance. Now, place your Hombros under the Barra while maintaining the foot positioning described and push the Barra up by extending your Caderas and knees until your torso is De Pie erect. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position. Tip: The Barra on your Espalda is only for balance purposes. Elevación the balls of your feet as you breathe out by extending your toes as Alto as possible and flexing your Gemelo. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go Espalda down. SBajoly go Espalda down to the starting position as you breathe in by Bajoering the balls of your feet and toes. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Gemelos.name: Gemelos de Pié Guiado
Gemelos.instructions:
This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the bar on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck).
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.
Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times as looking down will get you off balance and also maintain a straight back. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This will be your starting position. Tip: For better range of motion you may also place the ball of your feet on a wooden block but be careful as this option requires more balance and a sturdy block.
Raise your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go Espalda down. Gemelos.name: De Pie Gemelo Elevacións
Gemelos.instructions:
Adjust the padded lever of the calf raise machine to fit your height.
Place your shoulders under the pads provided and position your toes facing forward (or using any of the two other positions described at the beginning of the chapter). The balls of your feet should be secured on top of the calf block with the heels extending off it. Push the lever up by extending your hips and knees until your torso is standing erect. The knees should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. Toes should be facing forward, outwards or inwards as described at the beginning of the chapter. This will be your starting position.
Raise your heels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as possible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the knee is kept stationary at all times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Adjust the padded lever of the calf raise machine to fit your height.
Place your shoulders under the pads provided and position your toes facing forward (or using any of the two other positions described at the beginning of the chapter). The balls of your feet should be secured on top of the calf block with the heels extending off it. Push the lever up by extending your hips and knees until your torso is standing erect. Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Place your Hombros under the pads provided and position your toes facing forward (or using any of the two other positions described at the beginning of the chapter). The balls of your feet should be secured on top of the Gemelo Bloque with the heels extending off it. Push the lever up by extending your Caderas and knees until your torso is De Pie erect. Go Espalda sBajoly to the starting position as you breathe in by Bajoering your heels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Gemelos.name: De Pie Mancuerna Gemelo Elevación
Gemelos.instructions:
Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. Place the ball of the foot on a sturdy and stable wooden board (that is around 2-3 inches tall) while your heels extend off and touch the floor. This will be your starting position.
With the toes pointing either straight (to hit all parts equally), inwards (for emphasis on the outer head) or outwards (for emphasis on the inner head), raise the heels off the floor as you exhale by contracting the calves. Hold the top contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position by slowly lowering the heels.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. Place the ball of the foot on a sturdy and stable wooden board (that is around 2-3 inches tall) while your heels extend off and touch the floor. This will be your starting position.
With the toes pointing either straight (to hit all parts equally), inwards (for emphasis on the outer head) or outwards (for emphasis on the inner head), raise the heels off the floor as you exhale by contracting the calves. Hold the top contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position by slowly lowering the heels.
Repeat for the recommended amount of times.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Stand with your torso Vertical holding two Mancuernas in your hands by your Laterals. Place the ball of the foot on a sturdy and stable wooden board (that is around 2-3 inches tall) while your heels extend off and touch the Suelo. This will be your starting position. With the toes pointing either straight (to hit all parts equally), inwards (for emphasis on the outer head) or outwards (for emphasis on the inner head), Elevación the heels off the Suelo as you exhale by contracting the calves. Hold the top contraction for a second. As you inhale, go Espalda to the starting position by sBajoly Bajoering the heels. Repeat for the recommended amount of times.

Gemelos.name: Standing Gastrocnemius Calf Stretch
Gemelos.instructions:
Place your right heel on a step with your knee extended and lean forward to grab your right toe with your right hand. Your left knee should be slightly bent and your back should be straight.
Support your weight on your left leg and place your left hand on your left thigh.
Pull your right toes toward your knee until you feel a stretch in your calf.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Place your right heel on a step with your knee extended and lean forward to grab your right toe with your right hand. Your left knee should be slightly bent and your back should be straight.
Support your weight on your left leg and place your left hand on your left thigh.
Pull your right toes toward your knee until you feel a stretch in your calf.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Place your right heel on a step with your knee extended and lean forward to grab your right toe with your right hand. Your left knee should be slightly bent and your Espalda should be straight. Support your weight on your left Pierna and place your left hand on your left tAlto. Pull your right toes toward your knee until you feel a stretch in your Gemelo.

Gemelos.name: Standing Soleus And Achilles Stretch
Gemelos.instructions:
Stand with your feet hip-distance apart, one foot slightly in front of the other.
Bend both knees, keeping your back heel on the floor. Switch sides.
Gemelos.instructions_en:
Stand with your feet hip-distance apart, one foot slightly in front of the other.
Bend both knees, keeping your back heel on the floor. Switch sides.
Gemelos.instructions_es: Stand with your feet Cadera-distance apart, one foot slightly in Frontal of the other. Bend both knees, keeping your Espalda heel on the Suelo. Switch Laterals.

Pecho.name: Press de Suelo
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor with two kettlebells next to your shoulders.
Position one in place on your chest and then the other, gripping the kettlebells on the handle with the palms facing forward.
Extend both arms, so that the kettlebells are being held above your chest. Lower one kettlebell, bringing it to your chest and turn the wrist in the direction of the locked out kettlebell.
Raise the kettlebell and repeat on the opposite side.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor with two kettlebells next to your shoulders.
Position one in place on your chest and then the other, gripping the kettlebells on the handle with the palms facing forward.
Extend both arms, so that the kettlebells are being held above your chest. Lower one kettlebell, bringing it to your chest and turn the wrist in the direction of the locked out kettlebell.
Raise the kettlebell and repeat on the opposite side.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo with two Pesa Rusas next to your Hombros. Position one in place on your Pecho and then the other, gripping the Pesa Rusas on the handle with the palms facing forward. Extend both arms, so that the Pesa Rusas are being held above your Pecho. Bajoer one Pesa Rusa, bringing it to your Pecho and turn the Muñeca in the direction of the locked out Pesa Rusa. Elevación the Pesa Rusa and repeat on the opposite Lateral.

Pecho.name: Around The Worlds
Pecho.instructions:
Lay down on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with the palms of the hands facing towards the ceiling. Tip: Your arms should be parallel to the floor and next to your thighs. To avoid injury, make sure that you keep your elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Now move the dumbbells by creating a semi-circle as you displace them from the initial position to over the head. All of the movement should happen with the arms parallel to the floor at all times. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Reverse the movement to return the weight to the starting position as you exhale.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lay down on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with the palms of the hands facing towards the ceiling. Tip: Your arms should be parallel to the floor and next to your thighs. To avoid injury, make sure that you keep your elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Now move the dumbbells by creating a semi-circle as you displace them from the initial position to over the head. All of the movement should happen with the arms parallel to the floor at all times. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Reverse the movement to return the weight to the starting position as you exhale.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lay down on a flat bench holding a Mancuerna in each hand with the palms of the hands facing towards the ceiling. Tip: Your arms should be parallel to the Suelo and next to your tAltos. To avoid injury, make sure that you keep your elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position. Now move the Mancuernas by creating a semi-circle as you displace them from the initial position to over the head. All of the movement should happen with the arms parallel to the Suelo at all times. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Inverso the movement to return the weight to the starting position as you exhale.

Pecho.name: Barbell Bench Press - Medium Grip
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
From the starting position, breathe in and begin coming down slowly until the bar touches your middle chest.
After a brief pause, push the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out. Focus on pushing the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position at the top of the motion, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: Ideally, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
From the starting position, breathe in and begin coming down slowly until the bar touches your middle chest.
After a brief pause, push the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out. Focus on pushing the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position at the top of the motion, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: Ideally, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie Espalda on a flat bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the foPosteriorms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position. From the starting position, breathe in and begin coming down sBajoly until the bar touches your middle Pecho. After a brief pause, push the bar Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out. Focus on pushing the bar using your Pecho Muslos. Lock your arms and squeeze your Pecho in the contracted position at the top of the motion, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: Ideally, Bajoering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: Barbell Guillotine Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, bring the bar down slowly until it is about 1 inch from your neck.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, bring the bar down slowly until it is about 1 inch from your neck.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_es: Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the foPosteriorms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This will be your starting position. As you breathe in, bring the bar down sBajoly until it is about 1 inch from your neck. After a second pause, bring the bar Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your Pecho Muslos. Pecho.name: Barbell Incline Bench Press - Medium Grip
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on an incline bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on you upper chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: it should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.name_en: Barbell Incline Bench Press - Medium Grip
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie back on an incline bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on you upper chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: it should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie Espalda on an Banca Inclinada. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the foPosteriorms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position. As you breathe in, come down sBajoly until you feel the bar on you upper Pecho. After a second pause, bring the bar Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your Pecho Muslos. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your Pecho, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: it should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: Behind Head Chest Stretch
Pecho.instructions:
Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you.
Place your hands behind your hand, and push your elbows back as far as you can. Your partner should hold your elbows. This will be your starting position.
Gently attempt to pull your elbows forward with your hands still behind your head for 10 or more seconds. Your partner should prevent your elbows from moving.
Now, relax your muscles and have your partner gently pull the elbows back as far as it comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you.
Place your hands behind your hand, and push your elbows back as far as you can. Your partner should hold your elbows. This will be your starting position.
Gently attempt to pull your elbows forward with your hands still behind your head for 10 or more seconds. Your partner should prevent your elbows from moving.
Now, relax your muscles and have your partner gently pull the elbows back as far as it comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.
Pecho.instructions_es: Sit Vertical on the Suelo with your partner behind you. Place your hands behind your hand, and push your elbows Espalda as far as you can. Your partner should hold your elbows. This will be your starting position. Gently attempt to pull your elbows forward with your hands still behind your head for 10 or more seconds. Your partner should prevent your elbows from moving. Now, relax your Muslos and have your partner gently pull the elbows Espalda as far as it comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.

Pecho.name: Bench Press - With Bands
Pecho.instructions:
Using a flat bench secure a band under the leg of the bench that is nearest to your head.
Once the band is secure, grab it by both handles and lie down on the bench.
Extend your arms so that you are holding the band handles in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Bring down the handles slowly until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle. Keep full control at all times.
As you breathe out, bring the handles up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Using a flat bench secure a band under the leg of the bench that is nearest to your head.
Once the band is secure, grab it by both handles and lie down on the bench.
Extend your arms so that you are holding the band handles in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Bring down the handles slowly until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle. Keep full control at all times.
As you breathe out, bring the handles up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
Pecho.instructions_es: Using a flat bench secure a Banda under the Pierna of the bench that is nearest to your head. Once the Banda is secure, grab it by both handles and lie down on the bench. Extend your arms so that you are holding the Banda handles in Frontal of you at Hombro width. Once at Hombro width, rotate your Muñecas forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position. Bring down the handles sBajoly until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle. Keep full control at all times. As you breathe out, bring the handles up using your pectoral Muslos. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your Pecho, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

Pecho.name: Bent-arm Mancuerna Pullover
Pecho.instructions:
Place a dumbbell standing up on a flat bench.
Ensuring that the dumbbell stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with feet firmly on the floor. The head will be off the bench as well.
Grasp the dumbbell with both hands and hold it straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. Both palms should be pressing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbbell. This will be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the dumbbell used for this exercise is secure. Using a dumbbell with loose plates can result in the dumbbell falling apart and falling on your face.
While keeping your arms locked in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the dumbbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Place a dumbbell standing up on a flat bench.
Ensuring that the dumbbell stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with feet firmly on the floor. The head will be off the bench as well.
Grasp the dumbbell with both hands and hold it straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. Both palms should be pressing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbbell. This will be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the dumbbell used for this exercise is secure. Using a dumbbell with loose plates can result in the dumbbell falling apart and falling on your face.
While keeping your arms locked in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the dumbbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Place a Mancuerna De Pie up on a flat bench. Ensuring that the Mancuerna stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your Hombros Recostado on the surface. Caderas should be beBajo the bench and Piernas bent with feet firmly on the Suelo. The head will be off the bench as well. Grasp the Mancuerna with both hands and hold it straight over your Pecho with a bend in your arms. Both palms should be Pressing against the underLateral one of the Laterals of the Mancuerna. This will be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the Mancuerna used for this exercise is secure. Using a Mancuerna with loose Discos can result in the Mancuerna falling apart and falling on your face. While keeping your arms locked in the bent arm position, Bajoer the weight sBajoly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the Pecho. At that point, bring the Mancuerna Espalda to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was Bajoered and exhale as you perform this movement. Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Peso Corporal Aperturases
Pecho.instructions:
Position two equally loaded EZ bars on the ground next to each other. Ensure they are able to roll.
Assume a push-up position over the bars, supporting your weight on your toes and hands with your arms extended and body straight.
Place your hands on the bars. This will be your starting position.
Using a slow and controlled motion, move your hands away from the midline of your body, rolling the bars apart. Inhale during this portion of the motion.
After moving the bars as far apart as you can, return to the starting position by pulling them back together. Exhale as you perform this movement.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Position two equally loaded EZ bars on the ground next to each other. Ensure they are able to roll.
Assume a push-up position over the bars, supporting your weight on your toes and hands with your arms extended and body straight.
Place your hands on the bars. This will be your starting position.
Using a slow and controlled motion, move your hands away from the midline of your body, rolling the bars apart. Inhale during this portion of the motion.
After moving the bars as far apart as you can, return to the starting position by pulling them back together. Exhale as you perform this movement.
Pecho.instructions_es: Position two equally loaded EZ bars on the ground next to each other. Ensure they are able to roll. Assume a push-up position over the bars, supporting your weight on your toes and hands with your arms extended and body straight. Place your hands on the bars. This will be your starting position. Using a sBajo and controlled motion, move your hands away from the midline of your body, rolling the bars apart. Inhale during this portion of the motion. After moving the bars as far apart as you can, return to the starting position by pulling them Espalda together. Exhale as you perform this movement.

Pecho.name: Butteraperturas
Pecho.instructions:
Sit on the machine with your back flat on the pad.
Take hold of the handles. Tip: Your upper arms should be positioned parallel to the floor; adjust the machine accordingly. This will be your starting position.
Push the handles together slowly as you squeeze your chest in the middle. Breathe out during this part of the motion and hold the contraction for a second.
Return back to the starting position slowly as you inhale until your chest muscles are fully stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Sit on the machine with your back flat on the pad.
Take hold of the handles. Tip: Your upper arms should be positioned parallel to the floor; adjust the machine accordingly. This will be your starting position.
Push the handles together slowly as you squeeze your chest in the middle. Breathe out during this part of the motion and hold the contraction for a second.
Return back to the starting position slowly as you inhale until your chest muscles are fully stretched.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Sit on the Máquina with your Espalda flat on the pad. Take hold of the handles. Tip: Your upper arms should be positioned parallel to the Suelo; adjust the Máquina accordingly. This will be your starting position. Push the handles together sBajoly as you squeeze your Pecho in the middle. Breathe out during this part of the motion and hold the contraction for a second. Return Espalda to the starting position sBajoly as you inhale until your Pecho Muslos are fully stretched. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Cable Chest Press
Pecho.instructions:
Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together straight in front of you. Keep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
After pausing at full extension, return to th starting position, keeping tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back off the pad, at an incline or decline, or alternate hands.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together straight in front of you. Keep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
After pausing at full extension, return to th starting position, keeping tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back off the pad, at an incline or decline, or alternate hands.
Pecho.instructions_es: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be Sentado, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and Pecho up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position. Begin by extending through the elbow, Pressing the handles together straight in Frontal of you. Keep your Hombro blades retracted as you execute the movement. After pausing at full Extensión, return to th starting position, keeping tension on the Poleas. You can also execute this movement with your Espalda off the pad, at an Inclinado or Declinado, or alternate hands.

Pecho.name: Cruce de Poleas
Pecho.instructions:
To get yourself into the starting position, place the pulleys on a high position (above your head), select the resistance to be used and hold the pulleys in each hand.
Step forward in front of an imaginary straight line between both pulleys while pulling your arms together in front of you. Your torso should have a small forward bend from the waist. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon, extend your arms to the side (straight out at both sides) in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms and torso should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you breathe out. Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
To get yourself into the starting position, place the pulleys on a high position (above your head), select the resistance to be used and hold the pulleys in each hand.
Step forward in front of an imaginary straight line between both pulleys while pulling your arms together in front of you. Your torso should have a small forward bend from the waist. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon, extend your arms to the side (straight out at both sides) in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms and torso should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you breathe out. Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: To get yourself into the starting position, place the pulleys on a Alto position (above your head), select the resistance to be used and hold the pulleys in each hand. Step forward in Frontal of an imaginary straight line between both pulleys while pulling your arms together in Frontal of you. Your torso should have a small forward bend from the waist. This will be your starting position. With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the Bíceps tendon, extend your arms to the Lateral (straight out at both Laterals) in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your Pecho. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms and torso should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the Hombro joint. Return your arms Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out. Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to Bajoer the weights. Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Polea Iron Cross
Pecho.instructions:
Begin by moving the pulleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.
Stand directly between both pulleys with your arms extended out to your sides. Your head and chest should be up while your arms form a "T". This will be your starting position.
Keeping the elbows extended, pull your arms straight to your sides.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a pause at the peak contraction.
Continue the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin by moving the pulleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.
Stand directly between both pulleys with your arms extended out to your sides. Your head and chest should be up while your arms form a "T". This will be your starting position.
Keeping the elbows extended, pull your arms straight to your sides.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a pause at the peak contraction.
Continue the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin by moving the pulleys to the Alto position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand. Stand directly between both pulleys with your arms extended out to your Laterals. Your head and Pecho should be up while your arms form a "T". This will be your starting position. Keeping the elbows extended, pull your arms straight to your Laterals. Return your arms Espalda to the starting position after a pause at the peak contraction. Continue the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Chain Press
Pecho.instructions:
Begin by connecting the chains to the cable handle attachments. Position yourself on the flat bench in the same position as for a dumbbell press. Your wrists should be pronated and arms perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Lower the chains by flexing the elbows, unloading some of the chain onto the floor.
Continue until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle, and then reverse the motion by extending through the elbow to lockout.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin by connecting the chains to the cable handle attachments. Position yourself on the flat bench in the same position as for a dumbbell press. Your wrists should be pronated and arms perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Lower the chains by flexing the elbows, unloading some of the chain onto the floor.
Continue until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle, and then reverse the motion by extending through the elbow to lockout.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin by connecting the chains to the Polea handle attachments. Position yourself on the flat bench in the same position as for a Mancuerna Press. Your Muñecas should be pronated and arms perpendicular to the Suelo. This will be your starting position. Bajoer the chains by flexing the elbows, unloading some of the chain onto the Suelo. Continue until your elbow forms a 90 degree angle, and then Inverso the motion by extending through the elbow to lockout.

Pecho.name: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch
Pecho.instructions:
Start off by standing with your legs together, holding a bodybar or a broomstick.
Take a slightly wider than shoulder width grip on the pole and hold it in front of you with your palms facing down.
Carefully lift the pole up and behind your head.
Pecho.name_en: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch
Pecho.instructions_en:
Start off by standing with your legs together, holding a bodybar or a broomstick.
Take a slightly wider than shoulder width grip on the pole and hold it in front of you with your palms facing down.
Carefully lift the pole up and behind your head.
Pecho.instructions_es: Start off by De Pie with your Piernas together, holding a bodybar or a broomstick. Take a slightly wider than Hombro width grip on the pole and hold it in Frontal of you with your palms facing down. Carefully lift the pole up and behind your head.

Pecho.name: Pecho Push From 3 Point Stance
Pecho.instructions:
Begin in a three point stance, squatted down with your back flat and one hand on the ground. Place the medicine ball directly in front of you.
To begin, take your first step as you pull the ball to your chest, positioning both hands to prepare for the throw.
As you execute the second step, explosively release the ball forward as hard as possible.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin in a three point stance, squatted down with your back flat and one hand on the ground. Place the medicine ball directly in front of you.
To begin, take your first step as you pull the ball to your chest, positioning both hands to prepare for the throw.
As you execute the second step, explosively release the ball forward as hard as possible.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin in a three point stance, Sentadillated down with your Espalda flat and one hand on the ground. Place the medicine ball directly in Frontal of you. To begin, take your first step as you pull the ball to your Pecho, positioning both hands to prepare for the thRemo. As you execute the second step, explosively release the ball forward as hard as possible.

Pecho.name: Pecho Push (Multiple Response)
Pecho.instructions:
Begin in a kneeling position facing a wall or utilize a partner. Hold the ball with both hands tight into the chest.
Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the ball as hard as possible.
Follow through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
Immediately return to an upright position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin in a kneeling position facing a wall or utilize a partner. Hold the ball with both hands tight into the chest.
Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the ball as hard as possible.
Follow through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
Immediately return to an upright position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin in a Arrodillado position facing a wall or utilize a partner. Hold the ball with both hands tight into the Pecho. Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the Caderas while pushing the ball as hard as possible. FolBajo through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands. Immediately return to an Vertical position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Pecho Push (Single Response)
Pecho.instructions:
Begin in a kneeling position holding the medicine ball with both hands tightly into the chest.
Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the ball as far as possible.
Follow through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin in a kneeling position holding the medicine ball with both hands tightly into the chest.
Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the ball as far as possible.
Follow through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin in a Arrodillado position holding the medicine ball with both hands tightly into the Pecho. Execute the pass by exploding forward and outward with the Caderas while pushing the ball as far as possible. FolBajo through by falling forward, catching yourself with your hands.

Pecho.name: Pecho Push With Run Release
Pecho.instructions:
Begin in an athletic stance with the knees bent, hips back, and back flat. Hold the medicine ball near your legs. This will be your starting position.
While taking your first step draw the medicine ball into your chest.
As you take the second step, explosively push the ball forward, immediately sprinting for 10 yards after the release. If you are really fast, you can catch your own pass!
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin in an athletic stance with the knees bent, hips back, and back flat. Hold the medicine ball near your legs. This will be your starting position.
While taking your first step draw the medicine ball into your chest.
As you take the second step, explosively push the ball forward, immediately sprinting for 10 yards after the release. If you are really fast, you can catch your own pass!
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin in an athletic stance with the knees bent, Caderas Espalda, and Espalda flat. Hold the medicine ball near your Piernas. This will be your starting position. While taking your first step draw the medicine ball into your Pecho. As you take the second step, explosively push the ball forward, immediately sprinting for 10 yards after the release. If you are really fast, you can catch your own pass!

Pecho.name: Chest Stretch On Stability Ball
Pecho.instructions:
Get on your hands and knees next to an exercise ball.
Place your elbows on top of the ball, keeping your arm out to your side. This will be your starting position.
Lower your torso towards the floor, keeping your elbow on top of the ball. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, and repeat with the other arm.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Get on your hands and knees next to an exercise ball.
Place your elbows on top of the ball, keeping your arm out to your side. This will be your starting position.
Lower your torso towards the floor, keeping your elbow on top of the ball. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, and repeat with the other arm.
Pecho.instructions_es: Get on your hands and knees next to an exercise ball. Place your elbows on top of the ball, keeping your arm out to your Lateral. This will be your starting position. Bajoer your torso towards the Suelo, keeping your elbow on top of the ball. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, and repeat with the other arm.

Pecho.name: Clock Push-up
Pecho.instructions:
Move into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around shoulder width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest toward the ground.
At the bottom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as possible until you are air borne. Aim to "jump" 12-18 inches to one side.
As you accelerate up, move your outside foot away from your direction of travel. Leaving the ground, shift your body about 30 degrees for the next repetition.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise, working all the way around until you are back where you started.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Move into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around shoulder width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest toward the ground.
At the bottom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as possible until you are air borne. Aim to "jump" 12-18 inches to one side.
As you accelerate up, move your outside foot away from your direction of travel. Leaving the ground, shift your body about 30 degrees for the next repetition.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise, working all the way around until you are back where you started.
Pecho.instructions_es: Move into a Tumbado Prono position on the Suelo, supporting your weight on your hands and toes. Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around Hombro width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position. Descend by flexing at the elbow, Bajoering your Pecho toward the ground. At the bottom, Inverso the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow Extensión as quickly as possible until you are air borne. Aim to "Salto" 12-18 inches to one Lateral. As you accelerate up, move your outLateral foot away from your direction of travel. Leaving the ground, shift your body about 30 degrees for the next repetition. Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise, working all the way around until you are Espalda where you started.

Pecho.name: Cross Over - With Bandas
Pecho.instructions:
Secure an exercise band around a stationary post.
While facing away from the post, grab the handles on both ends of the band and step forward enough to create tension on the band.
Raise your arms to the sides, parallel to the floor, perpendicular to your torso (your torso and the arms should resemble the letter "T") and with the palms facing forward. Have them extended with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your arms straight, bring them across your chest in a semicircular motion to the front as you exhale and flex your pecs. Hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Perform for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Secure an exercise band around a stationary post.
While facing away from the post, grab the handles on both ends of the band and step forward enough to create tension on the band.
Raise your arms to the sides, parallel to the floor, perpendicular to your torso (your torso and the arms should resemble the letter "T") and with the palms facing forward. Have them extended with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your arms straight, bring them across your chest in a semicircular motion to the front as you exhale and flex your pecs. Hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Perform for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Secure an exercise Banda around a stationary post. While facing away from the post, grab the handles on both ends of the Banda and step forward enough to create tension on the Banda. Elevación your arms to the Laterals, parallel to the Suelo, perpendicular to your torso (your torso and the arms should resemble the letter "T") and with the palms facing forward. Have them extended with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position. While keeping your arms straight, bring them across your Pecho in a semicircular motion to the Frontal as you exhale and flex your pecs. Hold the contraction for a second. SBajoly return to the starting position as you inhale. Perform for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.
Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The arms should be perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position. Tip: In order to protect your rotator cuff, it is best if you have a spotter help you lift the barbell off the rack.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your lower chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up).
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.
Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The arms should be perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position. Tip: In order to protect your rotator cuff, it is best if you have a spotter help you lift the barbell off the rack.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your lower chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up).
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_es: Secure your Piernas at the end of the Declinado bench and sBajoly lay down on the bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the foPosteriorms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The arms should be perpendicular to the Suelo. This will be your starting position. Tip: In order to protect your rotator cuff, it is best if you have a spotter help you lift the Barra off the rack. As you breathe in, come down sBajoly until you feel the bar on your Bajoer Pecho. After a second pause, bring the bar Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your Pecho Muslos. Lock your arms and squeeze your Pecho in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up). Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.
Once you are laying down, move the dumbbells in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe out. Keep full control of the dumbbells at all times. Tip: Throughout the motion, the forearms should always be perpendicular to the floor.
As you breathe out, push the dumbbells up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up..
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

Pecho.instructions_es: Secure your Piernas at the end of the Declinado bench and lie down with a Mancuerna on each hand on top of your tAltos. The palms of your hand will be facing each other. Once you are laying down, move the Mancuernas in Frontal of you at Hombro width. Once at Hombro width, rotate your Muñecas forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position. Bring down the weights sBajoly to your Lateral as you breathe out. Keep full control of the Mancuernas at all times. Tip: Throughout the motion, the foPosteriorms should always be perpendicular to the Suelo. As you breathe out, push the Mancuernas up using your pectoral Muslos. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your Pecho, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

Pecho.name: Declinado Mancuerna Aperturases
Pecho.instructions:
Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.
Once you are laying down, move the dumbbells in front of you at shoulder width. The palms of the hands should be facing each other and the arms should be perpendicular to the floor and fully extended. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon, lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.instructions_es: Secure your Piernas at the end of the Declinado bench and lie down with a Mancuerna on each hand on top of your tAltos. The palms of your hand will be facing each other. Once you are laying down, move the Mancuernas in Frontal of you at Hombro width. The palms of the hands should be facing each other and the arms should be perpendicular to the Suelo and fully extended. This will be your starting position. With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the Bíceps tendon, Bajoer your arms out at both Laterals in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your Pecho. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the Hombro joint. Return your arms Espalda to the starting position as you squeeze your Pecho Muslos and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to Bajoer the weights. Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Declinado Push-up
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length. Move your feet up to a box or bench. This will be your starting position.
Next, lower yourself downward until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Now breathe out and press your upper body back up to the starting position while squeezing your chest.
After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.
Pecho.instructions_en:

Next, lower yourself downward until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Now breathe out and press your upper body back up to the starting position while squeezing your chest.
After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length. Move your feet up to a Cajón or bench. This will be your starting position. Next, Bajoer yourself downward until your Pecho almost touches the Suelo as you inhale. Now breathe out and Press your upper body Espalda up to the starting position while squeezing your Pecho. After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to Bajoer yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.

Pecho.name: Press Declinado en Smith
Pecho.instructions:
Place a decline bench underneath the Smith machine. Now place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms extended. This will be your starting position.
As you inhale, lower the bar under control by allowing the elbows to flex, lightly contacting the torso.
After a brief pause, bring the bar back to the starting position by extending the elbows, exhaling as you do so.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When the set is complete, lock the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Place a decline bench underneath the Smith machine. Now place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms extended. This will be your starting position.

After a brief pause, bring the bar back to the starting position by extending the elbows, exhaling as you do so.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When the set is complete, lock the bar back in the rack.
Pecho.instructions_es: Place a Declinado bench underneath the MultiPower. Now place the Barra at a height that you can reach when Recostado down and your arms are almost fully extended. Using a pronated grip that is wider than Hombro width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms extended. This will be your starting position. As you inhale, Bajoer the bar under control by alBajoing the elbows to flex, lightly contacting the torso. After a brief pause, bring the bar Espalda to the starting position by extending the elbows, exhaling as you do so. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When the set is complete, lock the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: Fondos - Pecho Version
Pecho.instructions:
For this exercise you will need access to parallel bars. To get yourself into the starting position, hold your body at arms length (arms locked) above the bars.
While breathing in, lower yourself slowly with your torso leaning forward around 30 degrees or so and your elbows flared out slightly until you feel a slight stretch in the chest.
Once you feel the stretch, use your chest to bring your body back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Remember to squeeze the chest at the top of the movement for a second.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
For this exercise you will need access to parallel bars. To get yourself into the starting position, hold your body at arms length (arms locked) above the bars.
While breathing in, lower yourself slowly with your torso leaning forward around 30 degrees or so and your elbows flared out slightly until you feel a slight stretch in the chest.
Once you feel the stretch, use your chest to bring your body back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Remember to squeeze the chest at the top of the movement for a second.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: For this exercise you will need access to parallel bars. To get yourself into the starting position, hold your body at arms length (arms locked) above the bars. While breathing in, Bajoer yourself sBajoly with your torso leaning forward around 30 degrees or so and your elbows flared out slightly until you feel a slight stretch in the Pecho. Once you feel the stretch, use your Pecho to bring your body Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Remember to squeeze the Pecho at the top of the movement for a second. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Drop Push
Pecho.instructions:
Position low boxes or other platforms 2-3 feet apart.
Move to a pushup position between them, supporting yourself by placing your hands on the boxes.
With good posture, drop from the platforms by pressing up and moving your hands to shoulder width, cushioning your landing by absorbing the impact through the arm.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Position low boxes or other platforms 2-3 feet apart.
Move to a pushup position between them, supporting yourself by placing your hands on the boxes.
With good posture, drop from the platforms by pressing up and moving your hands to shoulder width, cushioning your landing by absorbing the impact through the arm.
Pecho.instructions_es: Position Bajo Cajónes or other platforms 2-3 feet apart. Move to a pushup position between them, supporting yourself by placing your hands on the Cajónes. With good posture, drop from the platforms by Pressing up and moving your hands to Hombro width, cushioning your landing by absorbing the impact through the arm.

Pecho.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hands will be facing each other.
Then, using your thighs to help raise the dumbbells up, lift the dumbbells one at a time so that you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. The dumbbells should be just to the sides of your chest, with your upper arm and forearm creating a 90 degree angle. Be sure to maintain full control of the dumbbells at all times. This will be your starting position.
Then, as you breathe out, use your chest to push the dumbbells up. Lock your arms at the top of the lift and squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then begin coming down slowly. Tip: Ideally, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

Pecho.instructions_es: Lie down on a flat bench with a Mancuerna in each hand resting on top of your tAltos. The palms of your hands will be facing each other. Once at Hombro width, rotate your Muñecas forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. The Mancuernas should be just to the Laterals of your Pecho, with your upper arm and foPosteriorm creating a 90 degree angle. Be sure to maintain full control of the Mancuernas at all times. This will be your starting position. Then, as you breathe out, use your Pecho to push the Mancuernas up. Lock your arms at the top of the lift and squeeze your Pecho, hold for a second and then begin coming down sBajoly. Tip: Ideally, Bajoering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

Pecho.name: Dumbbell Bench Press With Neutral Grip
Pecho.instructions:
Take a dumbbell in each hand and lay back onto a flat bench. Your feet should be flat on the floor and your shoulder blades retracted.
Maintaining a neutral grip, palms facing each other, begin with your arms extended directly above you, perpendicular to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, lowering the upper arms to the side. Descend until the dumbbells are to your torso.
Pause, then extend the elbow and return to the starting position.
Pecho.name_en: Dumbbell Bench Press with Neutral Grip

Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, lowering the upper arms to the side. Descend until the dumbbells are to your torso.

Pecho.instructions_es: Take a Mancuerna in each hand and lay Espalda onto a flat bench. Your feet should be flat on the Suelo and your Hombro blades retracted. Maintaining a Agarre Neutro, palms facing each other, begin with your arms extended directly above you, perpendicular to the Suelo. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, Bajoering the upper arms to the Lateral. Descend until the Mancuernas are to your torso. Pause, then extend the elbow and return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Mancuerna Aperturases
Pecho.instructions:
Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell on each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.
Then using your thighs to help raise the dumbbells, lift the dumbbells one at a time so you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width with the palms of your hands facing each other. Raise the dumbbells up like you're pressing them, but stop and hold just before you lock out. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon, lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the Hombro joint. Return your arms Espalda to the starting position as you squeeze your Pecho Muslos and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to Bajoer the weights. Pecho.name: Dynamic Chest Stretch
Pecho.instructions:
Stand with your hands together, arms extended directly in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, quickly move your arms back as far as possible and back in again, similar to an exaggerated clapping motion. Repeat 5-10 times, increasing speed as you do so.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Stand with your hands together, arms extended directly in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, quickly move your arms back as far as possible and back in again, similar to an exaggerated clapping motion. Repeat 5-10 times, increasing speed as you do so.
Pecho.instructions_es: Stand with your hands together, arms extended directly in Frontal of you. This will be your starting position. Keeping your arms straight, quickly move your arms Espalda as far as possible and Espalda in again, similar to an exaggerated clapping motion. Repeat 5-10 times, increasing speed as you do so.

Pecho.name: Elbows Espalda
Pecho.instructions: Stand up straight. Place both hands on your Bajoer Espalda, fingers pointing downward and elbows out. Then gently pull your elbows Espalda aiming to touch them together.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Stand up straight.
Place both hands on your lower back, fingers pointing downward and elbows out.
Then gently pull your elbows back aiming to touch them together.
Pecho.instructions_es: Stand up straight. Place both hands on your Bajoer Espalda, fingers pointing downward and elbows out. Then gently pull your elbows Espalda aiming to touch them together.

Pecho.name: Press de Suelo
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor and position a kettlebell for one arm to press. The kettlebell should be held by the handle. The leg on the same side that you are pressing should be bent, with the knee crossing over the midline of the body.
Press the kettlebell by extending the elbow and adducting the arm, pressing it above your body. Return to the starting position.
Pecho.name_en: Extended Range One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor and position a kettlebell for one arm to press. The kettlebell should be held by the handle. The leg on the same side that you are pressing should be bent, with the knee crossing over the midline of the body.
Press the kettlebell by extending the elbow and adducting the arm, pressing it above your body. Return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo and position a Pesa Rusa for Un Brazo to Press. The Pesa Rusa should be held by the handle. The Pierna on the same Lateral that you are Pressing should be bent, with the knee crossing over the midline of the body. Press the Pesa Rusa by extending the elbow and adducting the arm, Pressing it above your body. Return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Flat Bench Aperturas en Poleaes
Pecho.instructions:
Position a flat bench between two low pulleys so that when you are laying on it, your chest will be lined up with the cable pulleys.
Lay flat on the bench and keep your feet on the ground.
Have someone hand you the handles on each hand. You will grab each single handle attachment with a palms up grip.
Extend your arms by your side with a slight bend on your elbows. Tip: You will keep this bend constant through the whole movement. Your arms should be parallel to the floor. This is your starting position.
Now start lifting the arms in a semi-circle motion directly in front of you by pulling the cables together until both hands meet at the top of the movement. Squeeze your chest as you perform this motion and breathe out during this movement. Also, hold the contraction for a second at the top. Tip: When performed correctly, at the top position of this movement, your arms should be perpendicular to your torso and the floor touching above your chest.
Slowly come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:

Lay flat on the bench and keep your feet on the ground.

Pecho.instructions_es: Position a flat bench between two Bajo pulleys so that when you are laying on it, your Pecho will be lined up with the Polea pulleys.
