Squeeze your Pecho as you perform this motion and breathe out during this movement. Also, hold the contraction for a second at the top. Tip: When performed correctly, at the top position of this movement, your arms should be perpendicular to your torso and the Suelo touching above your Pecho. SBajoly come Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Forward Drag With Press
Pecho.instructions:
Attach a dual handled chain or rope attachment to the sled. You should be facing away from the sled, holding a handle in each hand.
Begin the movement by moving forward for one step. Leaning forward, extend through the legs and hips to move, pausing with each step to extend through the elbows, pressing your hands forward. Step forward until you return to the start position prepared to press.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Attach a dual handled chain or rope attachment to the sled. You should be facing away from the sled, holding a handle in each hand.
Begin the movement by moving forward for one step. Leaning forward, extend through the legs and hips to move, pausing with each step to extend through the elbows, pressing your hands forward. Step forward until you return to the start position prepared to press.
Pecho.instructions_es: Attach a dual handled chain or rope attachment to the Trineo. You should be facing away from the Trineo, holding a handle in each hand. Begin the movement by moving forward for one step. Leaning forward, extend through the Piernas and Caderas to move, pausing with each step to extend through the elbows, Pressing your hands forward. Step forward until you return to the start position prepared to Press.

Pecho.name: Elevación Frontalal And Pullover
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on a flat bench while holding a barbell using a palms down grip that is about 15 inches apart.
Place the bar on your upper thighs, extend your arms and lock them while keeping a slight bend on the elbows. This will be your starting position.
Now raise the weight using a semicircular motion and keeping your arms straight as you inhale. Continue the same movement until the bar is on the other side above your head . (Tip: the bar will travel approximately 180-degrees). At this point your arms should be parallel to the floor with the palms of your hands facing the ceiling.
Now return the barbell to the starting position by reversing the motion as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie on a flat bench while holding a barbell using a palms down grip that is about 15 inches apart.
Place the bar on your upper thighs, extend your arms and lock them while keeping a slight bend on the elbows. This will be your starting position.
Now raise the weight using a semicircular motion and keeping your arms straight as you inhale. Continue the same movement until the bar is on the other side above your head . Now return the barbell to the starting position by reversing the motion as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on a flat bench while holding a Barra using a palms down grip that is about 15 inches apart. Place the bar on your upper tAltos, extend your arms and lock them while keeping a slight bend on the elbows. This will be your starting position. Now Elevación the weight using a semicircular motion and keeping your arms straight as you inhale. Continue the same movement until the bar is on the other Lateral above your head . (Tip: the bar will travel approximately 180-degrees). At this point your arms should be parallel to the Suelo with the palms of your hands facing the ceiling. Now return the Barra to the starting position by reversing the motion as you exhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Hammer Grip Incline Db Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.
By using your thighs to help you get the dumbbells up, clean the dumbbells one arm at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, keep the palms of your hands with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Keep your elbows flared out with the upper arms in line with the shoulders (perpendicular to the torso) and the elbows bent creating a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm. This will be your starting position.
Now bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe in. Keep full control of the dumbbells at all times.
As you breathe out, push the dumbbells up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the dumbbells back in your thighs and then on the floor. This is the safest manner to dispose of the dumbbells.
Pecho.name_en: Hammer Grip Incline DB Bench Press

Pecho.instructions_es: Lie Espalda on an Banca Inclinada with a Mancuerna on each hand on top of your tAltos. The palms of your hand will be facing each other. Once at Hombro width, keep the palms of your hands with a Agarre Neutro (palms facing each other). Keep your elbows flared out with the upper arms in line with the Hombros (perpendicular to the torso) and the elbows bent creating a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the foPosteriorm. This will be your starting position. Now bring down the weights sBajoly to your Lateral as you breathe in. Keep full control of the Mancuernas at all times. As you breathe out, push the Mancuernas up using your pectoral Muslos. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the Mancuernas Espalda in your tAltos and then on the Suelo. This is the safest manner to dispose of the Mancuernas.

Pecho.name: Heavy Bag Thrust
Pecho.instructions:
Utilize a heavy bag for this exercise. Assume an upright stance next to the bag, with your feet staggered, fairly wide apart. Place your hand on the bag at about chest height. This will be your starting position.
Begin by twisting at the waist, pushing the bag forward as hard as possible. Perform this move quickly, pushing the bag away from your body.
Receive the bag as it swings back by reversing these steps.
Pecho.instructions_en:

Begin by twisting at the waist, pushing the bag forward as hard as possible. Perform this move quickly, pushing the bag away from your body.
Receive the bag as it swings back by reversing these steps.

This will be your starting position. Begin by twisting at the waist, pushing the bag forward as hard as possible. Perform this move quickly, pushing the bag away from your body. Receive the bag as it swings Espalda by reversing these steps.

Pecho.name: Incline Cable Chest Press
Pecho.instructions:
Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together straight in front of you. Keep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
After pausing at full extension, return to the starting position, keeping tension on the cables.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together straight in front of you. Keep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
After pausing at full extension, return to the starting position, keeping tension on the cables.
Pecho.instructions_es: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be Sentado, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 45 degrees to the body, with your head and Pecho up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position. Begin by extending through the elbow, Pressing the handles together straight in Frontal of you. Keep your Hombro blades retracted as you execute the movement. After pausing at full Extensión, return to the starting position, keeping tension on the Poleas.

Pecho.name: Inclinado Aperturas en Poleae
Pecho.instructions:
To get yourself into the starting position, set the pulleys at the floor level (lowest level possible on the machine that is below your torso).
Place an incline bench (set at 45 degrees) in between the pulleys, select a weight on each one and grab a pulley on each hand.
With a handle on each hand, lie on the incline bench and bring your hands together at arms length in front of your face. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend of your elbows (in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon), lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary. The movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and exhale. Hold the contracted position for a second. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
To get yourself into the starting position, set the pulleys at the floor level (lowest level possible on the machine that is below your torso).
Place an incline bench (set at 45 degrees) in between the pulleys, select a weight on each one and grab a pulley on each hand.
With a handle on each hand, lie on the incline bench and bring your hands together at arms length in front of your face. This will be your starting position.

Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and exhale. Hold the contracted position for a second. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: To get yourself into the starting position, set the pulleys at the Suelo level (Bajoest level possible on the Máquina that is beBajo your torso). Place an Banca Inclinada (set at 45 degrees) in between the pulleys, select a weight on each one and grab a pulley on each hand. With a handle on each hand, lie on the Banca Inclinada and bring your hands together at arms length in Frontal of your face. This will be your starting position. With a slight bend of your elbows (in order to prevent stress at the Bíceps tendon), Bajoer your arms out at both Laterals in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your Pecho. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary. The movement should only occur at the Hombro joint. Return your arms Espalda to the starting position as you squeeze your Pecho Muslos and exhale. Hold the contracted position for a second. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to Bajoer the weights. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand will be facing each other.
By using your thighs to help you get the dumbbells up, clean the dumbbells one arm at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, keep the palms of your hands with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Keep your elbows flared out with the upper arms in line with the shoulders (perpendicular to the torso) and the elbows bent creating a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm. This will be your starting position.

When you are done, place the dumbbells back in your thighs and then on the floor. This is the safest manner to dispose of the dumbbells.

Pecho.name: Inclinado Mancuerna Aperturases
Pecho.instructions:
Hold a dumbbell on each hand and lie on an incline bench that is set to an incline angle of no more than 30 degrees.
Extend your arms above you with a slight bend at the elbows.
Now rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing you. Tip: The pinky fingers should be next to each other. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, start to slowly lower the arms to the side while keeping the arms extended and while rotating the wrists until the palms of the hand are facing each other. Tip: At the end of the movement the arms will be by your side with the palms facing the ceiling.
As you exhale start to bring the dumbbells back up to the starting position by reversing the motion and rotating the hands so that the pinky fingers are next to each other again. Tip: Keep in mind that the movement will only happen at the shoulder joint and at the wrist. There is no motion that happens at the elbow joint.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:

As you exhale start to bring the Mancuernas Espalda up to the starting position by reversing the motion and rotating the hands so that the pinky fingers are next to each other again. Tip: Keep in mind that the movement will only happen at the Hombro joint and at the Muñeca. There is no motion that happens at the elbow joint. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand atop your thighs. The palms of your hands will be facing each other.
Then, using your thighs to help push the dumbbells up, lift the dumbbells one at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.
Once you have the dumbbells raised to shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Be sure to keep full control of the dumbbells at all times. Then breathe out and push the dumbbells up with your chest.
Lock your arms at the top, hold for a second, and then start slowly lowering the weight. Tip Ideally, lowering the weights should take about twice as long as raising them.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the dumbbells back on your thighs and then on the floor. This is the safest manner to release the dumbbells.
Pecho.instructions_en:

Then, using your thighs to help push the dumbbells up, lift the dumbbells one at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.

Pecho.instructions_es: Lie Espalda on an Banca Inclinada with a Mancuerna in each hand atop your tAltos. The palms of your hands will be facing each other. Then, using your tAltos to help push the Mancuernas up, lift the Mancuernas one at a time so that you can hold them at Hombro width. Once you have the Mancuernas Elevaciónd to Hombro width, rotate your Muñecas forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position. Be sure to keep full control of the Mancuernas at all times. Then breathe out and push the Mancuernas up with your Pecho. Lock your arms at the top, hold for a second, and then start sBajoly Bajoering the weight. Tip Ideally, Bajoering the weights should take about twice as long as raising them. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the Mancuernas Espalda on your tAltos and then on the Suelo. This is the safest manner to release the Mancuernas.

Pecho.name: Inclinado Push-up
Pecho.instructions:
Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Position forefoot back from bench or platform with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body. Keeping body straight, lower chest to edge of box or platform by bending arms.
Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Position forefoot back from bench or platform with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body. Keeping body straight, lower chest to edge of box or platform by bending arms.
Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.
Pecho.instructions_es: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than Hombro width. Position forefoot Espalda from bench or platform with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body. Keeping body straight, Bajoer Pecho to edge of Cajón or platform by bending arms. Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.

Pecho.name: Inclinado Push-up Depth Salto
Pecho.instructions:
For this drill you will need a box about 12 inches high, and two thick mats or aerobics steps.
Place the steps just outside of your shoulders, and place your feet on top of the box so that you are in an incline pushup position, your hands just inside the steps. This will be your starting position.
Begin by bending at the elbows to lower your body, quickly reversing position to push your body off of the ground. As you leave the ground, move your hands onto the steps, bending your elbows to absorb the impact.
Repeat the motion to return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_en:
For this drill you will need a box about 12 inches high, and two thick mats or aerobics steps.
Place the steps just outside of your shoulders, and place your feet on top of the box so that you are in an incline pushup position, your hands just inside the steps. This will be your starting position.
Begin by bending at the elbows to lower your body, quickly reversing position to push your body off of the ground. As you leave the ground, move your hands onto the steps, bending your elbows to absorb the impact.
Repeat the motion to return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_es: For this drill you will need a Cajón about 12 inches Alto, and two thick mats or aerobics steps. Place the steps just outLateral of your Hombros, and place your feet on top of the Cajón so that you are in an Inclinado pushup position, your hands just inLateral the steps. This will be your starting position. Begin by bending at the elbows to Bajoer your body, quickly reversing position to push your body off of the ground. As you leave the ground, move your hands onto the steps, bending your elbows to absorb the impact. Repeat the motion to return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Inclinado Push-up Medium
Pecho.instructions:
Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an appropriate height.
Place your hands on the bar, with your hands about shoulder width apart.
Position your feet back from the bar with arms and body straight. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your body straight, lower your chest to the bar by bending the arms.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, pressing yourself back up.

Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, pressing yourself back up.

Pecho.name: Inclinado Push-up Wide

Keeping your body straight, lower your chest to the bar by bending the arms.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, pressing yourself back up.

Pecho.name: Isometric Pecho Squeezes
Pecho.instructions:
While either seating or standing, bend your arms at a 90-degree angle and place the palms of your hands together in front of your chest. Tip: Your hands should be open with the palms together and fingers facing forward (perpendicular to your torso).
Push both hands against each other as you contract your chest. Start with slow tension and increase slowly. Keep breathing normally as you execute this contraction.
Hold for the recommended number of seconds.
Now release the tension slowly.
Rest for the recommended amount of time and repeat.

Pecho.instructions_es: While either seating or De Pie, bend your arms at a 90-degree angle and place the palms of your hands together in Frontal of your Pecho. Tip: Your hands should be open with the palms together and fingers facing forward (perpendicular to your torso). Push both hands against each other as you contract your Pecho. Start with sBajo tension and increase sBajoly. Keep breathing normally as you execute this contraction. Hold for the recommended number of seconds. Now release the tension sBajoly. Rest for the recommended amount of time and repeat.

Pecho.name: Isometric Wipers
Pecho.instructions:
Assume a push-up position, supporting your weight on your hands and toes while keeping your body straight. Your hands should be just outside of shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Begin by shifting your body weight as far to one side as possible, allowing the elbow on that side to flex as you lower your body.
Reverse the motion by extending the flexed arm, pushing yourself up and then dropping to the other side.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Pecho.instructions_es: Assume a push-up position, supporting your weight on your hands and toes while keeping your body straight. Your hands should be just outLateral of Hombro width. This will be your starting position. Begin by shifting your body weight as far to one Lateral as possible, alBajoing the elbow on that Lateral to flex as you Bajoer your body. Inverso the motion by extending the flexed arm, pushing yourself up and then dropping to the other Lateral. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Press de Suelo
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor with one kettlebell in place on your chest, holding it by the handle. Extend leg on working side over leg on non-working side.Your free arm can be extended out to your side for support.
Press the kettlebll into a locked out position.
Lower the weight until the elbow touches the ground, keeping the kettlebell above the elbow. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo with one Pesa Rusa in place on your Pecho, holding it by the handle. Pecho.name: Leverage Chest Press
Pecho.instructions:
Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the bottom or middle of the pectorals at the beginning of the motion.
Your chest and head should be up and your shoulder blades retracted. This will be your starting position.
Press the handles forward by extending through the elbow.
After a brief pause at the top, return the weight just above the start position, keeping tension on the muscles by not returning the weight to the stops until the set is complete.

Pecho.name: Bajo Cruce de Poleas
Pecho.instructions:
To move into the starting position, place the pulleys at the low position, select the resistance to be used and grasp a handle in each hand.
Step forward, gaining tension in the pulleys. Your palms should be facing forward, hands below the waist, and your arms straight. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend in your arms, draw your hands upward and toward the midline of your body. Your hands should come together in front of your chest, palms facing up.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a brief pause.
Pecho.instructions_en:
To move into the starting position, place the pulleys at the low position, select the resistance to be used and grasp a handle in each hand.
Step forward, gaining tension in the pulleys. Your palms should be facing forward, hands below the waist, and your arms straight. This will be your starting position.
With a slight bend in your arms, draw your hands upward and toward the midline of your body. Your hands should come together in front of your chest, palms facing up.

With a slight bend in your arms, draw your hands upward and toward the midline of your body. Your hands should come together in Frontal of your Pecho, palms facing up. Return your arms Espalda to the starting position after a brief pause.

Pecho.name: Machine Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Sit down on the Chest Press Machine and select the weight.
Step on the lever provided by the machine since it will help you to bring the handles forward so that you can grab the handles and fully extend the arms.
Grab the handles with a palms-down grip and lift your elbows so that your upper arms are parallel to the floor to the sides of your torso. Tip: Your forearms will be pointing forward since you are grabbing the handles. Once you bring the handles forward and extend the arms you will be at the starting position.
Now bring the handles back towards you as you breathe in.
Push the handles away from you as you flex your pecs and you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second before going back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of reps.
When finished step on the lever again and slowly get the handles back to their original place.

Hold the contraction for a second before going Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of reps. Pecho.name: Medicine Ball Pecho Pass
Pecho.instructions:
You will need a partner for this exercise. Lacking one, this movement can be performed against a wall.
Begin facing your partner holding the medicine ball at your torso with both hands.
Pull the ball to your chest, and reverse the motion by extending through the elbows. For sports applications, you can take a step as you throw.
Your partner should catch the ball, and throw it back to you.
Receive the throw with both hands at chest height.
Pecho.instructions_en:

Pull the ball to your chest, and reverse the motion by extending through the elbows. For sports applications, you can take a step as you throw.
Your partner should catch the ball, and throw it back to you.
Receive the throw with both hands at chest height.
Pecho.instructions_es: You will need a partner for this exercise. Lacking one, this movement can be performed against a wall. Begin facing your partner holding the medicine ball at your torso with both hands. Pull the ball to your Pecho, and Inverso the motion by extending through the elbows. For sports applications, you can take a step as you thRemo. Your partner should catch the ball, and thRemo it Espalda to you. Receive the thRemo with both hands at Pecho height.

Pecho.name: Neck Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degree angle in the middle of the movement between the forearms and the upper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your neck.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up).
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

After a second pause, bring the bar Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your Pecho Muslos. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: One-arm Flat Bench Mancuerna Aperturase
Pecho.instructions:
Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand resting on top of your thigh. The palm of your hand with the dumbbell in it should be at a neutral grip.
By using your thighs to help you get the dumbbell up, clean the dumbbell so that you can hold it in front of you with your lifting arm being fully extended. Remember to maintain a neutral grip with this exercise. Your non lifting hand should be to the side holding the flat bench for better support. This will be your starting position.
Your arm with the weight should have a slight bend on your elbow in order to prevent stress at the biceps tendon. Begin by lowering your arm with the weight in it out in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, your lifting arm should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the shoulder joint.
Return your lifting arm back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

Begin by Bajoering your arm with the weight in it out in a wide arc until you feel a stretch on your Pecho. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Keep in mind that throughout the movement, your lifting arm should remain stationary; the movement should only occur at the Hombro joint. Return your lifting arm Espalda to the starting position as you squeeze your Pecho Muslos and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to Bajoer the weights. Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

Pecho.name: Press de Suelo
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor holding a kettlebell with one hand, with your upper arm supported by the floor. The palm should be facing in.
Press the kettlebell straight up toward the ceiling, rotating your wrist.
Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position and repeat.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor holding a kettlebell with one hand, with your upper arm supported by the floor. The palm should be facing in.
Press the kettlebell straight up toward the ceiling, rotating your wrist.
Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position and repeat.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo holding a Pesa Rusa with one hand, with your upper arm supported by the Suelo. The palm should be facing in. Press the Pesa Rusa straight up toward the ceiling, rotating your Muñeca. Bajoer the Pesa Rusa Espalda to the starting position and repeat.

Pecho.name: One Arm Dumbbell Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand on top of your thigh.
By using your thigh to help you get the dumbbell up, clean the dumbbell up so that you can hold it in front of you at shoulder width. Use the hand you are not lifting with to help position the dumbbell over you properly.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrist forward so that the palm of your hand is facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe in. Keep full control of the dumbbell at all times. Tip: Use the hand that you are not lifting with to help keep the dumbbell balance as you may struggle a bit at first. Only use your non-lifting hand if it is needed. Otherwise, keep it resting to the side.
As you breathe out, push the dumbbells up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program. Switch arms and repeat the movement.

Pecho.name: Plyo Pesa Rusa Pushups
Pecho.instructions:
Place a kettlebell on the floor. Place yourself in a pushup position, on your toes with one hand on the ground and one hand holding the kettlebell, with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.
Begin by lowering yourself as low as you can, keeping your back straight.
Quickly and forcefully reverse direction, pushing yourself up to the other side of the kettlebell, switching hands as you do so. Continue the movement by descending and repeating the movement back and forth.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Place a kettlebell on the floor. Place yourself in a pushup position, on your toes with one hand on the ground and one hand holding the kettlebell, with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.
Begin by lowering yourself as low as you can, keeping your back straight.
Quickly and forcefully reverse direction, pushing yourself up to the other side of the kettlebell, switching hands as you do so. Continue the movement by descending and repeating the movement back and forth.
Pecho.instructions_es: Place a Pesa Rusa on the Suelo. Place yourself in a pushup position, on your toes with one hand on the ground and one hand holding the Pesa Rusa, with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position. Begin by Bajoering yourself as Bajo as you can, keeping your Espalda straight. Quickly and forcefully Inverso direction, pushing yourself up to the other Lateral of the Pesa Rusa, switching hands as you do so. Continue the movement by descending and repeating the movement Espalda and forth.

Pecho.name: Plyo Push-up
Pecho.instructions:
Move into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around shoulder width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest towards the ground.
At the bottom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as possible. Attempt to push your upper body up until your hands leave the ground.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise.
For added difficulty, add claps into the movement while you are air borne.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Move into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around shoulder width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest towards the ground.
At the bottom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as possible. Attempt to push your upper body up until your hands leave the ground.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise.
For added difficulty, add claps into the movement while you are air borne.
Pecho.instructions_es: Move into a Tumbado Prono position on the Suelo, supporting your weight on your hands and toes. Your arms should be fully extended with the hands around Hombro width. Keep your body straight throughout the movement. This will be your starting position. Descend by flexing at the elbow, Bajoering your Pecho towards the ground. At the bottom, Inverso the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow Extensión as quickly as possible. Attempt to push your upper body up until your hands leave the ground. Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise. For added difficulty, add claps into the movement while you are air borne.

Pecho.name: Push-up Wide
Pecho.instructions:
With your hands wide apart, support your body on your toes and hands in a plank position. Your elbows should be extended and your body straight. Do not allow your hips to sag. This will be your starting position.
To begin, allow the elbows to flex, lowering your chest to the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position by extending the elbows. Exhale as you perform this step.
After pausing at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
With your hands wide apart, support your body on your toes and hands in a plank position. Your elbows should be extended and your body straight. Do not allow your hips to sag. This will be your starting position.
To begin, allow the elbows to flex, lowering your chest to the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position by extending the elbows. Exhale as you perform this step.

Pecho.instructions_es: With your hands wide apart, support your body on your toes and hands in a Plancha position. Your elbows should be extended and your body straight. Do not alBajo your Caderas to sag. This will be your starting position. To begin, alBajo the elbows to flex, Bajoering your Pecho to the Suelo as you inhale. Using your pectoral Muslos, Press your upper body Espalda up to the starting position by extending the elbows. Exhale as you perform this step. After pausing at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Push-ups With Feet Elevated
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.
Place your toes on top of a flat bench. This will allow your body to be elevated. Note: The higher the elevation of the flat bench, the higher the resistance of the exercise is.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Place your toes on top of a flat bench. This will allow your body to be elevated. Note: The higher the elevation of the flat bench, the higher the resistance of the exercise is.

Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length. Place your toes on top of a flat bench. This will alBajo your body to be elevated. Note: The Altoer the elevation of the flat bench, the Altoer the resistance of the exercise is. Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Flexión To Lateral Plancha
Pecho.instructions:
Get into pushup position on the toes with your hands just outside of shoulder width.
Perform a pushup by allowing the elbows to flex. As you descend, keep your body straight.
Do one pushup and as you come up, shift your weight on the left side of the body, twist to the side while bringing the right arm up towards the ceiling in a side plank.
Lower the arm back to the floor for another pushup and then twist to the other side.
Repeat the series, alternating each side, for 10 or more reps.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Get into pushup position on the toes with your hands just outside of shoulder width.
Perform a pushup by allowing the elbows to flex. As you descend, keep your body straight.
Do one pushup and as you come up, shift your weight on the left side of the body, twist to the side while bringing the right arm up towards the ceiling in a side plank.
Lower the arm back to the floor for another pushup and then twist to the other side.
Repeat the series, alternating each side, for 10 or more reps.
Pecho.instructions_es: Get into pushup position on the toes with your hands just outLateral of Hombro width. Perform a pushup by alBajoing the elbows to flex. As you descend, keep your body straight. Do one pushup and as you come up, shift your weight on the left Lateral of the body, twist to the Lateral while bringing the right arm up towards the ceiling in a Plancha Lateral. Bajoer the arm Espalda to the Suelo for another pushup and then twist to the other Lateral. Repeat the series, Alternando each Lateral, for 10 or more reps.

Pecho.name: Flexiones
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length.
Next, lower yourself downward until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Now breathe out and press your upper body back up to the starting position while squeezing your chest.
After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length.

After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie on the Suelo face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length. After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to Bajoer yourself downward again for as many repetitions as needed.

Pecho.name: Flexiones (Close And Wide Hand Positions)
Pecho.instructions:
Lie on the floor face down and body straight with your toes on the floor and the hands wider than shoulder width for a wide hand position and closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure you are holding your torso up at arms length.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, press your upper body back up to the starting position and squeeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie on the floor face down and body straight with your toes on the floor and the hands wider than shoulder width for a wide hand position and closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure you are holding your torso up at arms length.

Make sure you are holding your torso up at arms length. Bajoer yourself until your Pecho almost touches the Suelo as you inhale. Using your pectoral Muslos, Press your upper body Espalda up to the starting position and squeeze your Pecho. Breathe out as you perform this step. After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Single-arm Cruce de Poleas
Pecho.instructions:
Begin by moving the pulleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.
Step forward in front of both pulleys with your arms extended in front of you, bringing your hands together. Your head and chest should be up as you lean forward, while your feet should be staggered. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your left arm in place, allow your right arm to extend out to the side, maintaining a slight bend at the elbow. The right arm should be perpendicular to the body at approximately shoulder level.
Return your arm back to the starting position by pulling your hand back to the midline of the body.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side. Continue alternating back and forth for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin by moving the pulleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.
Step forward in front of both pulleys with your arms extended in front of you, bringing your hands together. Your head and chest should be up as you lean forward, while your feet should be staggered. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your left arm in place, allow your right arm to extend out to the side, maintaining a slight bend at the elbow. The right arm should be perpendicular to the body at approximately shoulder level.
Return your arm back to the starting position by pulling your hand back to the midline of the body.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side. Continue alternating back and forth for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin by moving the pulleys to the Alto position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand. Step forward in Frontal of both pulleys with your arms extended in Frontal of you, bringing your hands together. Your head and Pecho should be up as you lean forward, while your feet should be staggered. This will be your starting position. Keeping your left arm in place, alBajo your right arm to extend out to the Lateral, maintaining a slight bend at the elbow. The right arm should be perpendicular to the body at approximately Hombro level. Return your arm Espalda to the starting position by pulling your hand Espalda to the midline of the body. Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite Lateral. Continue Alternando Espalda and forth for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Un Brazo Push-up
Pecho.instructions:
Begin laying prone on the ground. Move yourself into a position supporting your weight on your toes and one arm. Your working arm should be placed directly under the shoulder, fully extended. Your legs should be extended, and for this movement you may need a wider base, placing your feet further apart than in a normal push-up.
Maintain good posture, and place your free hand behind your back. This will be your starting position.
Lower yourself by allowing the elbow to flex until you touch the ground.
Descend slowly, and reverse direction be extending the arm to return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin laying prone on the ground. Move yourself into a position supporting your weight on your toes and one arm. Your working arm should be placed directly under the shoulder, fully extended. Your legs should be extended, and for this movement you may need a wider base, placing your feet further apart than in a normal push-up.
Maintain good posture, and place your free hand behind your back. This will be your starting position.
Lower yourself by allowing the elbow to flex until you touch the ground.
Descend slowly, and reverse direction be extending the arm to return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin laying Tumbado Prono on the ground. Move yourself into a position supporting your weight on your toes and Un Brazo. Your working arm should be placed directly under the Hombro, fully extended. Your Piernas should be extended, and for this movement you may need a wider base, placing your feet further apart than in a normal push-up. Maintain good posture, and place your free hand behind your Espalda. This will be your starting position. Bajoer yourself by alBajoing the elbow to flex until you touch the ground. Descend sBajoly, and Inverso direction be extending the arm to return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Smith Machine Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Place a flat bench underneath the smith machine. Now place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the flat bench. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your middle chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, lock the bar back in the rack.

Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the flat bench. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.

Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, lock the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: Smith Machine Decline Press
Pecho.instructions:
Position a decline bench in the rack so that the bar will be above your chest. Load an appropriate weight and take your place on the bench.
Rotate the bar to unhook it from the rack and fully extend your arms. Your back should be slightly arched and your shoulder blades retracted. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your arms, lowering the bar to your chest.
Pause briefly, and then extend your arms to push the weight back to the starting position.
After completing the desired number of repetitions, rotate the bar to rack the weight.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Position a decline bench in the rack so that the bar will be above your chest. Load an appropriate weight and take your place on the bench.
Rotate the bar to unhook it from the rack and fully extend your arms. Your back should be slightly arched and your shoulder blades retracted. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your arms, lowering the bar to your chest.
Pause briefly, and then extend your arms to push the weight back to the starting position.
After completing the desired number of repetitions, rotate the bar to rack the weight.
Pecho.instructions_es: Position a Declinado bench in the rack so that the bar will be above your Pecho. Load an appropriate weight and take your place on the bench. Rotate the bar to unhook it from the rack and fully extend your arms. Your Espalda should be slightly arched and your Hombro blades retracted. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement by flexing your arms, Bajoering the bar to your Pecho. Pause brieAperturas, and then extend your arms to push the weight Espalda to the starting position. After completing the desired number of repetitions, rotate the bar to rack the weight.

Pecho.name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your upper chest is aligned with the barbell. Using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your upper chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your upper chest is aligned with the barbell. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the bar Espalda in the rack.

Pecho.name: Standing Cable Chest Press
Pecho.instructions:
Position dual pulleys to chest height and select an appropriate weight. Stand a foot or two in front of the cables, holding one in each hand. You can stagger your stance for better stability.
Position the upper arm at a 90 degree angle with the shoulder blades together. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the rest of the body stationary, extend through the elbows to press the handles forward, drawing them together in front of you.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Position dual pulleys to chest height and select an appropriate weight. Stand a foot or two in front of the cables, holding one in each hand. You can stagger your stance for better stability.
Position the upper arm at a 90 degree angle with the shoulder blades together. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the rest of the body stationary, extend through the elbows to press the handles forward, drawing them together in front of you.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_es: Position dual pulleys to Pecho height and select an appropriate weight. Stand a foot or two in Frontal of the Poleas, holding one in each hand. You can stagger your stance for better stability. Position the upper arm at a 90 degree angle with the Hombro blades together. This will be your starting position. Keeping the rest of the body stationary, extend through the elbows to Press the handles forward, drawing them together in Frontal of you. Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Straight-arm Mancuerna Pullover
Pecho.instructions:
Place a dumbbell standing up on a flat bench.
Ensuring that the dumbbell stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with feet firmly on the floor. The head will be off the bench as well.
Grasp the dumbbell with both hands and hold it straight over your chest at arms length. Both palms should be pressing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbbell. This will be your starting position.
Caution: Always ensure that the dumbbell used for this exercise is secure. Using a dumbbell with loose plates can result in the dumbbell falling apart and falling on your face.
While keeping your arms straight, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the dumbbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Place a dumbbell standing up on a flat bench.
Ensuring that the dumbbell stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with feet firmly on the floor. The head will be off the bench as well.
Grasp the dumbbell with both hands and hold it straight over your chest at arms length. Both palms should be pressing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbbell. This will be your starting position.

Ensuring that the Mancuerna stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso across it as in forming a cross) with only your Hombros Recostado on the surface. Caderas should be beBajo the bench and Piernas bent with feet firmly on the Suelo. The head will be off the bench as well. Grasp the Mancuerna with both hands and hold it straight over your Pecho at arms length. Both palms should be Pressing against the underLateral one of the Laterals of the Mancuerna. This will be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the Mancuerna used for this exercise is secure. Using a Mancuerna with loose Discos can result in the Mancuerna falling apart and falling on your face. While keeping your arms straight, Bajoer the weight sBajoly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the Pecho. At that point, bring the Mancuerna Espalda to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was Bajoered and exhale as you perform this movement. Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Suspended Push-up
Pecho.instructions:
Anchor your suspension straps securely to the top of a rack or other object.
Leaning into the straps, take a handle in each hand and move into a push-up plank position. You should be as close to parallel to the ground as you can manage with your arms fully extended, maintaining good posture.
Maintaining a straight, rigid torso, descend slowly by allowing the elbows to flex.
Continue until your elbows break 90 degrees, pausing before you extend to return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Anchor your suspension straps securely to the top of a rack or other object.
Leaning into the straps, take a handle in each hand and move into a push-up plank position. You should be as close to parallel to the ground as you can manage with your arms fully extended, maintaining good posture.
Maintaining a straight, rigid torso, descend slowly by allowing the elbows to flex.
Continue until your elbows break 90 degrees, pausing before you extend to return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_es: Anchor your suspension straps securely to the top of a rack or other object. Leaning into the straps, take a handle in each hand and move into a push-up Plancha position. You should be as close to parallel to the ground as you can manage with your arms fully extended, maintaining good posture. Maintaining a straight, rigid torso, descend sBajoly by alBajoing the elbows to flex. Continue until your elbows break 90 degrees, pausing before you extend to return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Svend Press
Pecho.instructions:
Begin in a standing position.
Press two lightweight plates together with your hands. Hold the plates together close to your chest to create an isometric contraction in your chest muscles. Your fingers should be pointed forward. This is your starting position.
Squeeze the plates between your palms and extend your arms directly out in front of you in a controlled motion.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then slowly return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Begin in a standing position.
Press two lightweight plates together with your hands. Hold the plates together close to your chest to create an isometric contraction in your chest muscles. Your fingers should be pointed forward. This is your starting position.
Squeeze the plates between your palms and extend your arms directly out in front of you in a controlled motion.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then slowly return to the starting position.
Pecho.instructions_es: Begin in a De Pie position. Press two lightweight Discos together with your hands. Hold the Discos together close to your Pecho to create an isometric contraction in your Pecho Muslos. Your fingers should be pointed forward. This is your starting position. Squeeze the Discos between your palms and extend your arms directly out in Frontal of you in a controlled motion. Pause at the top of the motion, and then sBajoly return to the starting position.

Pecho.name: Wide-grip Barbell Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on a flat bench with feet firm on the floor. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the floor. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your middle chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:

Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the Suelo. This will be your starting position. As you breathe in, come down sBajoly until you feel the bar on your middle Pecho. Lock your arms and squeeze your Pecho in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Wide-grip Decline Barbell Bench Press
Pecho.instructions:
Lie back on a decline bench with the feet securely locked at the front of the bench. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the floor. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your lower chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie back on a decline bench with the feet securely locked at the front of the bench. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the floor. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you feel the bar on your lower chest.
After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie Espalda on a Declinado bench with the feet securely locked at the Frontal of the bench. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from Hombro width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar will be perpendicular to the torso and the Suelo. This will be your starting position. As you breathe in, come down sBajoly until you feel the bar on your Bajoer Pecho. After a second pause, bring the bar Espalda to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your Pecho Muslos. Lock your arms and squeeze your Pecho in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down sBajoly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Pecho.name: Agarre Ancho Declinado Barra Pullover
Pecho.instructions:
Lie down on a decline bench with both legs securely locked in position. Reach for the barbell behind the head using a pronated grip (palms facing out). Make sure to grab the barbell wider than shoulder width apart for this exercise. Slowly lift the barbell up from the floor by using your arms.
When positioned properly, your arms should be fully extended and perpendicular to the floor. This is the starting position.
Begin by moving the barbell back down in a semicircular motion as if you were going to place it on the floor, but instead, stop when the arms are parallel to the floor. Tip: Keep the arms fully extended at all times. The movement should only happen at the shoulder joint. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Now bring the barbell up while exhaling until you are back at the starting position. Remember to keep full control of the barbell at all times.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
When finished with your set, slowly lower the barbell back down until it is level with your head and release it.
Pecho.instructions_en:
Lie down on a decline bench with both legs securely locked in position. Reach for the barbell behind the head using a pronated grip (palms facing out). Make sure to grab the barbell wider than shoulder width apart for this exercise. Slowly lift the barbell up from the floor by using your arms.
When positioned properly, your arms should be fully extended and perpendicular to the floor. This is the starting position.
Begin by moving the barbell back down in a semicircular motion as if you were going to place it on the floor, but instead, stop when the arms are parallel to the floor. Tip: Keep the arms fully extended at all times. The movement should only happen at the shoulder joint. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Now bring the barbell up while exhaling until you are back at the starting position. Remember to keep full control of the barbell at all times.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
When finished with your set, slowly lower the barbell back down until it is level with your head and release it.
Pecho.instructions_es: Lie down on a Declinado bench with both Piernas securely locked in position. Reach for the Barra behind the head using a pronated grip (palms facing out). Make sure to grab the Barra wider than Hombro width apart for this exercise. SBajoly lift the Barra up from the Suelo by using your arms. When positioned properly, your arms should be fully extended and perpendicular to the Suelo. This is the starting position. Begin by moving the Barra Espalda down in a semicircular motion as if you were going to place it on the Suelo, but instead, stop when the arms are parallel to the Suelo. Tip: Keep the arms fully extended at all times. The movement should only happen at the Hombro joint. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Now bring the Barra up while exhaling until you are Espalda at the starting position. Remember to keep full control of the Barra at all times. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program. When finished with your set, sBajoly Bajoer the Barra Espalda down until it is level with your head and release it.

Antebrazos.name: Bottoms-up Cargada From The Colgado Position
Antebrazos.instructions:
Initiate the exercise by standing upright with a kettlebell in one hand.
Swing the kettlebell back forcefully and then reverse the motion forcefully. Crush the kettlebell handle as hard as possible and raise the kettlebell to your shoulder.
Antebrazos.name_en: Bottoms-Up Clean From The Hang Position
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Initiate the exercise by standing upright with a kettlebell in one hand.
Swing the kettlebell back forcefully and then reverse the motion forcefully. Crush the kettlebell handle as hard as possible and raise the kettlebell to your shoulder.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Initiate the exercise by De Pie Vertical with a Pesa Rusa in one hand. Swing the Pesa Rusa Espalda forcefully and then Inverso the motion forcefully. Crush the Pesa Rusa handle as hard as possible and Elevación the Pesa Rusa to your Hombro.

Antebrazos.name: Cable Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start out by placing a flat bench in front of a low pulley cable that has a straight bar attachment.
Use your arms to grab the cable bar with a narrow to shoulder width supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the top of your thighs. Your wrists should be hanging just beyond your knees.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling. Keep the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Start out by placing a flat bench in front of a low pulley cable that has a straight bar attachment.
Use your arms to grab the cable bar with a narrow to shoulder width supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the top of your thighs. Your wrists should be hanging just beyond your knees.

Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.

Antebrazos.instructions_es: Start out by placing a flat bench in Frontal of a Bajo pulley Polea that has a straight bar attachment. Use your arms to grab the Polea bar with a narRemo to Hombro width supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your foPosteriorms are resting against the top of your tAltos. Your Muñecas should be Colgadoing just beyond your knees. Start out by Curling your Muñeca upwards and exhaling. Keep the contraction for a second. SBajoly Bajoer your Muñecas Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Your foPosteriorms should be stationary as your Muñeca is the only movement needed to perform this exercise. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Antebrazos.name: Mancuerna Recostado Pronation
Antebrazos.instructions:
Lie on a flat bench face down with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbbell so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm.
Now raise the upper arm so that the forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the upper arm is perpendicular to your torso. Tip: The upper arm should be parallel to the floor and also creating a 90-degree angle with your torso. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe out, externally rotate your forearm so that the dumbbell is lifted forward as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the forearm. You will continue this external rotation until the forearm is parallel to the floor. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Lie on a flat bench face down with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbbell so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm.
Now raise the upper arm so that the forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the upper arm is perpendicular to your torso. Tip: The upper arm should be parallel to the floor and also creating a 90-degree angle with your torso. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe out, externally rotate your forearm so that the dumbbell is lifted forward as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the forearm. You will continue this external rotation until the forearm is parallel to the floor. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Lie on a flat bench face down with Un Brazo holding a Mancuerna and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it. Bend the elbows of the arm holding the Mancuerna so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the foPosteriorm. Now Elevación the upper arm so that the foPosteriorm is perpendicular to the Suelo and the upper arm is perpendicular to your torso. Tip: The upper arm should be parallel to the Suelo and also creating a 90-degree angle with your torso. This will be your starting position. As you breathe out, externally rotate your foPosteriorm so that the Mancuerna is lifted forward as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the foPosteriorm. You will continue this external rotation until the foPosteriorm is parallel to the Suelo. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second. As you breathe in, sBajoly go Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Antebrazos.name: Mancuerna Recostado Supination
Antebrazos.instructions:
Lie sideways on a flat bench with one arm holding a dumbbell and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbbell so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the forearm.
Now raise the upper arm so that the forearm is parallel to the floor and perpendicular to your torso (Tip: So the forearm will be directly in front of you). The upper arm will be stationary by your torso and should be parallel to the floor (aligned with your torso at all times). This will be your starting position.
As you breathe out, externally rotate your forearm so that the dumbbell is lifted up in a semicircle motion as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the forearm. You will continue this external rotation until the forearm is perpendicular to the floor and the torso pointing towards the ceiling. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:

As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Lie Lateralways on a flat bench with Un Brazo holding a Mancuerna and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it. Bend the elbows of the arm holding the Mancuerna so that it creates a 90-degree angle between the upper arm and the foPosteriorm. Now Elevación the upper arm so that the foPosteriorm is parallel to the Suelo and perpendicular to your torso (Tip: So the foPosteriorm will be directly in Frontal of you). The upper arm will be stationary by your torso and should be parallel to the Suelo (aligned with your torso at all times). This will be your starting position. As you breathe out, externally rotate your foPosteriorm so that the Mancuerna is lifted up in a semicircle motion as you maintain the 90 degree angle bend between the upper arms and the foPosteriorm. You will continue this external rotation until the foPosteriorm is perpendicular to the Suelo and the torso pointing towards the ceiling. At this point you will hold the contraction for a second. As you breathe in, sBajoly go Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

Antebrazos.name: Paseo del Granjero
Antebrazos.instructions:
There are various implements that can be used for the farmers walk. These can also be performed with heavy dumbbells or short bars if these implements aren't available. Begin by standing between the implements.
After gripping the handles, lift them up by driving through your heels, keeping your back straight and your head up.
Walk taking short, quick steps, and don't forget to breathe. Move for a given distance, typically 50-100 feet, as fast as possible.

Antebrazos.instructions_es: There are various implements that can be used for the farmers walk. These can also be performed with heavy Mancuernas or short bars if these implements aren't available. Begin by De Pie between the implements. After gripping the handles, lift them up by driving through your heels, keeping your Espalda straight and your head up. Walk taking short, quick steps, and don't forget to breathe. Move for a given distance, typically 50-100 feet, as fast as possible.

Antebrazos.name: Curls de Dedos
Antebrazos.instructions:
Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible by extending the fingers. Allowing the bar to roll down the hands, catch the bar with the final joint in the fingers.
Now curl bar up as high as possible by closing your hands while exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible by extending the fingers. Allowing the bar to roll down the hands, catch the bar with the final joint in the fingers.
Now curl bar up as high as possible by closing your hands while exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Hold a Barra with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about Hombro width. Place your feet flat on the Suelo, at a distance that is slightly wider than Hombro width apart. This will be your starting position. Bajoer the bar as far as possible by extending the fingers. AlBajoing the bar to roll down the hands, catch the bar with the final joint in the fingers. Now Curl bar up as Alto as possible by closing your hands while exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top.

Antebrazos.name: Kneeling Forearm Stretch
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start by kneeling on a mat with your palms flat and your fingers pointing back toward your knees.
Slowly lean back keeping your palms flat on the floor until you feel a stretch in your wrists and forearms. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Start by kneeling on a mat with your palms flat and your fingers pointing back toward your knees.
Slowly lean back keeping your palms flat on the floor until you feel a stretch in your wrists and forearms. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Start by Arrodillado on a mat with your palms flat and your fingers pointing Espalda toward your knees. SBajoly lean Espalda keeping your palms flat on the Suelo until you feel a stretch in your Muñecas and foPosteriorms. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

Antebrazos.name: Palms-down Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start out by placing two dumbbells on one side of a flat bench.
Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells with a pronated grip (palms facing down) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
