Antebrazos.name: Disco Pinch
Antebrazos.instructions:
Grab two wide-rimmed plates and put them together with the smooth sides facing outward
Use your fingers to grip the outside part of the plate and your thumb for the other side thus holding both plates together. This is the starting position.
Squeeze the plate with your fingers and thumb. Hold this position for as long as you can.
Repeat for the recommended amount of sets prescribed in your program.
Switch arms and repeat the movements.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Grab two wide-rimmed plates and put them together with the smooth sides facing outward
Use your fingers to grip the outside part of the plate and your thumb for the other side thus holding both plates together. This is the starting position.

Switch arms and repeat the movements.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Grab two wide-rimmed Discos and put them together with the smooth Laterals facing outward Use your fingers to grip the outLateral part of the Disco and your thumb for the other Lateral thus holding both Discos together. This is the starting position. Squeeze the Disco with your fingers and thumb. Hold this position for as long as you can. Repeat for the recommended amount of sets prescribed in your program. Switch arms and repeat the movements.

Antebrazos.name: Rickshaw Carry
Antebrazos.instructions:
Position the frame at the starting point, and load with the appropriate weight. Standing in the center of the frame, begin by gripping the handles and driving through your heels to lift the frame. Ensure your chest and head are up and your back is straight.
Immediately begin walking briskly with quick, controlled steps. Keep your chest up and head forward, and make sure you continue breathing. Bring the frame to the ground after you have reached the end point.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:

Immediately begin walking briskly with quick, controlled steps. Keep your chest up and head forward, and make sure you continue breathing. Bring the frame to the ground after you have reached the end point.

De Pie in the center of the frame, begin by gripping the handles and driving through your heels to lift the frame. Ensure your Pecho and head are up and your Espalda is straight. Antebrazos.name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-down Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start out by placing two dumbbells on the floor in front of a flat bench.
Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your legs at about shoulder width apart. Make sure to keep your feet on the floor.
Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against your thighs with the palms of the hands facing down. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge of your thighs.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, simply lower the dumbbells to the floor.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Start out by placing two dumbbells on the floor in front of a flat bench.

Antebrazos.instructions_es: Start out by placing two Mancuernas on the Suelo in Frontal of a flat bench. Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your Piernas at about Hombro width apart. Use your arms to grab both of the Mancuernas and bring them up so that your foPosteriorms are resting against your tAltos with the palms of the hands facing down. Your Muñecas should be Colgadoing over the edge of your tAltos. Start out by Curling your Muñeca upwards and exhaling. SBajoly Bajoer your Muñecas Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your foPosteriorms should be stationary as your Muñeca is the only movement needed to perform this exercise. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. When finished, simply Bajoer the Mancuernas to the Suelo.

Antebrazos.name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-up Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start out by placing two dumbbells on the floor in front of a flat bench.
Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your legs at about shoulder width apart. Make sure to keep your feet on the floor.
Use your arms to grab both of the dumbbells and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against your thighs with the palms of the hands facing up. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge of your thighs.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, simply lower the dumbbells to the floor.

Antebrazos.name: Seated One-arm Dumbbell Palms-down Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in your right hand.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your right forearm on top of your upper right thigh with your palm down. Tip: Make sure that the back of the wrist lies on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the dumbbell as far as possible as you keep a tight grip on the dumbbell. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Now curl the dumbbell as high as possible as you contract the forearms and as you exhale. Keep the contraction for a second before you lower again. Tip: The only movement should happen at the wrist.
Perform for the recommended amount of repetitions, switch arms and repeat the movement.

Antebrazos.name: Seated One-arm Dumbbell Palms-up Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:

Lean forward and place your right forearm on top of your upper right thigh with your palm up. Tip: Make sure that the front of the wrist lies on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.

Antebrazos.name: Seated Palm-up Barbell Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your feet flat on the floor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your forearms on top of your upper thighs with your palms up. Tip: Make sure that the front of the wrists lay on top of your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible while inhaling and keeping a tight grip.
Now curl bar up as high as possible while flexing the forearms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the wrist should move.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:

Now Curl bar up as Alto as possible while flexing the foPosteriorms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the Muñeca should move.

Now curl bar up as high as possible while flexing the forearms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the wrist should move.

Antebrazos.name: Seated Two-arm Palms-up Low-pulley Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Put a bench in front of a low pulley machine that has a barbell or EZ Curl attachment on it.
Move the bench far enough away so that when you bring the handle to the top of your thighs tension is created on the cable due to the weight stack being moved up.
Now hold the handle with both hands, palms up, using a shoulder-width grip.
Step back and sit on the bench with your feet about shoulder width apart, firmly on the floor.
Lean forward and place the forearms on your thighs with the back of your wrists over your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible, while inhaling and keeping a tight grip.
Now curl the bar up as high as possible while contracting the forearms. Tip: Only the wrist should move; not the forearms.
After a second contraction at the top go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.name_en: Seated Two-Arm Palms-Up Low-Pulley Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Put a bench in front of a low pulley machine that has a barbell or EZ Curl attachment on it.
Move the bench far enough away so that when you bring the handle to the top of your thighs tension is created on the cable due to the weight stack being moved up.
Now hold the handle with both hands, palms up, using a shoulder-width grip.
Step back and sit on the bench with your feet about shoulder width apart, firmly on the floor.
Lean forward and place the forearms on your thighs with the back of your wrists over your knees. This will be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as possible, while inhaling and keeping a tight grip.
Now curl the bar up as high as possible while contracting the forearms. Tip: Only the wrist should move; not the forearms.
After a second contraction at the top go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Put a bench in Frontal of a Bajo pulley Máquina that has a Barra or EZ Curl attachment on it. Move the bench far enough away so that when you bring the handle to the top of your tAltos tension is created on the Polea due to the weight stack being moved up. Now hold the handle with both hands, palms up, using a Hombro-width grip. Step Espalda and sit on the bench with your feet about Hombro width apart, firmly on the Suelo. Lean forward and place the foPosteriorms on your tAltos with the Espalda of your Muñecas over your knees. This will be your starting position. Bajoer the bar as far as possible, while inhaling and keeping a tight grip. Now Curl the bar up as Alto as possible while contracting the foPosteriorms. Tip: Only the Muñeca should move; not the foPosteriorms. After a second contraction at the top go Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Antebrazos.name: Standing Palms-up Barbell Behind The Back Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start by standing straight and holding a barbell behind your glutes at arm's length while using a pronated grip (palms will be facing back away from the glutes) and having your hands shoulder width apart from each other.
You should be looking straight forward while your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, slowly elevate the barbell up by curling your wrist in a semi-circular motion towards the ceiling. Note: Your wrist should be the only body part moving for this exercise.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbell back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, lower the barbell down to the squat rack or the floor by bending the knees. Tip: It is easiest to either pick it up from a squat rack or have a partner hand it to you.
Antebrazos.name_en: Standing Palms-Up Barbell Behind The Back Wrist Curl
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Start by standing straight and holding a barbell behind your glutes at arm's length while using a pronated grip (palms will be facing back away from the glutes) and having your hands shoulder width apart from each other.
You should be looking straight forward while your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, slowly elevate the barbell up by curling your wrist in a semi-circular motion towards the ceiling. Note: Your wrist should be the only body part moving for this exercise.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbell back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
When finished, lower the barbell down to the squat rack or the floor by bending the knees. Tip: It is easiest to either pick it up from a squat rack or have a partner hand it to you.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Start by De Pie straight and holding a Barra behind your Glúteos at arm's length while using a pronated grip (palms will be facing Espalda away from the Glúteos) and having your hands Hombro width apart from each other. You should be looking straight forward while your feet are Hombro width apart from each other. This is the starting position. While exhaling, sBajoly elevate the Barra up by Curling your Muñeca in a semi-circular motion towards the ceiling. Note: Your Muñeca should be the only body part moving for this exercise. Hold the contraction for a second and Bajoer the Barra Espalda down to the starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. When finished, Bajoer the Barra down to the Sentadilla rack or the Suelo by bending the knees. Tip: It is easiest to either pick it up from a Sentadilla rack or have a partner hand it to you.

Antebrazos.name: Muñeca Circles
Antebrazos.instructions:
Start by standing straight with your feet being shoulder width apart from each other. Elevate your arms to the side of you until they are fully extended and parallel to the floor at a height that is evenly aligned with your shoulders. Tip: Your torso and arms should form the letter "T: Your palms should be facing down. This is the starting position.
Keeping your entire body stationary except for the wrists, begin to rotate both wrists forward in a circular motion. Tip: Pretend that you are trying to draw circles by using your hands as the brush. Breathe normally as you perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Start by standing straight with your feet being shoulder width apart from each other. Elevate your arms to the side of you until they are fully extended and parallel to the floor at a height that is evenly aligned with your shoulders. Tip: Your torso and arms should form the letter "T: Your palms should be facing down. This is the starting position.
Keeping your entire body stationary except for the wrists, begin to rotate both wrists forward in a circular motion. Tip: Pretend that you are trying to draw circles by using your hands as the brush. Breathe normally as you perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Start by De Pie straight with your feet being Hombro width apart from each other. Elevate your arms to the Lateral of you until they are fully extended and parallel to the Suelo at a height that is evenly aligned with your Hombros. Tip: Your torso and arms should form the letter "T: Your palms should be facing down. This is the starting position. Keeping your entire body stationary except for the Muñecas, begin to rotate both Muñecas forward in a circular motion. Tip: Pretend that you are trying to draw circles by using your hands as the brush. Breathe normally as you perform this exercise. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Antebrazos.name: Muñeca Roller
Antebrazos.instructions:
To begin, stand straight up grabbing a wrist roller using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your feet should be shoulder width apart.
Slowly lift both arms until they are fully extended and parallel to the floor in front of you. Note: Make sure the rope is not wrapped around the roller. Your entire body should be stationary except for the forearms. This is the starting position.
Rotate one wrist at a time in an upward motion to bring the weight up to the bar by rolling the rope around the roller.
Once the weight has reached the bar, slowly begin to lower the weight back down by rotating the wrist in a downward motion until the weight reaches the starting position.
Repeat for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
To begin, stand straight up grabbing a wrist roller using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your feet should be shoulder width apart.
Slowly lift both arms until they are fully extended and parallel to the floor in front of you. Note: Make sure the rope is not wrapped around the roller. Your entire body should be stationary except for the forearms. This is the starting position.
Rotate one wrist at a time in an upward motion to bring the weight up to the bar by rolling the rope around the roller.
Once the weight has reached the bar, slowly begin to lower the weight back down by rotating the wrist in a downward motion until the weight reaches the starting position.
Repeat for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: To begin, stand straight up grabbing a Muñeca roller using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your feet should be Hombro width apart. SBajoly lift both arms until they are fully extended and parallel to the Suelo in Frontal of you. Note: Make sure the rope is not wrapped around the roller. Your entire body should be stationary except for the foPosteriorms. This is the starting position. Rotate one Muñeca at a time in an upward motion to bring the weight up to the bar by rolling the rope around the roller. Once the weight has reached the bar, sBajoly begin to Bajoer the weight Espalda down by rotating the Muñeca in a downward motion until the weight reaches the starting position. Repeat for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.

Antebrazos.name: Muñeca Rotations With Straight Bar
Antebrazos.instructions:
Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Alternating between each of your hands, perform the movement by extending the wrist as though you were rolling up a newspaper. Continue alternating back and forth until failure.
Reverse the motion by flexing the wrist, rolling the opposite direction. Continue the alternating motion until failure.
Antebrazos.instructions_en:
Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Alternating between each of your hands, perform the movement by extending the wrist as though you were rolling up a newspaper. Continue alternating back and forth until failure.
Reverse the motion by flexing the wrist, rolling the opposite direction. Continue the alternating motion until failure.
Antebrazos.instructions_es: Hold a Barra with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about Hombro width. This will be your starting position. Alternando between each of your hands, perform the movement by extending the Muñeca as though you were rolling up a newspaper. Continue Alternando Espalda and forth until failure. Inverso the motion by flexing the Muñeca, rolling the opposite direction. Continue the Alternando motion until failure.

Glúteos.name: Ankle On The Knee
Glúteos.instructions:
From a lying position, bend your knees and keep your feet on the floor.
Place your ankle of one foot on your opposite knee.
Grasp the thigh or knee of the bottom leg and pull both of your legs into the chest. Relax your neck and shoulders. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
From a lying position, bend your knees and keep your feet on the floor.
Place your ankle of one foot on your opposite knee.
Grasp the thigh or knee of the bottom leg and pull both of your legs into the chest. Relax your neck and shoulders. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.
Glúteos.instructions_es: From a Recostado position, bend your knees and keep your feet on the Suelo. Place your ankle of one foot on your opposite knee. Grasp the tAlto or knee of the bottom Pierna and pull both of your Piernas into the Pecho. Relax your neck and Hombros. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch Laterals.

Glúteos.name: Puente de Glúteos
Glúteos.instructions:
Begin seated on the ground with a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lay down flat on the floor.
Begin the movement by driving through with your heels, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your upper back and the heels of your feet.
Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Begin seated on the ground with a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lay down flat on the floor.
Begin the movement by driving through with your heels, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your upper back and the heels of your feet.
Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Begin Sentado on the ground with a loaded Barra over your Piernas. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Roll the bar so that it is directly above your Caderas, and lay down flat on the Suelo. Begin the movement by driving through with your heels, extending your Caderas vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your upper Espalda and the heels of your feet. Extend as far as possible, then Inverso the motion to return to the starting position.

Glúteos.name: Barra Cadera Thrust
Glúteos.instructions:
Begin seated on the ground with a bench directly behind you. Have a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise.
Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lean back against the bench so that your shoulder blades are near the top of it.
Begin the movement by driving through your feet, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your shoulder blades and your feet. Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Begin seated on the ground with a bench directly behind you. Have a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise.
Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lean back against the bench so that your shoulder blades are near the top of it.
Begin the movement by driving through your feet, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your shoulder blades and your feet. Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Begin Sentado on the ground with a bench directly behind you. Have a loaded Barra over your Piernas. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Roll the bar so that it is directly above your Caderas, and lean Espalda against the bench so that your Hombro blades are near the top of it. Begin the movement by driving through your feet, extending your Caderas vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your Hombro blades and your feet. Extend as far as possible, then Inverso the motion to return to the starting position.

Glúteos.name: Butt Lift (Bridge)
Glúteos.instructions:
Lie flat on the floor on your back with the hands by your side and your knees bent. Your feet should be placed around shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Pushing mainly with your heels, lift your hips off the floor while keeping your back straight. Breathe out as you perform this part of the motion and hold at the top for a second.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Lie flat on the floor on your back with the hands by your side and your knees bent. Your feet should be placed around shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Pushing mainly with your heels, lift your hips off the floor while keeping your back straight. Breathe out as you perform this part of the motion and hold at the top for a second.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Lie flat on the Suelo on your Espalda with the hands by your Lateral and your knees bent. Your feet should be placed around Hombro width. This will be your starting position. Pushing mainly with your heels, lift your Caderas off the Suelo while keeping your Espalda straight. Breathe out as you perform this part of the motion and hold at the top for a second. SBajoly go Espalda to the starting position as you breathe in.

Glúteos.name: Balanceo Postura del Perro Boca Abajo
Glúteos.instructions:
Lie facedown on top of an exercise ball.
While resting on your stomach on the ball, walk your hands forward along the floor and lift your legs, extending your elbows and knees.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Lie facedown on top of an exercise ball.
While resting on your stomach on the ball, walk your hands forward along the floor and lift your legs, extending your elbows and knees.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Lie facedown on top of an exercise ball. While resting on your stomach on the ball, walk your hands forward along the Suelo and lift your Piernas, extending your elbows and knees.

Glúteos.name: Aleteo de Piernas
Glúteos.instructions:
On a flat bench lie facedown with the hips on the edge of the bench, the legs straight with toes high off the floor and with the arms on top of the bench holding on to the front edge.
Squeeze your glutes and hamstrings and straighten the legs until they are level with the hips. This will be your starting position.
Start the movement by lifting the left leg higher than the right leg.
Then lower the left leg as you lift the right leg.
Continue alternating in this manner (as though you are doing a flutter kick in water) until you have done the recommended amount of repetitions for each leg. Make sure that you keep a controlled movement at all times. Tip: You will breathe normally as you perform this movement.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
On a flat bench lie facedown with the hips on the edge of the bench, the legs straight with toes high off the floor and with the arms on top of the bench holding on to the front edge.
Squeeze your glutes and hamstrings and straighten the legs until they are level with the hips. This will be your starting position.
Start the movement by lifting the left leg higher than the right leg.
Then lower the left leg as you lift the right leg.
Continue alternating in this manner (as though you are doing a flutter kick in water) until you have done the recommended amount of repetitions for each leg. Make sure that you keep a controlled movement at all times. Tip: You will breathe normally as you perform this movement.
Glúteos.instructions_es: On a flat bench lie facedown with the Caderas on the edge of the bench, the Piernas straight with toes Alto off the Suelo and with the arms on top of the bench holding on to the Frontal edge. Squeeze your Glúteos and hamstrings and straighten the Piernas until they are level with the Caderas. This will be your starting position. Start the movement by lifting the left Pierna Altoer than the right Pierna. Then Bajoer the left Pierna as you lift the right Pierna. Continue Alternando in this manner (as though you are doing a flutter kick in water) until you have done the recommended amount of repetitions for each Pierna. Make sure that you keep a controlled movement at all times. Tip: You will breathe normally as you perform this movement.

Glúteos.name: Glúteo Patada
Glúteos.instructions:
Kneel on the floor or an exercise mat and bend at the waist with your arms extended in front of you (perpendicular to the torso) in order to get into a kneeling push-up position but with the arms spaced at shoulder width. Your head should be looking forward and the bend of the knees should create a 90-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, lift up your right leg until the hamstrings are in line with the back while maintaining the 90-degree angle bend. Contract the glutes throughout this movement and hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: At the end of the movement the upper leg should be parallel to the floor while the calf should be perpendicular to it.
Go back to the initial position as you inhale and now repeat with the left leg.
Continue to alternate legs until all of the recommended repetitions have been performed.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Kneel on the floor or an exercise mat and bend at the waist with your arms extended in front of you (perpendicular to the torso) in order to get into a kneeling push-up position but with the arms spaced at shoulder width. Your head should be looking forward and the bend of the knees should create a 90-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, lift up your right leg until the hamstrings are in line with the back while maintaining the 90-degree angle bend. Contract the glutes throughout this movement and hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: At the end of the movement the upper leg should be parallel to the floor while the calf should be perpendicular to it.
Go back to the initial position as you inhale and now repeat with the left leg.
Continue to alternate legs until all of the recommended repetitions have been performed.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Kneel on the Suelo or an exercise mat and bend at the waist with your arms extended in Frontal of you (perpendicular to the torso) in order to get into a Arrodillado push-up position but with the arms spaced at Hombro width. Your head should be looking forward and the bend of the knees should create a 90-degree angle between the hamstrings and the calves. This will be your starting position. As you exhale, lift up your right Pierna until the hamstrings are in line with the Espalda while maintaining the 90-degree angle bend. Contract the Glúteos throughout this movement and hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: At the end of the movement the upper Pierna should be parallel to the Suelo while the Gemelo should be perpendicular to it. Go Espalda to the initial position as you inhale and now repeat with the left Pierna. Continue to alternate Piernas until all of the recommended repetitions have been performed.

Glúteos.name: Cadera Extensión With Bandas
Glúteos.instructions:
Secure one end of the band to the lower portion of a post and attach the other to one ankle.
Facing the attachment point of the band, hold on to the column to stabilize yourself.
Keeping your head and your chest up, move the resisted leg back as far as you can while keeping the knee straight.
Return the leg to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Secure one end of the band to the lower portion of a post and attach the other to one ankle.
Facing the attachment point of the band, hold on to the column to stabilize yourself.
Keeping your head and your chest up, move the resisted leg back as far as you can while keeping the knee straight.
Return the leg to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Secure one end of the Banda to the Bajoer portion of a post and attach the other to one ankle. Facing the attachment point of the Banda, hold on to the column to stabilize yourself. Keeping your head and your Pecho up, move the resisted Pierna Espalda as far as you can while keeping the knee straight. Return the Pierna to the starting position.

Glúteos.name: Puente de Glúteos con Banda
Glúteos.instructions:
After choosing a suitable band, lay down in the middle of the rack, after securing the band on either side of you. If your rack doesn't have pegs, the band can be secured using heavy dumbbells or similar objects, just ensure they won't move.
Adjust your position so that the band is directly over your hips. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor. Your hands can be on the floor or holding the band in position.
Keeping your shoulders on the ground, drive through your heels to raise your hips, pushing into the band as high as you can.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
After choosing a suitable band, lay down in the middle of the rack, after securing the band on either side of you. If your rack doesn't have pegs, the band can be secured using heavy dumbbells or similar objects, just ensure they won't move.
Adjust your position so that the band is directly over your hips. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor. Your hands can be on the floor or holding the band in position.
Keeping your shoulders on the ground, drive through your heels to raise your hips, pushing into the band as high as you can.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: After choosing a suitable Banda, lay down in the middle of the rack, after securing the Banda on either Lateral of you. If your rack doesn't have pegs, the Banda can be secured using heavy Mancuernas or similar objects, just ensure they won't move. Adjust your position so that the Banda is directly over your Caderas. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the Suelo. Your hands can be on the Suelo or holding the Banda in position. Keeping your Hombros on the ground, drive through your heels to Elevación your Caderas, pushing into the Banda as Alto as you can. Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.

Glúteos.name: Rodilla Cruzada Sobre el Cuerpo
Glúteos.instructions:
Lie down on the floor with your right leg straight. Bend your left leg and lower it across your body, holding the knee down toward the floor with your right hand. (The knee doesn't need to touch the floor if you're tight.)
Place your left arm comfortably beside you and turn your head to the left. Imagine you have a weight tied to your tailbone. let your tailbone fall back toward the floor as your chest reaches in the opposite direction to stretch your lower back. Switch sides.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Lie down on the floor with your right leg straight. Bend your left leg and lower it across your body, holding the knee down toward the floor with your right hand. (The knee doesn't need to touch the floor if you're tight.)
Place your left arm comfortably beside you and turn your head to the left. Imagine you have a weight tied to your tailbone. let your tailbone fall back toward the floor as your chest reaches in the opposite direction to stretch your lower back. Switch sides.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Lie down on the Suelo with your right Pierna straight. Bend your left Pierna and Bajoer it across your body, holding the knee down toward the Suelo with your right hand. (The knee doesn't need to touch the Suelo if you're tight.) Place your left arm comfortably beLateral you and turn your head to the left. Imagine you have a weight tied to your tailbone. let your tailbone fall Espalda toward the Suelo as your Pecho reaches in the opposite direction to stretch your Bajoer Espalda. Switch Laterals.

Glúteos.name: Arrodillado Salto Sentadilla
Glúteos.instructions:
Begin kneeling on the floor with a barbell racked across the back of your shoulders, or you can use your body weight for this exercise. This can be done inside of a power rack to make unracking easier.
Sit back with your hips until your glutes touch your feet, keeping your head and chest up.
Explode up with your hips, generating enough power to land with your feet flat on the floor.
Continue with the squat by driving through your heels and extending the knees to come to a standing position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Begin kneeling on the floor with a barbell racked across the back of your shoulders, or you can use your body weight for this exercise. This can be done inside of a power rack to make unracking easier.
Sit back with your hips until your glutes touch your feet, keeping your head and chest up.
Explode up with your hips, generating enough power to land with your feet flat on the floor.
Continue with the squat by driving through your heels and extending the knees to come to a standing position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Begin Arrodillado on the Suelo with a Barra racked across the Espalda of your Hombros, or you can use your body weight for this exercise. This can be done inLateral of a Power rack to make unracking easier. Sit Espalda with your Caderas until your Glúteos touch your feet, keeping your head and Pecho up. Explode up with your Caderas, generating enough Power to land with your feet flat on the Suelo. Continue with the Sentadilla by driving through your heels and extending the knees to come to a De Pie position.

Glúteos.name: Sentadilla Arrodillado
Glúteos.instructions:
Set the bar to the proper height in a power rack. Kneel behind the bar; it may be beneficial to put a mat down to pad your knees. Slide under the bar, racking it across the back of your shoulders. Your shoulder blades should be retracted and the bar tight across your back. Unrack the weight.
With your head looking forward, sit back with your butt until you touch your calves.
Reverse the motion, returning the torso to an upright position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Set the bar to the proper height in a power rack. Kneel behind the bar; it may be beneficial to put a mat down to pad your knees. Slide under the bar, racking it across the back of your shoulders. Your shoulder blades should be retracted and the bar tight across your back. Unrack the weight.
With your head looking forward, sit back with your butt until you touch your calves.
Reverse the motion, returning the torso to an upright position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Set the bar to the proper height in a Power rack. Kneel behind the bar; it may be beneficial to put a mat down to pad your knees. Slide under the bar, racking it across the Espalda of your Hombros. Your Hombro blades should be retracted and the bar tight across your Espalda. Unrack the weight. With your head looking forward, sit Espalda with your butt until you touch your calves. Inverso the motion, returning the torso to an Vertical position.

Glúteos.name: Pierna Lift
Glúteos.instructions:
While standing up straight with both feet next to each other at around shoulder width, grab a sturdy surface such as the sides of a squat rack or the top of a chair to brace yourself and keep balance.
With or without an ankle weight, lift one leg behind you as if performing a leg curl but standing up while keeping the other leg straight. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Slowly bring the raised leg back to the floor as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Repeat the movement with the opposite leg.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
While standing up straight with both feet next to each other at around shoulder width, grab a sturdy surface such as the sides of a squat rack or the top of a chair to brace yourself and keep balance.
With or without an ankle weight, lift one leg behind you as if performing a leg curl but standing up while keeping the other leg straight. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Slowly bring the raised leg back to the floor as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Repeat the movement with the opposite leg.
Glúteos.instructions_es: While De Pie up straight with both feet next to each other at around Hombro width, grab a sturdy surface such as the Laterals of a Sentadilla rack or the top of a chair to brace yourself and keep balance. With or without an ankle weight, lift one Pierna behind you as if performing a Pierna Curl but De Pie up while keeping the other Pierna straight. Breathe out as you perform this movement. SBajoly bring the Elevaciónd Pierna Espalda to the Suelo as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Repeat the movement with the opposite Pierna.

Glúteos.name: Recostado Glúteo
Glúteos.instructions:
Lie on your back with your partner kneeling beside you.
Flex the hip of one leg, raising it off of the floor. Rotate the leg so the foot is over the opposite hip, the lower leg perpendicular to your body. Your partner should hold the knee and ankle in place. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your leg towards your partner, who should be preventing any actual movement of the leg.
After 10-20 seconds, completely relax as your partner gently pushes the ankle and knee towards your chest. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Lie on your back with your partner kneeling beside you.
Flex the hip of one leg, raising it off of the floor. Rotate the leg so the foot is over the opposite hip, the lower leg perpendicular to your body. Your partner should hold the knee and ankle in place. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your leg towards your partner, who should be preventing any actual movement of the leg.
After 10-20 seconds, completely relax as your partner gently pushes the ankle and knee towards your chest. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Lie on your Espalda with your partner Arrodillado beLateral you. Flex the Cadera of one Pierna, raising it off of the Suelo. Rotate the Pierna so the foot is over the opposite Cadera, the Bajoer Pierna perpendicular to your body. Your partner should hold the knee and ankle in place. This will be your starting position. Attempt to push your Pierna towards your partner, who should be preventing any actual movement of the Pierna. After 10-20 seconds, completely relax as your partner gently pushes the ankle and knee towards your Pecho. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.

Glúteos.name: One-piernaged Polea Patada
Glúteos.instructions:
Hook a leather ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and then attach the cuff to your ankle.
Face the weight stack from a distance of about two feet, grasping the steel frame for support.
While keeping your knees and hips bent slightly and your abs tight, contract your glutes to slowly "kick" the working leg back in a semicircular arc as high as it will comfortably go as you breathe out. Tip: At full extension, squeeze your glutes for a second in order to achieve a peak contraction.
Now slowly bring your working leg forward, resisting the pull of the cable until you reach the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement for the other side.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Hook a leather ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and then attach the cuff to your ankle.
Face the weight stack from a distance of about two feet, grasping the steel frame for support.
While keeping your knees and hips bent slightly and your abs tight, contract your glutes to slowly "kick" the working leg back in a semicircular arc as high as it will comfortably go as you breathe out. Tip: At full extension, squeeze your glutes for a second in order to achieve a peak contraction.
Now slowly bring your working leg forward, resisting the pull of the cable until you reach the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement for the other side.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Hook a leather ankle cuff to a Bajo Polea pulley and then attach the cuff to your ankle. Face the weight stack from a distance of about two feet, grasping the steel frame for support. While keeping your knees and Caderas bent slightly and your abs tight, contract your Glúteos to sBajoly "kick" the working Pierna Espalda in a semicircular arc as Alto as it will comfortably go as you breathe out. Tip: At full Extensión, squeeze your Glúteos for a second in order to achieve a peak contraction. Now sBajoly bring your working Pierna forward, resisting the pull of the Polea until you reach the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Switch Piernas and repeat the movement for the other Lateral.

Glúteos.name: One Knee To Pecho
Glúteos.instructions:
Start off by lying on the floor.
Extend one leg straight and pull the other knee to your chest. Hold under the knee joint to protect the kneecap.
Gently tug that knee toward your nose.
Switch sides. This stretches the buttocks and lower back of the bent leg and the hip flexor of the straight leg.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Start off by lying on the floor.
Extend one leg straight and pull the other knee to your chest. Hold under the knee joint to protect the kneecap.
Gently tug that knee toward your nose.
Switch sides. This stretches the buttocks and lower back of the bent leg and the hip flexor of the straight leg.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Start off by Recostado on the Suelo. Extend one Pierna straight and pull the other knee to your Pecho. Hold under the knee joint to protect the kneecap. Gently tug that knee toward your nose. Switch Laterals. This stretches the buttocks and Bajoer Espalda of the bent Pierna and the Cadera flexor of the straight Pierna.

Glúteos.name: Physioball Cadera Bridge
Glúteos.instructions:
Lay on a ball so that your upper back is on the ball with your hips unsupported. Both feet should be flat on the floor, hip width apart or wider. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips using your glutes and hamstrings, raising your hips upward as you bridge.
Pause at the top of the motion and return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Lay on a ball so that your upper back is on the ball with your hips unsupported. Both feet should be flat on the floor, hip width apart or wider. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips using your glutes and hamstrings, raising your hips upward as you bridge.
Pause at the top of the motion and return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Lay on a ball so that your upper Espalda is on the ball with your Caderas unsupported. Both feet should be flat on the Suelo, Cadera width apart or wider. This will be your starting position. Begin by extending the Caderas using your Glúteos and hamstrings, raising your Caderas upward as you bridge. Pause at the top of the motion and return to the starting position.

Glúteos.name: Piriformis-smr
Glúteos.instructions:
Sit with your buttocks on top of a foam roll. Bend your knees, and then cross one leg so that the ankle is over the knee. This will be your starting position.
Shift your weight to the side of the crossed leg, rolling over the buttocks until you feel tension in your upper glute. You may assist the stretch by using one hand to pull the bent knee towards your chest. Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Sit with your buttocks on top of a foam roll. Bend your knees, and then cross one leg so that the ankle is over the knee. This will be your starting position.
Shift your weight to the side of the crossed leg, rolling over the buttocks until you feel tension in your upper glute. You may assist the stretch by using one hand to pull the bent knee towards your chest. Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Sit with your buttocks on top of a foam roll. Bend your knees, and then cross one Pierna so that the ankle is over the knee. This will be your starting position. Shift your weight to the Lateral of the crossed Pierna, rolling over the buttocks until you feel tension in your upper Glúteo. You may assist the stretch by using one hand to pull the bent knee towards your Pecho. Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, and then switch Laterals.

Glúteos.name: Pull Through
Glúteos.instructions:
Begin standing a few feet in front of a low pulley with a rope or handle attached. Face away from the machine, straddling the cable, with your feet set wide apart.
Begin the movement by reaching through your legs as far as possible, bending at the hips. Keep your knees slightly bent. Keeping your arms straight, extend through the hip to stand straight up. Avoid pulling upward through the shoulders; all of the motion should originate through the hips.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Begin standing a few feet in front of a low pulley with a rope or handle attached. Face away from the machine, straddling the cable, with your feet set wide apart.
Begin the movement by reaching through your legs as far as possible, bending at the hips. Keep your knees slightly bent. Keeping your arms straight, extend through the hip to stand straight up. Avoid pulling upward through the shoulders; all of the motion should originate through the hips.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Begin De Pie a few feet in Frontal of a Bajo pulley with a rope or handle attached. Face away from the Máquina, straddling the Polea, with your feet set wide apart. Begin the movement by reaching through your Piernas as far as possible, bending at the Caderas. Keep your knees slightly bent. Keeping your arms straight, extend through the Cadera to stand straight up. Avoid pulling upward through the Hombros; all of the motion should originate through the Caderas.

Glúteos.name: Sentado Glúteo
Glúteos.instructions:
In a seated position with your knees bent, cross one ankle over the opposite knee. Your partner will stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
In a seated position with your knees bent, cross one ankle over the opposite knee. Your partner will stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.
Glúteos.instructions_es: In a Sentado position with your knees bent, cross one ankle over the opposite knee. Your partner will stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your Hombros with their hands. This will be your starting position. Attempt to push your torso Espalda for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso. Now relax your Muslos as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.

Glúteos.name: Una Pierna Glúteo Bridge
Glúteos.instructions:
Lay on the floor with your feet flat and knees bent.
Raise one leg off of the ground, pulling the knee to your chest. This will be your starting position.
Execute the movement by driving through the heel, extending your hip upward and raising your glutes off of the ground.
Extend as far as possible, pause and then return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Lay on the floor with your feet flat and knees bent.
Raise one leg off of the ground, pulling the knee to your chest. This will be your starting position.
Execute the movement by driving through the heel, extending your hip upward and raising your glutes off of the ground.
Extend as far as possible, pause and then return to the starting position.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Lay on the Suelo with your feet flat and knees bent. Elevación one Pierna off of the ground, pulling the knee to your Pecho. This will be your starting position. Execute the movement by driving through the heel, extending your Cadera upward and raising your Glúteos off of the ground. Extend as far as possible, pause and then return to the starting position.

Glúteos.name: Step-up With Elevación de Rodillas
Glúteos.instructions:
Stand facing a box or bench of an appropriate height with your feet together. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by stepping up, putting your left foot on the top of the bench. Extend through the hip and knee of your front leg to stand up on the box. As you stand on the box with your left leg, flex your right knee and hip, bringing your knee as high as you can.
Reverse this motion to step down off the box, and then repeat the sequence on the opposite leg.
Glúteos.instructions_en:
Stand facing a box or bench of an appropriate height with your feet together. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by stepping up, putting your left foot on the top of the bench. Extend through the hip and knee of your front leg to stand up on the box. As you stand on the box with your left leg, flex your right knee and hip, bringing your knee as high as you can.
Reverse this motion to step down off the box, and then repeat the sequence on the opposite leg.
Glúteos.instructions_es: Stand facing a Cajón or bench of an appropriate height with your feet together. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement by stepping up, putting your left foot on the top of the bench. Extend through the Cadera and knee of your Frontal Pierna to stand up on the Cajón. As you stand on the Cajón with your left Pierna, flex your right knee and Cadera, bringing your knee as Alto as you can. Inverso this motion to step down off the Cajón, and then repeat the sequence on the opposite Pierna.

Isquiotibiales.name: 90/90 Hamstring
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Lie on your back, with one leg extended straight out.
With the other leg, bend the hip and knee to 90 degrees. You may brace your leg with your hands if necessary. This will be your starting position.
Extend your leg straight into the air, pausing briefly at the top. Return the leg to the starting position.
Repeat for 10-20 repetitions, and then switch to the other leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Lie on your back, with one leg extended straight out.
With the other leg, bend the hip and knee to 90 degrees. You may brace your leg with your hands if necessary. This will be your starting position.
Extend your leg straight into the air, pausing briefly at the top. Return the leg to the starting position.
Repeat for 10-20 repetitions, and then switch to the other leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Lie on your Espalda, with one Pierna extended straight out. With the other Pierna, bend the Cadera and knee to 90 degrees. You may brace your Pierna with your hands if necessary. This will be your starting position. Extend your Pierna straight into the air, pausing brieAperturas at the top. Return the Pierna to the starting position. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions, and then switch to the other Pierna.

Isquiotibiales.name: Alternando Colgado Cargada
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.
Clean one kettlebell to your shoulder and hold on to the other kettlebell in a hanging position. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so.
Lower the cleaned kettlebell to a hanging position and clean the alternate kettlebell. Repeat.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.
Clean one kettlebell to your shoulder and hold on to the other kettlebell in a hanging position. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so.
Lower the cleaned kettlebell to a hanging position and clean the alternate kettlebell. Repeat.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Place two Pesa Rusas between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt Espalda and look straight ahead. Cargada one Pesa Rusa to your Hombro and hold on to the other Pesa Rusa in a Colgadoing position. Cargada the Pesa Rusa to your Hombro by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you pull the Pesa Rusa towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñeca as you do so. Bajoer the Cargadaed Pesa Rusa to a Colgadoing position and Cargada the alternate Pesa Rusa. Repeat.

Isquiotibiales.name: Ball Leg Curl
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin on the floor laying on your back with your feet on top of the ball.
Position the ball so that when your legs are extended your ankles are on top of the ball. This will be your starting position.
Raise your hips off of the ground, keeping your weight on the shoulder blades and your feet.
Flex the knees, pulling the ball as close to you as you can, contracting the hamstrings.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin on the floor laying on your back with your feet on top of the ball.
Position the ball so that when your legs are extended your ankles are on top of the ball. This will be your starting position.
Raise your hips off of the ground, keeping your weight on the shoulder blades and your feet.
Flex the knees, pulling the ball as close to you as you can, contracting the hamstrings.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin on the Suelo laying on your Espalda with your feet on top of the ball. Position the ball so that when your Piernas are extended your ankles are on top of the ball. This will be your starting position. Elevación your Caderas off of the ground, keeping your weight on the Hombro blades and your feet. Flex the knees, pulling the ball as close to you as you can, contracting the hamstrings. After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

Isquiotibiales.name: Banda Buenos Días
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Using a 41 inch band, stand on one end, spreading your feet a small amount. Bend at the hips to loop the end of the band behind your neck. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your legs straight, extend through the hips to come to a near vertical position.
Ensure that you do not round your back as you go down back to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Using a 41 inch band, stand on one end, spreading your feet a small amount. Bend at the hips to loop the end of the band behind your neck. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your legs straight, extend through the hips to come to a near vertical position.
Ensure that you do not round your back as you go down back to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Using a 41 inch Banda, stand on one end, spreading your feet a small amount. Bend at the Caderas to loop the end of the Banda behind your neck. This will be your starting position. Keeping your Piernas straight, extend through the Caderas to come to a near vertical position. Ensure that you do not round your Espalda as you go down Espalda to the starting position.

Isquiotibiales.name: Banda Buenos Días (Pull Through)
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Loop the band around a post. Standing a little ways away, loop the opposite end around the neck. Your hands can help hold the band in position.
Begin by bending at the hips, getting your butt back as far as possible. Keep your back flat and bend forward to about 90 degrees. Your knees should be only slightly bent.
Return to the starting position be driving through with the hips to come back to a standing position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Loop the band around a post. Standing a little ways away, loop the opposite end around the neck. Your hands can help hold the band in position.
Begin by bending at the hips, getting your butt back as far as possible. Keep your back flat and bend forward to about 90 degrees. Your knees should be only slightly bent.
Return to the starting position be driving through with the hips to come back to a standing position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Loop the Banda around a post. De Pie a little ways away, loop the opposite end around the neck. Your hands can help hold the Banda in position. Begin by bending at the Caderas, getting your butt Espalda as far as possible. Keep your Espalda flat and bend forward to about 90 degrees. Your knees should be only slightly bent. Return to the starting position be driving through with the Caderas to come Espalda to a De Pie position.

Isquiotibiales.name: Cajón Salto (Multiple Response)
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Assume a relaxed stance facing the box or platform approximately an arm's length away. Arms should be down at the sides and legs slightly bent.
Using the arms to aid in the initial burst, jump upward and forward, landing with feet simultaneously on top of the box or platform.
Immediately drop or jump back down to the original starting place; then repeat the sequence.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Assume a relaxed stance facing the box or platform approximately an arm's length away. Arms should be down at the sides and legs slightly bent.
Using the arms to aid in the initial burst, jump upward and forward, landing with feet simultaneously on top of the box or platform.
Immediately drop or jump back down to the original starting place; then repeat the sequence.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Assume a relaxed stance facing the Cajón or platform approximately an arm's length away. Arms should be down at the Laterals and Piernas slightly bent. Using the arms to aid in the initial burst, Salto upward and forward, landing with feet simultaneously on top of the Cajón or platform. Immediately drop or Salto Espalda down to the original starting place; then repeat the sequence.

Isquiotibiales.name: Cajón Skip
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
You will need several boxes lined up about 8 feet apart.
Begin facing the first box with one leg slightly behind the other.
Drive off the back leg, attempting to gain as much height with the hips as possible.
Immediately upon landing on the box, drive the other leg forward and upward to gain height and distance, leaping from the box. Land between the first two boxes with the same leg that landed on the first box.
Then, step to the next box and repeat.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
You will need several boxes lined up about 8 feet apart.
Begin facing the first box with one leg slightly behind the other.
Drive off the back leg, attempting to gain as much height with the hips as possible.
Immediately upon landing on the box, drive the other leg forward and upward to gain height and distance, leaping from the box. Land between the first two boxes with the same leg that landed on the first box.
Then, step to the next box and repeat.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: You will need several Cajónes lined up about 8 feet apart. Begin facing the first Cajón with one Pierna slightly behind the other. Drive off the Espalda Pierna, attempting to gain as much height with the Caderas as possible. Immediately upon landing on the Cajón, drive the other Pierna forward and upward to gain height and distance, leaping from the Cajón. Land between the first two Cajónes with the same Pierna that landed on the first Cajón. Then, step to the next Cajón and repeat.

Isquiotibiales.name: Chair Leg Extended Stretch
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Sit upright in a chair and grip the seat on the sides.
Raise one leg, extending the knee, flexing the ankle as you do so.
Slowly move that leg outward as far as you can, and then back to the center and down.
Repeat for your other leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Sit upright in a chair and grip the seat on the sides.
Raise one leg, extending the knee, flexing the ankle as you do so.
Slowly move that leg outward as far as you can, and then back to the center and down.
Repeat for your other leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Sit Vertical in a chair and grip the seat on the Laterals. Elevación one Pierna, extending the knee, flexing the ankle as you do so. SBajoly move that Pierna outward as far as you can, and then Espalda to the center and down. Repeat for your other Pierna.

Isquiotibiales.name: Cargada
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand (or hook) grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.
As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom squat position, which will help in the recovery.
Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand (or hook) grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.
As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom squat position, which will help in the recovery.
Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: With a Barra on the Suelo close to the shins, take an overhand (or hook) grip just outLateral the Piernas. Bajoer your Caderas with the weight focused on the heels, Espalda straight, head facing forward, Pecho up, with your Hombros just in Frontal of the bar. This will be your starting position. Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your Espalda angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees. Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the Cargada. As the bar approaches the mid-tAlto position, begin extending through the Caderas. In a Saltoing motion, accelerate by extending the Caderas, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly Espalda, with the arms still extended. As full Extensión is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively Encogimientoging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak Extensión, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a Frontal Sentadilla position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted Hombros, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom Sentadilla position, which will help in the recovery. Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso Vertical and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a De Pie position.

Isquiotibiales.name: Cargada Peso Muerto
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin standing with a barbell close to your shins. Your feet should be directly under your hips with your feet turned out slightly. Grip the bar with a double overhand grip or hook grip, about shoulder width apart. Squat down to the bar. Your spine should be in full extension, with a back angle that places your shoulders in front of the bar and your back as vertical as possible.
Begin by driving through the floor through the front of your heels. As the bar travels upward, maintain a constant back angle. Flare your knees out to the side to help keep them out of the bar's path.
After the bar crosses the knees, complete the lift by driving the hips into the bar until your hips and knees are extended.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin standing with a barbell close to your shins. Your feet should be directly under your hips with your feet turned out slightly. Grip the bar with a double overhand grip or hook grip, about shoulder width apart. Squat down to the bar. Your spine should be in full extension, with a back angle that places your shoulders in front of the bar and your back as vertical as possible.
Begin by driving through the floor through the front of your heels. As the bar travels upward, maintain a constant back angle. Flare your knees out to the side to help keep them out of the bar's path.
After the bar crosses the knees, complete the lift by driving the hips into the bar until your hips and knees are extended.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin De Pie with a Barra close to your shins. Your feet should be directly under your Caderas with your feet turned out slightly. Grip the bar with a double overhand grip or hook grip, about Hombro width apart. Sentadilla down to the bar. Your spine should be in full Extensión, with a Espalda angle that places your Hombros in Frontal of the bar and your Espalda as vertical as possible. Begin by driving through the Suelo through the Frontal of your heels. As the bar travels upward, maintain a constant Espalda angle. Flare your knees out to the Lateral to help keep them out of the bar's path. After the bar crosses the knees, complete the lift by driving the Caderas into the bar until your Caderas and knees are extended.

Isquiotibiales.name: Double Pesa Rusa Alternando Colgado Cargada
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.
Clean one kettlebell to your shoulder and hold on to the other kettlebell.
With a fluid motion, lower the top kettlebell while driving the bottom kettlebell up.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.
Clean one kettlebell to your shoulder and hold on to the other kettlebell.
With a fluid motion, lower the top kettlebell while driving the bottom kettlebell up.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Place two Pesa Rusas between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt Espalda and look straight ahead. Cargada one Pesa Rusa to your Hombro and hold on to the other Pesa Rusa. With a fluid motion, Bajoer the top Pesa Rusa while driving the bottom Pesa Rusa up.

Isquiotibiales.name: Mancuerna Cargada
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin standing with a dumbbell in each hand with your feet shoulder width apart.
Lower the weights to the floor by flexing at the hips and knees, pushing your hips back until the dumbbells reach the floor. This will be your starting position.
To initiate the movement, violently jump upward by extending the hips, knees, and ankles to acclerate the weights upward. Maintaining a neutral grip on the dumbbells, keep the arms straight until full extension is reached.
After full extension, rebend the hips and knees to receive the weight in a squat position. Allow the arms to bend, guiding the dumbbells to your shoulders.
Upon receiving the weight in the squat position, extend the hips and knees to finish in a standing position with the weights on your shoulders.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin standing with a dumbbell in each hand with your feet shoulder width apart.
Lower the weights to the floor by flexing at the hips and knees, pushing your hips back until the dumbbells reach the floor. This will be your starting position.
To initiate the movement, violently jump upward by extending the hips, knees, and ankles to acclerate the weights upward. Maintaining a neutral grip on the dumbbells, keep the arms straight until full extension is reached.
After full extension, rebend the hips and knees to receive the weight in a squat position. Allow the arms to bend, guiding the dumbbells to your shoulders.
Upon receiving the weight in the squat position, extend the hips and knees to finish in a standing position with the weights on your shoulders.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin De Pie with a Mancuerna in each hand with your feet Hombro width apart. Bajoer the weights to the Suelo by flexing at the Caderas and knees, pushing your Caderas Espalda until the Mancuernas reach the Suelo. This will be your starting position. To initiate the movement, violently Salto upward by extending the Caderas, knees, and ankles to acclerate the weights upward. Maintaining a Agarre Neutro on the Mancuernas, keep the arms straight until full Extensión is reached. After full Extensión, rebend the Caderas and knees to receive the weight in a Sentadilla position. AlBajo the arms to bend, guiding the Mancuernas to your Hombros. Upon receiving the weight in the Sentadilla position, extend the Caderas and knees to finish in a De Pie position with the weights on your Hombros.

Isquiotibiales.name: Suelo Glúteo-ham Elevación
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
You can use a partner for this exercise or brace your feet under something stable.
Begin on your knees with your upper legs and torso upright. If using a partner, they will firmly hold your feet to keep you in position. This will be your starting position.
Lower yourself by extending at the knee, taking care to NOT flex the hips as you go forward.
Place your hands in front of you as you reach the floor. This movement is very difficult and you may be unable to do it unaided. Use your arms to lightly push off the floor to aid your return to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
You can use a partner for this exercise or brace your feet under something stable.
Begin on your knees with your upper legs and torso upright. If using a partner, they will firmly hold your feet to keep you in position. This will be your starting position.
Lower yourself by extending at the knee, taking care to NOT flex the hips as you go forward.
Place your hands in front of you as you reach the floor. This movement is very difficult and you may be unable to do it unaided. Use your arms to lightly push off the floor to aid your return to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: You can use a partner for this exercise or brace your feet under something stable. Begin on your knees with your upper Piernas and torso Vertical. If using a partner, they will firmly hold your feet to keep you in position. This will be your starting position. Bajoer yourself by extending at the knee, taking care to NOT flex the Caderas as you go forward. Place your hands in Frontal of you as you reach the Suelo. This movement is very difficult and you may be unable to do it unaided. Use your arms to lightly push off the Suelo to aid your return to the starting position.

Isquiotibiales.name: Frontal Cajón Salto
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin with a box of an appropriate height 1-2 feet in front of you. Stand with your feet should width apart. This will be your starting position.
Perform a short squat in preparation for jumping, swinging your arms behind you.
Rebound out of this position, extending through the hips, knees, and ankles to jump as high as possible. Swing your arms forward and up.
Land on the box with the knees bent, absorbing the impact through the legs. You can jump from the box back to the ground, or preferably step down one leg at a time.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin with a box of an appropriate height 1-2 feet in front of you. Stand with your feet should width apart. This will be your starting position.
Perform a short squat in preparation for jumping, swinging your arms behind you.
Rebound out of this position, extending through the hips, knees, and ankles to jump as high as possible. Swing your arms forward and up.
Land on the box with the knees bent, absorbing the impact through the legs. You can jump from the box back to the ground, or preferably step down one leg at a time.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin with a Cajón of an appropriate height 1-2 feet in Frontal of you. Stand with your feet should width apart. This will be your starting position. Perform a short Sentadilla in preparation for Saltoing, swinging your arms behind you. Rebound out of this position, extending through the Caderas, knees, and ankles to Salto as Alto as possible. Swing your arms forward and up. Land on the Cajón with the knees bent, absorbing the impact through the Piernas. You can Salto from the Cajón Espalda to the ground, or preferably step down one Pierna at a time.

Isquiotibiales.name: Frontal Elevación de Piernass
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Stand next to a chair or other support, holding on with one hand.
Swing your leg forward, keeping the leg straight. Continue with a downward swing, bringing the leg as far back as your flexibility allows. Repeat 5-10 times, and then switch legs.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Stand next to a chair or other support, holding on with one hand.
Swing your leg forward, keeping the leg straight. Continue with a downward swing, bringing the leg as far back as your flexibility allows. Repeat 5-10 times, and then switch legs.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Stand next to a chair or other support, holding on with one hand. Swing your Pierna forward, keeping the Pierna straight. Continue with a downward swing, bringing the Pierna as far Espalda as your flexibility alBajos. Repeat 5-10 times, and then switch Piernas.

Isquiotibiales.name: Glúteo Ham Elevación
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin by adjusting the equipment to fit your body. Place your feet against the footplate in between the rollers as you lie facedown. Your knees should be just behind the pad.
Start from the bottom of the movement. Keep your back arched as you begin the movement by flexing the knees. Drive your toes into the foot plate as you do so. Keep your upper body straight, and continue until your body is upright.
