Keep the front heel on the floor (if it lifts up, scoot your other leg further back).
Place your hands on either side of your front leg. To get more out of this stretch, push your butt up toward the ceiling, and then gradually lower it back toward the floor. You'll Stretch the hip flexor of the back leg and the hamstring and buttocks of the front.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: It's easiest to get into this stretch if you start De Pie up, put one Pierna behind you, and sBajoly Bajoer your torso down to the Suelo. Keep the Frontal heel on the Suelo (if it lifts up, scoot your other Pierna further Espalda). Place your hands on either Lateral of your Frontal Pierna. To get more out of this stretch, push your butt up toward the ceiling, and then gradually Bajoer it Espalda toward the Suelo. You'll Stretch the Cadera flexor of the Espalda Pierna and the hamstring and buttocks of the Frontal.

Isquiotibiales.name: Seated Band Hamstring Curl
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Secure a band close to the ground and place a bench a couple feet away from it.
Seat yourself on the bench and secure the band behind your ankles, beginning with your legs straight. This will be your starting position.
Flex the knees, bringing your feet towards the bench. You may need to lean back slightly to keep your feet from striking the floor.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Secure a band close to the ground and place a bench a couple feet away from it.
Seat yourself on the bench and secure the band behind your ankles, beginning with your legs straight. This will be your starting position.
Flex the knees, bringing your feet towards the bench. You may need to lean back slightly to keep your feet from striking the floor.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Secure a Banda close to the ground and place a bench a couple feet away from it. Seat yourself on the bench and secure the Banda behind your ankles, beginning with your Piernas straight. This will be your starting position. Flex the knees, bringing your feet towards the bench. You may need to lean Espalda slightly to keep your feet from striking the Suelo. Pause at the completion of the movement, and then sBajoly return to the starting position.

Isquiotibiales.name: Seated Floor Hamstring Stretch
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Sit on a mat with your right leg extended in front of you and your left leg bent with your foot against your right inner thigh.
Lean forward from your hips and reach for your ankle until you feel a stretch in your hamstring. Hold for 15 seconds, then repeat for your other side.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Sit on a mat with your right leg extended in front of you and your left leg bent with your foot against your right inner thigh.
Lean forward from your hips and reach for your ankle until you feel a stretch in your hamstring. Hold for 15 seconds, then repeat for your other side.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Sit on a mat with your right Pierna extended in Frontal of you and your left Pierna bent with your foot against your right inner tAlto. Lean forward from your Caderas and reach for your ankle until you feel a stretch in your hamstring. Hold for 15 seconds, then repeat for your other Lateral.

Isquiotibiales.name: Sentado Hamstring
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
In a seated position with your legs extended, have your partner stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
In a seated position with your legs extended, have your partner stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: In a Sentado position with your Piernas extended, have your partner stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your Hombros with their hands. This will be your starting position. Attempt to push your torso Espalda for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso. Now relax your Muslos as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.

Isquiotibiales.name: Seated Hamstring And Calf Stretch
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. Sit down with both legs extended . This will be your starting position.
Leaning forward slightly, pull on the belt to draw the toes of your foot back. Hold this position for 10-20 seconds and then repeat with the other leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Loop a belt, rope, or band around one foot. Sit down with both legs extended . This will be your starting position.
Leaning forward slightly, pull on the belt to draw the toes of your foot back. Hold this position for 10-20 seconds and then repeat with the other leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Loop a belt, rope, or Banda around one foot. Sit down with both Piernas extended . This will be your starting position. Leaning forward slightly, pull on the belt to draw the toes of your foot Espalda. Hold this position for 10-20 seconds and then repeat with the other Pierna.

Isquiotibiales.name: Seated Leg Curl
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and sit on the machine with your back against the back support pad.
Place the back of lower leg on top of padded lever (just a few inches under the calves) and secure the lap pad against your thighs, just above the knees. Then grasp the side handles on the machine as you point your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances) and ensure that the legs are fully straight right in front of you. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, pull the machine lever as far as possible to the back of your thighs by flexing at the knees. Keep your torso stationary at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and sit on the machine with your back against the back support pad.
Place the back of lower leg on top of padded lever (just a few inches under the calves) and secure the lap pad against your thighs, just above the knees. Then grasp the side handles on the machine as you point your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances) and ensure that the legs are fully straight right in front of you. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, pull the machine lever as far as possible to the back of your thighs by flexing at the knees. Keep your torso stationary at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Adjust the Máquina lever to fit your height and sit on the Máquina with your Espalda against the Espalda support pad. Place the Espalda of Bajoer Pierna on top of padded lever (just a few inches under the calves) and secure the lap pad against your tAltos, just above the knees. Then grasp the Lateral handles on the Máquina as you point your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances) and ensure that the Piernas are fully straight right in Frontal of you. This will be your starting position. As you exhale, pull the Máquina lever as far as possible to the Espalda of your tAltos by flexing at the knees. Keep your torso stationary at all times. Hold the contracted position for a second. SBajoly return to the starting position as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Isquiotibiales.name: Multipower Colgado Power Cargada
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Position the bar at knee height and load it to an appropriate weight.
Take a pronated grip on the bar outside of shoulder width and unhook the bar from the machine. Your arms should be fully extended with your head and chest up. Your elbows should be pointed out with your shoulders back and down. Your hips should be back, loading the tension into the hamstrings. This will be your starting position.
Initate the movement by forcefully extending the hips and knees, accelerating into the bar. Ensure that you keep your arms straight during this part of the motion.
Upon full extension, rebend the hips and knees to lower your receiving position.
Allow the arms to flex at this point, rotating the elbows around the bar to receive it on your shoulders.
Extend through the hips and knees to come to a standing position with the bar racked on your shoulders to complete the movement.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Position the bar at knee height and load it to an appropriate weight.
Take a pronated grip on the bar outside of shoulder width and unhook the bar from the machine. Your arms should be fully extended with your head and chest up. Your elbows should be pointed out with your shoulders back and down. Your hips should be back, loading the tension into the hamstrings. This will be your starting position.
Initate the movement by forcefully extending the hips and knees, accelerating into the bar. Ensure that you keep your arms straight during this part of the motion.
Upon full extension, rebend the hips and knees to lower your receiving position.
Allow the arms to flex at this point, rotating the elbows around the bar to receive it on your shoulders.
Extend through the hips and knees to come to a standing position with the bar racked on your shoulders to complete the movement.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Position the bar at knee height and load it to an appropriate weight. Take a pronated grip on the bar outLateral of Hombro width and unhook the bar from the Máquina. Your arms should be fully extended with your head and Pecho up. Your elbows should be pointed out with your Hombros Espalda and down. Your Caderas should be Espalda, loading the tension into the hamstrings. This will be your starting position. Initate the movement by forcefully extending the Caderas and knees, accelerating into the bar. Ensure that you keep your arms straight during this part of the motion. Upon full Extensión, rebend the Caderas and knees to Bajoer your receiving position. AlBajo the arms to flex at this point, rotating the elbows around the bar to receive it on your Hombros. Extend through the Caderas and knees to come to a De Pie position with the bar racked on your Hombros to complete the movement.

Isquiotibiales.name: Multipower Piernas Rígidasged Peso Muerto
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the middle of your thighs. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Lift the bar up by fully extending your arms while keeping your back straight. Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narrower stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.
Keeping the knees stationary, lower the barbell to over the top of your feet by bending at the waist while keeping your back straight. Keep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the floor until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement
Start bringing your torso up straight again as soon as you feel the hamstrings stretch by extending your hips and waist until you are back at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the middle of your thighs. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Lift the bar up by fully extending your arms while keeping your back straight. Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narrower stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.
Keeping the knees stationary, lower the barbell to over the top of your feet by bending at the waist while keeping your back straight. Keep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the floor until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement
Start bringing your torso up straight again as soon as you feel the hamstrings stretch by extending your hips and waist until you are back at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: To begin, set the bar on the MultiPower to a height that is around the middle of your tAltos. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is Hombro width apart. You may need some Muñeca wraps if using a significant amount of weight. Lift the bar up by fully extending your arms while keeping your Espalda straight. Stand with your torso straight and your Piernas spaced using a Hombro width or narRemoer stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position. Keeping the knees stationary, Bajoer the Barra to over the top of your feet by bending at the waist while keeping your Espalda straight. Keep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the Suelo until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement Start bringing your torso up straight again as soon as you feel the hamstrings stretch by extending your Caderas and waist until you are Espalda at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Isquiotibiales.name: Arrancada Peso Muerto
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
The snatch deadlift strengthens the first pull of the snatch. Begin with a wide snatch grip with the barbell placed on the platform. The feet should be directly under the hips, with the feet turned out. Squat down to the bar, keeping the back in absolute extension with the head facing forward.
Initiate the movement by driving through the heels, raising the hips. The back angle should remain the same until the bar passes the knees.
At that point, drive your hips through the bar as you lay back. Return the bar to the platform by reversing the motion.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
The snatch deadlift strengthens the first pull of the snatch. Begin with a wide snatch grip with the barbell placed on the platform. The feet should be directly under the hips, with the feet turned out. Squat down to the bar, keeping the back in absolute extension with the head facing forward.
Initiate the movement by driving through the heels, raising the hips. The back angle should remain the same until the bar passes the knees.
At that point, drive your hips through the bar as you lay back. Return the bar to the platform by reversing the motion.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: The Arrancada Peso Muerto strengthens the first pull of the Arrancada. Begin with a wide Arrancada grip with the Barra placed on the platform. The feet should be directly under the Caderas, with the feet turned out. Sentadilla down to the bar, keeping the Espalda in absolute Extensión with the head facing forward. Initiate the movement by driving through the heels, raising the Caderas. The Espalda angle should remain the same until the bar passes the knees. At that point, drive your Caderas through the bar as you lay Espalda. Return the bar to the platform by reversing the motion.

Isquiotibiales.name: Arrancada Pull
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take a wide snatch grip. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the pull. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward.
There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back. Full extension should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the extension for longer than necessary.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take a wide snatch grip. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the pull. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward.
There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back. Full extension should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the extension for longer than necessary.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: With a Barra on the Suelo close to the shins, take a wide Arrancada grip. Bajoer your Caderas with the weight focused on the heels, Espalda straight, head facing forward, Pecho up, with your Hombros just in Frontal of the bar. This will be your starting position. Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your Espalda angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees. Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the pull. As the bar approaches the mid-tAlto position, begin extending through the Caderas. In a Saltoing motion, accelerate by extending the Caderas, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly Espalda. Full Extensión should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the Extensión for longer than necessary.

Isquiotibiales.name: Split Arrancada
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin with a loaded barbell on the floor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar from the ground. The back angle should stay the same until the bar passes the knees.
Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and allow the elbows to flex to the side.
As you move your feet into the receiving position, forcefully pull yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The feet should move forcefully to a split position, one foot forward one foot back. Receive the bar with your body as low as possible and the arms fully extended overhead.
Keeping the bar aligned over the front of the heels, your head and chest up, drive through heels of the feet to move to a standing position, bringing your feet together.
Carefully return the weight to floor.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin with a loaded barbell on the floor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly below the hips, with the feet turned out as needed. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head looking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This will be the starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the front of the heels, raising the bar from the ground. The back angle should stay the same until the bar passes the knees.
Transition into the second pull by extending through the hips knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and allow the elbows to flex to the side.
As you move your feet into the receiving position, forcefully pull yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The feet should move forcefully to a split position, one foot forward one foot back. Receive the bar with your body as low as possible and the arms fully extended overhead.
Keeping the bar aligned over the front of the heels, your head and chest up, drive through heels of the feet to move to a standing position, bringing your feet together.
Carefully return the weight to floor.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin with a loaded Barra on the Suelo. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a Agarre Ancho should be taken on the bar. The feet should be directly beBajo the Caderas, with the feet turned out as needed. Bajoer the Caderas, with the Pecho up and the head looking forward. The Hombros should be just in Frontal of the bar. This will be the starting position. Begin the first pull by driving through the Frontal of the heels, raising the bar from the ground. The Espalda angle should stay the same until the bar passes the knees. Transition into the second pull by extending through the Caderas knees and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as possible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak Extensión, Encogimiento the Hombros and alBajo the elbows to flex to the Lateral. As you move your feet into the receiving position, forcefully pull yourself beBajo the bar as you elevate the bar Sobre la Cabeza. The feet should move forcefully to a Split position, one foot forward one foot Espalda. Receive the bar with your body as Bajo as possible and the arms fully extended Sobre la Cabeza. Keeping the bar aligned over the Frontal of the heels, your head and Pecho up, drive through heels of the feet to move to a De Pie position, bringing your feet together. Carefully return the weight to Suelo.

Isquiotibiales.name: Sentadilla Splits
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Being in a standing position. Jump into a split leg position, with one leg forward and one leg back, flexing the knees and lowering your hips slightly as you do so.
As you descend, immediately reverse direction, standing back up and jumping, reversing the position of your legs. Repeat 5-10 times on each leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Being in a standing position. Jump into a split leg position, with one leg forward and one leg back, flexing the knees and lowering your hips slightly as you do so.
As you descend, immediately reverse direction, standing back up and jumping, reversing the position of your legs. Repeat 5-10 times on each leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Being in a De Pie position. Salto into a Split Pierna position, with one Pierna forward and one Pierna Espalda, flexing the knees and Bajoering your Caderas slightly as you do so. As you descend, immediately Inverso direction, De Pie Espalda up and Saltoing, reversing the position of your Piernas. Repeat 5-10 times on each Pierna.

Isquiotibiales.name: Standing Hamstring And Calf Stretch
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Being by looping a belt, band, or rope around one foot. While standing, place that foot forward.
Bend your back leg, while keeping the front one straight. Now raise the toes of your front foot off of the ground and lean forward.
Using the belt, pull on the top of the foot to increase the stretch in the calf. Hold for 10-20 seconds and repeat with the other foot.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Being by looping a belt, band, or rope around one foot. While standing, place that foot forward.
Bend your back leg, while keeping the front one straight. Now raise the toes of your front foot off of the ground and lean forward.
Using the belt, pull on the top of the foot to increase the stretch in the calf. Hold for 10-20 seconds and repeat with the other foot.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Being by looping a belt, Banda, or rope around one foot. While De Pie, place that foot forward. Bend your Espalda Pierna, while keeping the Frontal one straight. Now Elevación the toes of your Frontal foot off of the ground and lean forward. Using the belt, pull on the top of the foot to increase the stretch in the Gemelo. Hold for 10-20 seconds and repeat with the other foot.

Isquiotibiales.name: Standing Leg Curl
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie with your torso bent at the waist facing forward around 30-45 degrees (since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment) with the pad of the lever on the back of your right leg (just a few inches under the calves) and the front of the right leg on top of the machine pad.
Keeping the torso bent forward, ensure your leg is fully stretched and grab the side handles of the machine. Position your toes straight. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl your right leg up as far as possible without lifting the upper leg from the pad. Once you hit the fully contracted position, hold it for a second.
As you inhale, bring the legs back to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Perform the same exercise now for the left leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie with your torso bent at the waist facing forward around 30-45 degrees (since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment) with the pad of the lever on the back of your right leg (just a few inches under the calves) and the front of the right leg on top of the machine pad.
Keeping the torso bent forward, ensure your leg is fully stretched and grab the side handles of the machine. Position your toes straight. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl your right leg up as far as possible without lifting the upper leg from the pad. Once you hit the fully contracted position, hold it for a second.
As you inhale, bring the legs back to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Perform the same exercise now for the left leg.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Adjust the Máquina lever to fit your height and lie with your torso bent at the waist facing forward around 30-45 degrees (since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment) with the pad of the lever on the Espalda of your right Pierna (just a few inches under the calves) and the Frontal of the right Pierna on top of the Máquina pad. Keeping the torso bent forward, ensure your Pierna is fully stretched and grab the Lateral handles of the Máquina. Position your toes straight. This will be your starting position. As you exhale, Curl your right Pierna up as far as possible without lifting the upper Pierna from the pad. Once you hit the fully contracted position, hold it for a second. As you inhale, bring the Piernas Espalda to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Perform the same exercise now for the left Pierna.

Isquiotibiales.name: De Pie Toe Touches
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Stand with some space in front and behind you.
Bend at the waist, keeping your legs straight, until you can relax and let your upper body hang down in front of you. Let your arms and hands hang down naturally. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Stand with some space in front and behind you.
Bend at the waist, keeping your legs straight, until you can relax and let your upper body hang down in front of you. Let your arms and hands hang down naturally. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Stand with some space in Frontal and behind you. Bend at the waist, keeping your Piernas straight, until you can relax and let your upper body Colgado down in Frontal of you. Let your arms and hands Colgado down naturally. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.

Isquiotibiales.name: Piernas Rígidasged Barra Peso Muerto
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Grasp a bar using an overhand grip (palms facing down). You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narrower stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.
Keeping the knees stationary, lower the barbell to over the top of your feet by bending at the hips while keeping your back straight. Keep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the floor until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Start bringing your torso up straight again by extending your hips until you are back at the starting position. Exhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Grasp a bar using an overhand grip (palms facing down). You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narrower stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.

Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Start bringing your torso up straight again by extending your Caderas until you are Espalda at the starting position. Exhale as you perform this movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Isquiotibiales.name: Piernas Rígidasged Mancuerna Peso Muerto
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Grasp a couple of dumbbells holding them by your side at arm's length.
Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narrower stance. The knees should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.
Keeping the knees stationary, lower the dumbbells to over the top of your feet by bending at the waist while keeping your back straight. Keep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the floor until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement
Start bringing your torso up straight again by extending your hips and waist until you are back at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:

Inhale as you perform this movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Isquiotibiales.name: Peso Muerto Sumo
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin with a bar loaded on the ground. Approach the bar so that the bar intersects the middle of the feet. The feet should be set very wide, near the collars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hook grip. Relax the shoulders, which in effect lengthens your arms.
Take a breath, and then lower your hips, looking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the floor, spreading your feet apart, with your weight on the back half of your feet. Extend through the hips and knees.
As the bar passes through the knees, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, pulling your shoulder blades together.
Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controlling the weight on the way down.

Isquiotibiales.instructions:
To deadlift with short bands, simply loop them over the bar before you start, and step into them to set up. Ensure that they under the back half of your foot, directly where you are driving into the floor.

Isquiotibiales.name: Peso Muerto Sumo With Chains
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
You can attach the chains to the sleeves of the bar, or just drape the middle over the bar so there is a greater weight increase as you lift. Attempt to keep the ends of the chains away from the plates so you don't hit them when you lower the weight.

Isquiotibiales.name: The Straddle
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin in a seated, upright position. Start by extending your legs in front of you in a V.
With your hands on the floor, lean forward as far as possible. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin in a seated, upright position. Start by extending your legs in front of you in a V.
With your hands on the floor, lean forward as far as possible. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin in a Sentado, Vertical position. Start by extending your Piernas in Frontal of you in a V. With your hands on the Suelo, lean forward as far as possible. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.

Isquiotibiales.name: Upper Espalda-pierna Grab
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
While seated, bend forward to hug your thighs from underneath with both arms.
Keep your knees together and your legs extended out as you bring your chest down to your knees. You can also stretch your middle back by pulling your back away from your knees as your hugging them.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
While seated, bend forward to hug your thighs from underneath with both arms.
Keep your knees together and your legs extended out as you bring your chest down to your knees. You can also stretch your middle back by pulling your back away from your knees as your hugging them.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: While Sentado, bend forward to hug your tAltos from underneath with both arms. Keep your knees together and your Piernas extended out as you bring your Pecho down to your knees. You can also stretch your middle Espalda by pulling your Espalda away from your knees as your hugging them.

Isquiotibiales.name: Vertical Swing
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Allow the dumbbell to hang at arms length between your legs, holding it with both hands. Keep your back straight and your head up.
Swing the dumbbell between your legs, flexing at the hips and bending the knees slightly.
Powerfully reverse the motion by extending at the hips, knees, and ankles to propel yourself upward, swinging the dumbell over your head.
As you land, absorb the impact through your legs and draw the dumbbell to your torso before the next repetition.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:

Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: AlBajo the Mancuerna to Colgado at arms length between your Piernas, holding it with both hands. Keep your Espalda straight and your head up. Swing the Mancuerna between your Piernas, flexing at the Caderas and bending the knees slightly. Powerfully Inverso the motion by extending at the Caderas, knees, and ankles to propel yourself upward, swinging the dumbell over your head. As you land, absorb the impact through your Piernas and draw the Mancuerna to your torso before the next repetition.

Isquiotibiales.name: Wide Stance Piernas Rígidass
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
Begin with a barbell loaded on the floor. Adopt a wide stance, and then bend at the hips to grab the bar. Your hips should be as far back as possible, and your legs nearly straight. Keep your back straight, and your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement be engaging the hips, driving them forward as you allow the arms to hang straight. Continue until you are standing straight up, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position. For successive reps, the weight need not touch the floor.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
Begin with a barbell loaded on the floor. Adopt a wide stance, and then bend at the hips to grab the bar. Your hips should be as far back as possible, and your legs nearly straight. Keep your back straight, and your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement be engaging the hips, driving them forward as you allow the arms to hang straight. Continue until you are standing straight up, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position. For successive reps, the weight need not touch the floor.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: Begin with a Barra loaded on the Suelo. Adopt a wide stance, and then bend at the Caderas to grab the bar. Your Caderas should be as far Espalda as possible, and your Piernas nearly straight. Keep your Espalda straight, and your head and Pecho up. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement be engaging the Caderas, driving them forward as you alBajo the arms to Colgado straight. Continue until you are De Pie straight up, and then sBajoly return the weight to the starting position. For successive reps, the weight need not touch the Suelo.

Isquiotibiales.name: World's Greatest Stretch
Isquiotibiales.instructions:
This is a three-part stretch. Begin by lunging forward, with your front foot flat on the ground and on the toes of your back foot. With your knees bent, squat down until your knee is almost touching the ground. Keep your torso erect, and hold this position for 10-20 seconds.
Now, place the arm on the same side as your front leg on the ground, with the elbow next to the foot. Your other hand should be placed on the ground, parallel to your lead leg, to help support you during this portion of the stretch.
After 10-20 seconds, place your hands on either side of your front foot. Raise the toes of the front foot off of the ground, and straighten your leg. You may need to reposition your rear leg to do so. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then repeat the entire sequence for the other side.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_en:
This is a three-part stretch. Begin by lunging forward, with your front foot flat on the ground and on the toes of your back foot. With your knees bent, squat down until your knee is almost touching the ground. Keep your torso erect, and hold this position for 10-20 seconds.
Now, place the arm on the same side as your front leg on the ground, with the elbow next to the foot. Your other hand should be placed on the ground, parallel to your lead leg, to help support you during this portion of the stretch.
After 10-20 seconds, place your hands on either side of your front foot. Raise the toes of the front foot off of the ground, and straighten your leg. You may need to reposition your rear leg to do so. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then repeat the entire sequence for the other side.
Isquiotibiales.instructions_es: This is a three-part stretch. Begin by lunging forward, with your Frontal foot flat on the ground and on the toes of your Espalda foot. With your knees bent, Sentadilla down until your knee is almost touching the ground. Keep your torso erect, and hold this position for 10-20 seconds. Now, place the arm on the same Lateral as your Frontal Pierna on the ground, with the elbow next to the foot. Your other hand should be placed on the ground, parallel to your lead Pierna, to help support you during this portion of the stretch. After 10-20 seconds, place your hands on either Lateral of your Frontal foot. Elevación the toes of the Frontal foot off of the ground, and straighten your Pierna. You may need to reposition your Posterior Pierna to do so. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then repeat the entire sequence for the other Lateral.

Isquiotibiales.name: Curl de Piernas
Isquiotibiales.instructions: Siéntate en la máquina y coloca los tobillos sobre el cojín. Contrae los isquiotibiales para flexionar las piernas hacia abajo.

Dorsales.name: Banda Assisted Pull-up
Dorsales.instructions:
Choke the band around the center of the pullup bar. You can use different bands to provide varying levels of assistance.
Pull the end of the band down, and place one bent knee into the loop, ensuring it won't slip out. Take a medium to wide grip on the bar. This will be your starting position.
Pull yourself upward by contracting the lats as you flex the elbow. The elbow should be driven to your side. Pull to the front, attempting to get your chin over the bar. Avoid swinging or jerking movements.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_en:

Pull the end of the band down, and place one bent knee into the loop, ensuring it won't slip out. Take a medium to wide grip on the bar. This will be your starting position.

Pull the end of the Banda down, and place one bent knee into the loop, ensuring it won't slip out. Take a medium to Agarre Ancho on the bar. This will be your starting position. Pull yourself upward by contracting the lats as you flex the elbow. The elbow should be driven to your Lateral. Pull to the Frontal, attempting to get your chin over the bar. Avoid swinging or Envióning movements. After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

Dorsales.name: Bent-arm Barra Pullover
Dorsales.instructions:
Lie on a flat bench with a barbell using a shoulder grip width.
Hold the bar straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your arms in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the barbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Dorsales.instructions_en:

Hold the bar straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your arms in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the barbell back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Lie on a flat bench with a Barra using a Hombro grip width. Hold the bar straight over your Pecho with a bend in your arms. This will be your starting position. While keeping your arms in the bent arm position, Bajoer the weight sBajoly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you feel a stretch on the Pecho. At that point, bring the Barra Espalda to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was Bajoered and exhale as you perform this movement. Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Dorsales.name: Polea Inclinado Extensión en Polea
Dorsales.instructions:
Lie on incline an bench facing away from a high pulley machine that has a straight bar attachment on it.
Grasp the straight bar attachment overhead with a pronated (overhand; palms down) shoulder width grip and extend your arms in front of you. The bar should be around 2 inches away from your upper thighs. This will be your starting position.
Keeping the upper arms stationary, lift your arms back in a semi circle until the bar is straight over your head. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
Slowly go back to the starting position using your lats and hold the contraction once you reach the starting position. Breathe out during the execution of this movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Grasp the straight bar attachment overhead with a pronated (overhand; palms down) shoulder width grip and extend your arms in front of you. The bar should be around 2 inches away from your upper thighs. This will be your starting position.

Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Grasp the straight bar attachment Sobre la Cabeza with a pronated (overhand; palms down) Hombro width grip and extend your arms in Frontal of you. The bar should be around 2 inches away from your upper tAltos. This will be your starting position. Keeping the upper arms stationary, lift your arms Espalda in a semi circle until the bar is straight over your head. Breathe in during this portion of the movement. SBajoly go Espalda to the starting position using your lats and hold the contraction once you reach the starting position. Breathe out during the execution of this movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Dorsales.name: Catch And Sobre la Cabeza Thremo
Dorsales.instructions:
Begin standing while facing a wall or a partner.
Using both hands, position the ball behind your head, stretching as much as possible, and forcefully throw the ball forward.
Ensure that you follow your throw through, being prepared to receive your rebound from your throw. If you are throwing against the wall, make sure that you stand close enough to the wall to receive the rebound, and aim a little higher than you would with a partner.

Dorsales.name: Chair Lower Back Stretch
Dorsales.instructions:
Sit upright on a chair.
Bend to one side with your arm over your head. You can hold onto the chair with your free hand.
Hold for 10 seconds, and repeat for your other side.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Sit upright on a chair.
Bend to one side with your arm over your head. You can hold onto the chair with your free hand.
Hold for 10 seconds, and repeat for your other side.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Sit Vertical on a chair. Bend to one Lateral with your arm over your head. You can hold onto the chair with your free hand. Hold for 10 seconds, and repeat for your other Lateral.

Dorsales.name: Dominada Supina
Dorsales.instructions:
Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing your torso and a grip closer than the shoulder width.
As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, keep your torso as straight as possible while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position. Tip: Keeping the torso as straight as possible maximizes biceps stimulation while minimizing back involvement.
As you breathe out, pull your torso up until your head is around the level of the pull-up bar. Concentrate on using the biceps muscles in order to perform the movement. Keep the elbows close to your body. Tip: The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second of squeezing the biceps in the contracted position, slowly lower your torso back to the starting position; when your arms are fully extended. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

The foPosteriorms should do no other work other than hold the bar. After a second of squeezing the Bíceps in the contracted position, sBajoly Bajoer your torso Espalda to the starting position; when your arms are fully extended. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Dorsales.name: Agarre Cerrado Frontal Jalón al Pecho
Dorsales.instructions:
Sit down on a pull-down machine with a wide bar attached to the top pulley. Make sure that you adjust the knee pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads will prevent your body from being raised by the resistance attached to the bar.
Grab the bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.
As you have both arms extended in front of you - while holding the bar at the chosen grip width - bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.
As you breathe out, bring the bar down until it touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary (only the arms should move). The forearms should do no other work except for holding the bar; therefore do not try to pull the bar down using the forearms.
After a second in the contracted position, while squeezing your shoulder blades together, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched. Inhale during this portion of the movement.
6. Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Dorsales.name: Dynamic Back Stretch
Dorsales.instructions:
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, swing them straight up in front of you 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion each time until your arms are above your head.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, swing them straight up in front of you 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion each time until your arms are above your head.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Stand with your feet Hombro width apart. This will be your starting position. Keeping your arms straight, swing them straight up in Frontal of you 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion each time until your arms are above your head.

Dorsales.name: Elevated Polea Remos
Dorsales.instructions:
Get a platform of some sort (it can be an aerobics or calf raise platform) that is around 4-6 inches in height.
Place it on the seat of the cable row machine.
Sit down on the machine and place your feet on the front platform or crossbar provided making sure that your knees are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your back and grab the V-bar handles.
With your arms extended pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feeling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in front of you. This is the starting position of the exercise.
Keeping the torso stationary, pull the handles back towards your torso while keeping the arms close to it until you touch the abdominals. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squeezing your back muscles hard. Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Get a platform of some sort (it can be an aerobics or calf raise platform) that is around 4-6 inches in height.
Place it on the seat of the cable row machine.
Sit down on the machine and place your feet on the front platform or crossbar provided making sure that your knees are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your back and grab the V-bar handles.
With your arms extended pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feeling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in front of you. This is the starting position of the exercise.
Keeping the torso stationary, pull the handles back towards your torso while keeping the arms close to it until you touch the abdominals. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squeezing your back muscles hard. Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Get a platform of some sort (it can be an aerobics or Gemelo Elevación platform) that is around 4-6 inches in height. Place it on the seat of the Polea Remo Máquina. Sit down on the Máquina and place your feet on the Frontal platform or crossbar provided making sure that your knees are slightly bent and not locked. Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your Espalda and grab the V-bar handles. With your arms extended pull Espalda until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your Piernas. Your Espalda should be slightly arched and your Pecho should be sticking out. You should be feeling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in Frontal of you. This is the starting position of the exercise. Keeping the torso stationary, pull the handles Espalda towards your torso while keeping the arms close to it until you touch the Abdominals. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squeezing your Espalda Muslos hard. Hold that contraction for a second and sBajoly go Espalda to the original position while breathing in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Dorsales.name: Jalón al Pecho
Dorsales.instructions:
Either standing or seated on a high bench, grasp two stirrup cables that are attached to the high pulleys. Grab with the opposing hand so your arms are crisscrossed about you and your palms are facing forward.
Keeping your chest up and maintaining a slight arch in your lower back, pull the handles down as if you were doing a regular pulldown. The range of motion will be more of an arc. During the movement, rotate your hands so that in the bottom position your palms face each other rather than forward. Return slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Either standing or seated on a high bench, grasp two stirrup cables that are attached to the high pulleys. Grab with the opposing hand so your arms are crisscrossed about you and your palms are facing forward.
Keeping your chest up and maintaining a slight arch in your lower back, pull the handles down as if you were doing a regular pulldown. The range of motion will be more of an arc. During the movement, rotate your hands so that in the bottom position your palms face each other rather than forward. Return slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Either De Pie or Sentado on a Alto bench, grasp two stirrup Poleas that are attached to the Alto pulleys. Grab with the opposing hand so your arms are crisscrossed about you and your palms are facing forward. Keeping your Pecho up and maintaining a slight arch in your Bajoer Espalda, pull the handles down as if you were doing a regular Jalón. The range of motion will be more of an arc. During the movement, rotate your hands so that in the bottom position your palms face each other rather than forward. Return sBajoly to the starting position and repeat.

Dorsales.name: Gironda Sternum Chins
Dorsales.instructions:
Grasp the pull-up bar with a shoulder width underhand grip.
Now hang with your arms fully extended and stick your chest out and lean back. Tip: You will be leaning back throughout the entire movement. This will be your starting position.
Start pulling yourself towards the bar with your spine arched throughout the movement and your head leaning back as far away from the bar as possible. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the upper end of the movement, your hips and legs will be at about a 45-degree angle to the floor.
Keep pulling until your collarbone passes the bar and your lower chest or sternum area touches it. Hold that contraction for a second. Tip: By the time you've completed this portion of the movement; your head will be parallel to the floor.
Slowly start going back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Grasp the pull-up bar with a shoulder width underhand grip.
Now hang with your arms fully extended and stick your chest out and lean back. Tip: You will be leaning back throughout the entire movement. This will be your starting position.
Start pulling yourself towards the bar with your spine arched throughout the movement and your head leaning back as far away from the bar as possible. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the upper end of the movement, your hips and legs will be at about a 45-degree angle to the floor.
Keep pulling until your collarbone passes the bar and your lower chest or sternum area touches it. Hold that contraction for a second. Tip: By the time you've completed this portion of the movement; your head will be parallel to the floor.
Slowly start going back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Grasp the pull-up bar with a Hombro width underhand grip. Now Colgado with your arms fully extended and stick your Pecho out and lean Espalda. Tip: You will be leaning Espalda throughout the entire movement. This will be your starting position. Start pulling yourself towards the bar with your spine arched throughout the movement and your head leaning Espalda as far away from the bar as possible. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the upper end of the movement, your Caderas and Piernas will be at about a 45-degree angle to the Suelo. Keep pulling until your collarbone passes the bar and your Bajoer Pecho or sternum area touches it. Hold that contraction for a second. Tip: By the time you've completed this portion of the movement; your head will be parallel to the Suelo. SBajoly start going Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Dorsales.name: Kipping Muslo Up
Dorsales.instructions:
Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings.
Begin with a movement swinging your legs backward slightly.
Counter that movement by swinging your legs forward and up, jerking your chin and chest back, pulling yourself up with both arms as you do so. As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your shoulders forward, allowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings.
Begin with a movement swinging your legs backward slightly.
Counter that movement by swinging your legs forward and up, jerking your chin and chest back, pulling yourself up with both arms as you do so. As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your shoulders forward, allowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Begin with a movement swinging your Piernas Espaldaward slightly. Counter that movement by swinging your Piernas forward and up, Envióning your chin and Pecho Espalda, pulling yourself up with both arms as you do so. As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your Hombros forward, alBajoing your elbows to move straight Espalda behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the Fondo portion of the movement. Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion. Use care when Bajoering yourself to the ground.

Dorsales.name: Arrodillado Alto Pulley Remo
Dorsales.instructions:
Select the appropriate weight using a pulley that is above your head. Attach a rope to the cable and kneel a couple of feet away, holding the rope out in front of you with both arms extended. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing the elbows and fully retracting your shoulders, pulling the rope toward your upper chest with your elbows out.
After pausing briefly, slowly return to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Select the appropriate weight using a pulley that is above your head. Attach a rope to the cable and kneel a couple of feet away, holding the rope out in front of you with both arms extended. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing the elbows and fully retracting your shoulders, pulling the rope toward your upper chest with your elbows out.
After pausing briefly, slowly return to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Select the appropriate weight using a pulley that is above your head. Attach a rope to the Polea and kneel a couple of feet away, holding the rope out in Frontal of you with both arms extended. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement by flexing the elbows and fully retracting your Hombros, pulling the rope toward your upper Pecho with your elbows out. After pausing brieAperturas, sBajoly return to the starting position.

Dorsales.name: Arrodillado Un Brazo Alto Pulley Remo
Dorsales.instructions:
Attach a single handle to a high pulley and make your weight selection.
Kneel in front of the cable tower, taking the cable with one hand with your arm extended. This will be your starting position.
Starting with your palm facing forward, pull the weight down to your torso by flexing the elbow and retract the shoulder blade. As you do so, rotate the wrist so that at the completion of the movement, your palm is now facing you.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Attach a single handle to a high pulley and make your weight selection.
Kneel in front of the cable tower, taking the cable with one hand with your arm extended. This will be your starting position.
Starting with your palm facing forward, pull the weight down to your torso by flexing the elbow and retract the shoulder blade. As you do so, rotate the wrist so that at the completion of the movement, your palm is now facing you.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Attach a single handle to a Alto pulley and make your weight selection. Kneel in Frontal of the Polea tower, taking the Polea with one hand with your arm extended. This will be your starting position. Starting with your palm facing forward, pull the weight down to your torso by flexing the elbow and retract the Hombro blade. As you do so, rotate the Muñeca so that at the completion of the movement, your palm is now facing you. After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

Dorsales.name: Latissimus Dorsi-smr
Dorsales.instructions:
While lying on the floor, place a foam roll under your back and to one side, just behind your arm pit. This will be your starting position.
Keep the arm of the side being stretched behind and to the side of you as you shift your weight onto your lats, keeping your upper body off of the ground. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and switch sides.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
While lying on the floor, place a foam roll under your back and to one side, just behind your arm pit. This will be your starting position.
Keep the arm of the side being stretched behind and to the side of you as you shift your weight onto your lats, keeping your upper body off of the ground. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and switch sides.
Dorsales.instructions_es: While Recostado on the Suelo, place a foam roll under your Espalda and to one Lateral, just behind your arm pit. This will be your starting position. Keep the arm of the Lateral being stretched behind and to the Lateral of you as you shift your weight onto your lats, keeping your upper body off of the ground. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and switch Laterals.

Dorsales.name: Leverage Iso Remo
Dorsales.instructions:
Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level. Grasp the handles with either a neutral or pronated grip. This will be your starting position.
Pull the handles towards your torso, retracting your shoulder blades as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then slowly return the handles to the starting position. For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to the stops to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level. Grasp the handles with either a neutral or pronated grip. This will be your starting position.
Pull the handles towards your torso, retracting your shoulder blades as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then slowly return the handles to the starting position. For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to the stops to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Load an appropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that the handles are at Pecho level. Grasp the handles with either a neutral or pronated grip. This will be your starting position. Pull the handles towards your torso, retracting your Hombro blades as you flex the elbow. Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then sBajoly return the handles to the starting position. For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to the stops to keep tension on the Muslos being worked.

Dorsales.name: London Bridges
Dorsales.instructions:
Attach a climbing rope to a high beam or cross member. Below it, ensure that the smith machine bar is locked in place with the safeties and cannot move. Alternatively, a secure box could also be utilized.
Stand on the bar, using the rope to balance yourself. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your body straight, lean back and lower your body by slowly going hand over hand with the rope. Continue until you are perpendicular to the ground.
Keeping your body straight, reverse the motion, going hand over hand back to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Attach a climbing rope to a high beam or cross member. Below it, ensure that the smith machine bar is locked in place with the safeties and cannot move. Alternatively, a secure box could also be utilized.
Stand on the bar, using the rope to balance yourself. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your body straight, lean back and lower your body by slowly going hand over hand with the rope. Continue until you are perpendicular to the ground.
Keeping your body straight, reverse the motion, going hand over hand back to the starting position.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Attach a climbing rope to a Alto beam or cross member. BeBajo it, ensure that the MultiPower bar is locked in place with the safeties and cannot move. Alternatively, a secure Cajón could also be utilized. Stand on the bar, using the rope to balance yourself. This will be your starting position. Keeping your body straight, lean Espalda and Bajoer your body by sBajoly going hand over hand with the rope. Continue until you are perpendicular to the ground. Keeping your body straight, Inverso the motion, going hand over hand Espalda to the starting position.

Dorsales.name: Muslo Up
Dorsales.instructions:
Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Initiate a pull up by pulling the elbows down to your side, flexing the elbows.
As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your shoulders forward, allowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Initiate a pull up by pulling the elbows down to your side, flexing the elbows.
As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your shoulders forward, allowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Initiate a Dominada by pulling the elbows down to your Lateral, flexing the elbows. As you reach the top position of the pull-up, pull the rings to your armpits as you roll your Hombros forward, alBajoing your elbows to move straight Espalda behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the Fondo portion of the movement. Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion. Use care when Bajoering yourself to the ground.

Dorsales.name: Un Brazo Against Wall
Dorsales.instructions: From a De Pie position, place a bent arm against a wall or doorway. SBajoly lean toward your arm until you feel a stretch in your lats.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
From a standing position, place a bent arm against a wall or doorway.
Slowly lean toward your arm until you feel a stretch in your lats.
Dorsales.instructions_es: From a De Pie position, place a bent arm against a wall or doorway. SBajoly lean toward your arm until you feel a stretch in your lats.

Dorsales.name: Un Brazo Jalón al Pecho
Dorsales.instructions:
Select an appropriate weight and adjust the knee pad to help keep you down. Grasp the handle with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position.
Pull the handle down, squeezing your elbow to your side as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then slowly return the handle to the starting position.
For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Select an appropriate weight and adjust the knee pad to help keep you down. Grasp the handle with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position.
Pull the handle down, squeezing your elbow to your side as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then slowly return the handle to the starting position.
For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to keep tension on the muscles being worked.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Select an appropriate weight and adjust the knee pad to help keep you down. Grasp the handle with a pronated grip. This will be your starting position. Pull the handle down, squeezing your elbow to your Lateral as you flex the elbow. Pause at the bottom of the motion, and then sBajoly return the handle to the starting position. For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to keep tension on the Muslos being worked.

Dorsales.name: One Handed Colgado
Dorsales.instructions: Grab onto a chinup bar with one hand, using a pronated grip. Keep your feet on the floor or a step. Allow the majority of your weight to hang from that hand, while keeping your feet on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.
Dorsales.instructions_en: Grab onto a chinup bar with one hand, using a pronated grip. Keep your feet on the floor or a step. Allow the majority of your weight to hang from that hand, while keeping your feet on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Grab onto a Dominada Supina bar with one hand, using a pronated grip. Keep your feet on the Suelo or a step. AlBajo the majority of your weight to Colgado from that hand, while keeping your feet on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch Laterals.

Dorsales.name: Sobre la Cabeza Lat
Dorsales.instructions:
Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your tricep and wrist. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to pull your upper arm to your side as your partner prevents you from doing actually doing so.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and allow your partner to further stretch the lat by applying gentle pressure to the tricep. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Sit upright on the floor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your tricep and wrist. This will be your starting position.
Attempt to pull your upper arm to your side as your partner prevents you from doing actually doing so.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and allow your partner to further stretch the lat by applying gentle pressure to the tricep. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Sit Vertical on the Suelo with your partner behind you. Elevación Un Brazo straight up, and flex the elbow, attempting to touch your hand to your Espalda. Your parner should hold your tricep and Muñeca. This will be your starting position. Attempt to pull your upper arm to your Lateral as your partner prevents you from doing actually doing so. After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and alBajo your partner to further stretch the lat by appRecostado gentle Pressure to the tricep. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch Laterals.

Dorsales.name: Sobre la Cabeza Slam
Dorsales.instructions:
Hold a medine ball with both hands and stand with your feet at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the countermovement by raising the ball above your head and fully extending your body.
Reverse the motion, slamming the ball into the ground directly in front of you as hard as you can.
Receive the ball with both hands on the bounce and repeat the movement.
Dorsales.instructions_en:
Hold a medine ball with both hands and stand with your feet at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the countermovement by raising the ball above your head and fully extending your body.
Reverse the motion, slamming the ball into the ground directly in front of you as hard as you can.
Receive the ball with both hands on the bounce and repeat the movement.
Dorsales.instructions_es: Hold a medine ball with both hands and stand with your feet at Hombro width. This will be your starting position. Initiate the countermovement by raising the ball above your head and fully extending your body. Inverso the motion, slamming the ball into the ground directly in Frontal of you as hard as you can. Receive the ball with both hands on the bounce and repeat the movement.

Dorsales.name: Dominadas
Dorsales.instructions:
Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.
As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degrees or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.
Pull your torso up until the bar touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and the upper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squeezing the back muscles once you reach the full contracted position. The upper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fully extended and the lats are fully stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

For a medium grip, your hands need to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaller than your shoulder width.
