Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise correctly, the front of the knees should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knees are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stress on the knee and the exercise has been performed incorrectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the ball of your foot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Alternating Cable Shoulder Press
Hombros.instructions:
Move the cables to the bottom of the tower and select an appropriate weight.
Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to press one side directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Move the cables to the bottom of the tower and select an appropriate weight.
Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to press one side directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
Hombros.instructions_es: Move the Poleas to the bottom of the tower and select an appropriate weight. Grasp the Poleas and hold them at Hombro height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position. Keeping your head and Pecho up, extend through the elbow to Press one Lateral directly over head. After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite Lateral.

Hombros.name: Alternando Deltoid Elevación
Hombros.instructions:
In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
Return the weights to your side.
On the next repetition, raise the weights laterally, raising them out to your side to about shoulder height.
Return the weights to the starting position and continue alternating to the front and side.
Hombros.instructions_en:
In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
Return the weights to your side.
On the next repetition, raise the weights laterally, raising them out to your side to about shoulder height.
Return the weights to the starting position and continue alternating to the front and side.
Hombros.instructions_es: In a De Pie position, hold a pair of Mancuernas at your Lateral. Keeping your elbows slightly bent, Elevación the weights directly in Frontal of you to Hombro height, avoiding any swinging or cheating. Return the weights to your Lateral. On the next repetition, Elevación the weights Laterally, raising them out to your Lateral to about Hombro height. Return the weights to the starting position and continue Alternando to the Frontal and Lateral.

Hombros.name: Alternating Kettlebell Press
Hombros.instructions:
Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Press one directly overhead by extending through the elbow, turning it so the palm faces forward while holding the other kettlebell stationary .
Lower the pressed kettlebell to the starting position and immediately press with your other arm.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Press one directly overhead by extending through the elbow, turning it so the palm faces forward while holding the other kettlebell stationary .
Lower the pressed kettlebell to the starting position and immediately press with your other arm.
Hombros.instructions_es: Cargada two Pesa Rusas to your Hombros. Cargada the Pesa Rusas to your Hombros by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you pull the Pesa Rusas towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñecas as you do so. Press one directly Sobre la Cabeza by extending through the elbow, turning it so the palm faces forward while holding the other Pesa Rusa stationary . Bajoer the Pressed Pesa Rusa to the starting position and immediately Press with your other arm.

Hombros.name: Anti-gravity Press
Hombros.instructions:
Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbell up from the floor. Flex the elbows, performing a reverse curl to bring the bar near your chest. This will be your starting position.
To begin, press the barbell out in front of your head by extending your elbows. Keep your arms parallel to the ground throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat to complete the set.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbell up from the floor. Flex the elbows, performing a reverse curl to bring the bar near your chest. This will be your starting position.
To begin, press the barbell out in front of your head by extending your elbows. Keep your arms parallel to the ground throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat to complete the set.
Hombros.instructions_es: Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an Banca Inclinada. Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the Barra up from the Suelo. Flex the elbows, performing a Curl Inverso to bring the bar near your Pecho. This will be your starting position. To begin, Press the Barra out in Frontal of your head by extending your elbows. Keep your arms parallel to the ground throughout the movement. Return to the starting position and repeat to complete the set.

Hombros.name: Arm Circles
Hombros.instructions:
Stand up and extend your arms straight out by the sides. The arms should be parallel to the floor and perpendicular (90-degree angle) to your torso. This will be your starting position.
Slowly start to make circles of about 1 foot in diameter with each outstretched arm. Breathe normally as you perform the movement.
Continue the circular motion of the outstretched arms for about ten seconds. Then reverse the movement, going the opposite direction.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Stand up and extend your arms straight out by the sides. The arms should be parallel to the floor and perpendicular (90-degree angle) to your torso. This will be your starting position.
Slowly start to make circles of about 1 foot in diameter with each outstretched arm. Breathe normally as you perform the movement.
Continue the circular motion of the outstretched arms for about ten seconds. Then reverse the movement, going the opposite direction.
Hombros.instructions_es: Stand up and extend your arms straight out by the Laterals. The arms should be parallel to the Suelo and perpendicular (90-degree angle) to your torso. This will be your starting position. SBajoly start to make circles of about 1 foot in diameter with each outstretched arm. Breathe normally as you perform the movement. Continue the circular motion of the outstretched arms for about ten seconds. Then Inverso the movement, going the opposite direction.

Hombros.name: Arnold Dumbbell Press
Hombros.instructions:
Sit on an exercise bench with back support and hold two dumbbells in front of you at about upper chest level with your palms facing your body and your elbows bent. Tip: Your arms should be next to your torso. The starting position should look like the contracted portion of a dumbbell curl.
Now to perform the movement, raise the dumbbells as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
Continue lifting the dumbbells until your arms are extended above you in straight arm position. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement.
After a second pause at the top, begin to lower the dumbbells to the original position by rotating the palms of your hands towards you. Tip: The left arm will be rotated in a counter clockwise manner while the right one will be rotated clockwise. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit on an exercise bench with back support and hold two dumbbells in front of you at about upper chest level with your palms facing your body and your elbows bent. Tip: Your arms should be next to your torso. The starting position should look like the contracted portion of a dumbbell curl.
Now to perform the movement, raise the dumbbells as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
Continue lifting the dumbbells until your arms are extended above you in straight arm position. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement.
After a second pause at the top, begin to lower the dumbbells to the original position by rotating the palms of your hands towards you. Tip: The left arm will be rotated in a counter clockwise manner while the right one will be rotated clockwise. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit on an exercise bench with Espalda support and hold two Mancuernas in Frontal of you at about upper Pecho level with your palms facing your body and your elbows bent. Tip: Your arms should be next to your torso. The starting position should look like the contracted portion of a Mancuerna Curl. Now to perform the movement, Elevación the Mancuernas as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. Continue lifting the Mancuernas until your arms are extended above you in straight arm position. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. After a second pause at the top, begin to Bajoer the Mancuernas to the original position by rotating the palms of your hands towards you. Tip: The left arm will be rotated in a counter clockwise manner while the right one will be rotated clockwise. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Espalda Aperturases - With Bandas
Hombros.instructions:
Run a band around a stationary post like that of a squat rack.
Grab the band by the handles and stand back so that the tension in the band rises.
Extend and lift the arms straight in front of you. Tip: Your arms should be straight and parallel to the floor while perpendicular to your torso. Your feet should be firmly planted on the floor spread at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, move your arms to the sides and back. Keep your arms extended and parallel to the floor. Continue the movement until the arms are extended to your sides.
After a pause, go back to the original position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Run a band around a stationary post like that of a squat rack.
Grab the band by the handles and stand back so that the tension in the band rises.
Extend and lift the arms straight in front of you. Tip: Your arms should be straight and parallel to the floor while perpendicular to your torso. Your feet should be firmly planted on the floor spread at shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, move your arms to the sides and back. Keep your arms extended and parallel to the floor. Continue the movement until the arms are extended to your sides.
After a pause, go back to the original position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Run a Banda around a stationary post like that of a Sentadilla rack. Grab the Banda by the handles and stand Espalda so that the tension in the Banda rises. Extend and lift the arms straight in Frontal of you. Tip: Your arms should be straight and parallel to the Suelo while perpendicular to your torso. Your feet should be firmly planted on the Suelo spread at Hombro width. This will be your starting position. As you exhale, move your arms to the Laterals and Espalda. Keep your arms extended and parallel to the Suelo. Continue the movement until the arms are extended to your Laterals. After a pause, go Espalda to the original position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Espaldaward Medicine Ball Thremo
Hombros.instructions:
This exercise is best done with a partner. If you lack a partner, the ball can be thrown and retrieved or thrown against a wall.
Begin standing a few meters in front of your partner, both facing the same direction. Begin holding the ball between your legs.
Squat down and then forcefully reverse direction, coming to full extension and you toss the ball over your head to your partner.
Your partner can then roll the ball back to you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
This exercise is best done with a partner. If you lack a partner, the ball can be thrown and retrieved or thrown against a wall.
Begin standing a few meters in front of your partner, both facing the same direction. Begin holding the ball between your legs.
Squat down and then forcefully reverse direction, coming to full extension and you toss the ball over your head to your partner.
Your partner can then roll the ball back to you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: This exercise is best done with a partner. If you lack a partner, the ball can be thRemon and retrieved or thRemon against a wall. Begin De Pie a few meters in Frontal of your partner, both facing the same direction. Begin holding the ball between your Piernas. Sentadilla down and then forcefully Inverso direction, coming to full Extensión and you toss the ball over your head to your partner. Your partner can then roll the ball Espalda to you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Banda Pull Apart
Hombros.instructions:
Begin with your arms extended straight out in front of you, holding the band with both hands.
Initiate the movement by performing a reverse fly motion, moving your hands out laterally to your sides.
Keep your elbows extended as you perform the movement, bringing the band to your chest. Ensure that you keep your shoulders back during the exercise.
Pause as you complete the movement, returning to the starting position under control.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Begin with your arms extended straight out in front of you, holding the band with both hands.
Initiate the movement by performing a reverse fly motion, moving your hands out laterally to your sides.
Keep your elbows extended as you perform the movement, bringing the band to your chest. Ensure that you keep your shoulders back during the exercise.
Pause as you complete the movement, returning to the starting position under control.
Hombros.instructions_es: Begin with your arms extended straight out in Frontal of you, holding the Banda with both hands. Initiate the movement by performing a Inverso Aperturas motion, moving your hands out Laterally to your Laterals. Keep your elbows extended as you perform the movement, bringing the Banda to your Pecho. Ensure that you keep your Hombros Espalda during the exercise. Pause as you complete the movement, returning to the starting position under control.

Hombros.name: Barra Inclinado Hombro Elevación
Hombros.instructions:
Lie back on an Incline Bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms straight. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the arms straight, lift the bar by protracting your shoulder blades, raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the bar to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Lie back on an Incline Bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms straight. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the arms straight, lift the bar by protracting your shoulder blades, raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the bar to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Lie Espalda on an Banca Inclinada. Using a medium width grip (a grip that is slightly wider than Hombro width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms straight. This will be your starting position. While keeping the arms straight, lift the bar by protracting your Hombro blades, raising the Hombros from the bench as you breathe out. Bring Espalda the bar to the starting position as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Barra Deltoides Posterior Remo
Hombros.instructions:
Stand up straight while holding a barbell using a wide (higher than shoulder width) and overhand (palms facing your body) grip.
Bend knees slightly and bend over as you keep the natural arch of your back. Let the arms hang in front of you as they hold the bar. Once your torso is parallel to the floor, flare the elbows out and away from your body. Tip: Your torso and your arms should resemble the letter "T". Now you are ready to begin the exercise.
While keeping the upper arms perpendicular to the torso, pull the barbell up towards your upper chest as you squeeze the rear delts and you breathe out. Tip: When performed correctly, this exercise should resemble a bench press in reverse. Also, refrain from using your biceps to do the work. Focus on targeting the rear delts; the arms should only act as hooks.
Slowly go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Stand up straight while holding a barbell using a wide (higher than shoulder width) and overhand (palms facing your body) grip.
Bend knees slightly and bend over as you keep the natural arch of your back. Let the arms hang in front of you as they hold the bar. Once your torso is parallel to the floor, flare the elbows out and away from your body. Tip: Your torso and your arms should resemble the letter "T". Now you are ready to begin the exercise.
While keeping the upper arms perpendicular to the torso, pull the barbell up towards your upper chest as you squeeze the rear delts and you breathe out. Tip: When performed correctly, this exercise should resemble a bench press in reverse. Also, refrain from using your biceps to do the work. Focus on targeting the rear delts; the arms should only act as hooks.
Slowly go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Stand up straight while holding a Barra using a wide (Altoer than Hombro width) and overhand (palms facing your body) grip. Bend knees slightly and bend over as you keep the natural arch of your Espalda. Let the arms Colgado in Frontal of you as they hold the bar. Once your torso is parallel to the Suelo, flare the elbows out and away from your body. Tip: Your torso and your arms should resemble the letter "T". Now you are ready to begin the exercise. While keeping the upper arms perpendicular to the torso, pull the Barra up towards your upper Pecho as you squeeze the Deltoides Posteriors and you breathe out. Tip: When performed correctly, this exercise should resemble a Press de Banca in Inverso. Also, refrain from using your Bíceps to do the work. Focus on targeting the Deltoides Posteriors; the arms should only act as hooks. SBajoly go Espalda to the initial position as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Barbell Shoulder Press
Hombros.instructions:
Sit on a bench with back support in a squat rack. Position a barbell at a height that is just above your head. Grab the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing forward).
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip width, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the shoulders slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit on a bench with back support in a squat rack. Position a barbell at a height that is just above your head. Grab the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing forward).
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip width, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the shoulders slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit on a bench with Espalda support in a Sentadilla rack. Position a Barra at a height that is just above your head. Grab the Barra with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Once you pick up the Barra with the correct grip width, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about Hombro level and slightly in Frontal of your head. This is your starting position. Bajoer the bar down to the Hombros sBajoly as you inhale. Lift the bar Espalda up to the starting position as you exhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Battling Ropes
Hombros.instructions:
For this exercise you will need a heavy rope anchored at its center 15-20 feet away. Standing in front of the rope, take an end in each hand with your arms extended at your side. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rapidly raising one arm to shoulder level as quickly as you can.
As you let that arm drop to the starting position, raise the opposite side.
Continue alternating your left and right arms, whipping the ropes up and down as fast as you can.
Hombros.instructions_en:
For this exercise you will need a heavy rope anchored at its center 15-20 feet away. Standing in front of the rope, take an end in each hand with your arms extended at your side. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rapidly raising one arm to shoulder level as quickly as you can.
As you let that arm drop to the starting position, raise the opposite side.
Continue alternating your left and right arms, whipping the ropes up and down as fast as you can.
Hombros.instructions_es: For this exercise you will need a heavy rope anchored at its center 15-20 feet away. De Pie in Frontal of the rope, take an end in each hand with your arms extended at your Lateral. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement by rapidly raising Un Brazo to Hombro level as quickly as you can. As you let that arm drop to the starting position, Elevación the opposite Lateral. Continue Alternando your left and right arms, wCaderaping the ropes up and down as fast as you can.

Hombros.name: Inclinado Mancuerna Deltoides Posterior Elevación With Head On Bench
Hombros.instructions:
Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand and with an incline bench in front of you.
While keeping your back straight and maintaining the natural arch of your back, lean forward until your forehead touches the bench in front of you. Let the arms hang in front of you perpendicular to the ground. The palms of your hands should be facing each other and your torso should be parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows, lift the dumbbells straight to the side until both arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift the weights. Caution: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms back as opposed to the side.
After a one second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.name_en: Bent Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise With Head On Bench
Hombros.instructions_en:
Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand and with an incline bench in front of you.
While keeping your back straight and maintaining the natural arch of your back, lean forward until your forehead touches the bench in front of you. Let the arms hang in front of you perpendicular to the ground. The palms of your hands should be facing each other and your torso should be parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows, lift the dumbbells straight to the side until both arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you lift the weights. Caution: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms back as opposed to the side.
After a one second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Stand up straight while holding a Mancuerna in each hand and with an Banca Inclinada in Frontal of you. While keeping your Espalda straight and maintaining the natural arch of your Espalda, lean forward until your forehead touches the bench in Frontal of you. Let the arms Colgado in Frontal of you perpendicular to the ground. The palms of your hands should be facing each other and your torso should be parallel to the Suelo. This will be your starting position. Keeping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows, lift the Mancuernas straight to the Lateral until both arms are parallel to the Suelo. Exhale as you lift the weights. Caution: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms Espalda as opposed to the Lateral. After a one second contraction at the top, sBajoly Bajoer the Mancuernas Espalda to the starting position. Repeat the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Inclinado Bajo-pulley Lateral Lateral
Hombros.instructions:
Select a weight and hold the handle of the low pulley with your right hand.
Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Your legs should be slightly bent with your left hand placed on your lower left thigh. Your right arm should be hanging from your shoulder in front of you and with a slight bend at the elbow. This will be your starting position.
Raise your right arm, elbow slightly bent, to the side until the arm is parallel to the floor and in line with your right ear. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and repeat the movement with the other arm.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Select a weight and hold the handle of the low pulley with your right hand.
Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Your legs should be slightly bent with your left hand placed on your lower left thigh. Your right arm should be hanging from your shoulder in front of you and with a slight bend at the elbow. This will be your starting position.
Raise your right arm, elbow slightly bent, to the side until the arm is parallel to the floor and in line with your right ear. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and repeat the movement with the other arm.
Hombros.instructions_es: Select a weight and hold the handle of the Bajo pulley with your right hand. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the Suelo. Your Piernas should be slightly bent with your left hand placed on your Bajoer left tAlto. Your right arm should be Colgadoing from your Hombro in Frontal of you and with a slight bend at the elbow. This will be your starting position. Elevación your right arm, elbow slightly bent, to the Lateral until the arm is parallel to the Suelo and in line with your right ear. Breathe out as you perform this step. SBajoly Bajoer the weight Espalda to the starting position as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and repeat the movement with the other arm.

Hombros.name: Bradford/rocky Presses
Hombros.instructions:
Sit on a Military Press Bench with a bar at shoulder level with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than shoulder width and it should create a 90-degree angle between the forearm and the upper arm as the barbell goes down. This is your starting position.
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms.
Now lower the bar down to the back of the head slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Lower the bar down to the starting position slowly as you inhale. This is one repetition.
Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit on a Military Press Bench with a bar at shoulder level with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than shoulder width and it should create a 90-degree angle between the forearm and the upper arm as the barbell goes down. This is your starting position.
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms.
Now lower the bar down to the back of the head slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Lower the bar down to the starting position slowly as you inhale. This is one repetition.
Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit on a Press Militar Bench with a bar at Hombro level with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than Hombro width and it should create a 90-degree angle between the foPosteriorm and the upper arm as the Barra goes down. This is your starting position. Once you pick up the Barra with the correct grip, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Now Bajoer the bar down to the Espalda of the head sBajoly as you inhale. Lift the bar Espalda up to the starting position as you exhale. Bajoer the bar down to the starting position sBajoly as you inhale. This is one repetition. Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Polea Internal Rotation
Hombros.instructions:
Sit next to a low pulley sideways (with legs stretched in front of you or crossed) and grasp the single hand cable attachment with the arm nearest to the cable. Tip: If you can adjust the pulley's height, you can use a flat bench to sit on instead.
Position the elbow against your side with the elbow bent at 90° and the arm pointing towards the pulley. This will be your starting position.
Pull the single hand cable attachment toward your body by internally rotating your shoulder until your forearm is across your abs. You will be creating an imaginary semi-circle. Tip: The forearm should be perpendicular to your torso at all times.
Slowly go back to the initial position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then repeat the movement with the next arm.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit next to a low pulley sideways (with legs stretched in front of you or crossed) and grasp the single hand cable attachment with the arm nearest to the cable. Tip: If you can adjust the pulley's height, you can use a flat bench to sit on instead.
Position the elbow against your side with the elbow bent at 90° and the arm pointing towards the pulley. This will be your starting position.
Pull the single hand cable attachment toward your body by internally rotating your shoulder until your forearm is across your abs. You will be creating an imaginary semi-circle. Tip: The forearm should be perpendicular to your torso at all times.
Slowly go back to the initial position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then repeat the movement with the next arm.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit next to a Bajo pulley Lateralways (with Piernas stretched in Frontal of you or crossed) and grasp the single hand Polea attachment with the arm nearest to the Polea. Tip: If you can adjust the pulley's height, you can use a flat bench to sit on instead. Position the elbow against your Lateral with the elbow bent at 90° and the arm pointing towards the pulley. This will be your starting position. Pull the single hand Polea attachment toward your body by internally rotating your Hombro until your foPosteriorm is across your abs. You will be creating an imaginary semi-circle. Tip: The foPosteriorm should be perpendicular to your torso at all times. SBajoly go Espalda to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then repeat the movement with the next arm.

Hombros.name: Polea Pájaros
Hombros.instructions:
Adjust the pulleys to the appropriate height and adjust the weight. The pulleys should be above your head.
Grab the left pulley with your right hand and the right pulley with your left hand, crossing them in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by moving your arms back and outward, keeping your arms straight as you execute the movement.
Pause at the end of the motion before returning the handles to the start position.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Adjust the pulleys to the appropriate height and adjust the weight. The pulleys should be above your head.
Grab the left pulley with your right hand and the right pulley with your left hand, crossing them in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by moving your arms back and outward, keeping your arms straight as you execute the movement.
Pause at the end of the motion before returning the handles to the start position.
Hombros.instructions_es: Adjust the pulleys to the appropriate height and adjust the weight. The pulleys should be above your head. Grab the left pulley with your right hand and the right pulley with your left hand, crossing them in Frontal of you. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement by moving your arms Espalda and outward, keeping your arms straight as you execute the movement. Pause at the end of the motion before returning the handles to the start position.

Hombros.name: Polea Rope Posterior-delt Remos
Hombros.instructions:
Sit in the same position on a low pulley row station as you would if you were doing seated cable rows for the back.
Attach a rope to the pulley and grasp it with an overhand grip. Your arms should be extended and parallel to the floor with the elbows flared out.
Keep your lower back upright and slide your hips back so that your knees are slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Pull the cable attachment towards your upper chest, just below the neck, as you keep your elbows up and out to the sides. Continue this motion as you exhale until the elbows travel slightly behind the back. Tip: Keep your upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to the torso and parallel to the floor throughout the motion.
Go back to the initial position where the arms are extended and the shoulders are stretched forward. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit in the same position on a low pulley row station as you would if you were doing seated cable rows for the back.
Attach a rope to the pulley and grasp it with an overhand grip. Your arms should be extended and parallel to the floor with the elbows flared out.
Keep your lower back upright and slide your hips back so that your knees are slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Pull the cable attachment towards your upper chest, just below the neck, as you keep your elbows up and out to the sides. Continue this motion as you exhale until the elbows travel slightly behind the back. Tip: Keep your upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to the torso and parallel to the floor throughout the motion.
Go back to the initial position where the arms are extended and the shoulders are stretched forward. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit in the same position on a Bajo pulley Remo station as you would if you were doing Sentado Polea Remos for the Espalda. Attach a rope to the pulley and grasp it with an overhand grip. Your arms should be extended and parallel to the Suelo with the elbows flared out. Keep your Bajoer Espalda Vertical and slide your Caderas Espalda so that your knees are slightly bent. This will be your starting position. Pull the Polea attachment towards your upper Pecho, just beBajo the neck, as you keep your elbows up and out to the Laterals. Continue this motion as you exhale until the elbows travel slightly behind the Espalda. Tip: Keep your upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to the torso and parallel to the Suelo throughout the motion. Go Espalda to the initial position where the arms are extended and the Hombros are stretched forward. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Polea Sentado Elevación Lateral
Hombros.instructions:
Stand in the middle of two low pulleys that are opposite to each other and place a flat bench right behind you (in perpendicular fashion to you; the narrow edge of the bench should be the one behind you). Select the weight to be used on each pulley.
Now sit at the edge of the flat bench behind you with your feet placed in front of your knees.
Bend forward while keeping your back flat and rest your torso on the thighs.
Have someone give you the single handles attached to the pulleys. Grasp the left pulley with the right hand and the right pulley with the left after you select your weight. The pulleys should run under your knees and your arms will be extended with palms facing each other and a slight bend at the elbows. This will be the starting position.
While keeping the arms stationary, raise the upper arms to the sides until they are parallel to the floor and at shoulder height. Exhale during the execution of this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your arms to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Tip: Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and a fixed elbow position (10 degree to 30 degree angle) throughout exercise.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Stand in the middle of two low pulleys that are opposite to each other and place a flat bench right behind you (in perpendicular fashion to you; the narrow edge of the bench should be the one behind you). Select the weight to be used on each pulley.
Now sit at the edge of the flat bench behind you with your feet placed in front of your knees.
Bend forward while keeping your back flat and rest your torso on the thighs.
Have someone give you the single handles attached to the pulleys. Grasp the left pulley with the right hand and the right pulley with the left after you select your weight. The pulleys should run under your knees and your arms will be extended with palms facing each other and a slight bend at the elbows. This will be the starting position.
While keeping the arms stationary, raise the upper arms to the sides until they are parallel to the floor and at shoulder height. Exhale during the execution of this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your arms to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Tip: Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and a fixed elbow position (10 degree to 30 degree angle) throughout exercise.
Hombros.instructions_es: Stand in the middle of two Bajo pulleys that are opposite to each other and place a flat bench right behind you (in perpendicular fashion to you; the narRemo edge of the bench should be the one behind you). Select the weight to be used on each pulley. Now sit at the edge of the flat bench behind you with your feet placed in Frontal of your knees. Bend forward while keeping your Espalda flat and rest your torso on the tAltos. Have someone give you the single handles attached to the pulleys. Grasp the left pulley with the right hand and the right pulley with the left after you select your weight. The pulleys should run under your knees and your arms will be extended with palms facing each other and a slight bend at the elbows. This will be the starting position. While keeping the arms stationary, Elevación the upper arms to the Laterals until they are parallel to the Suelo and at Hombro height. Exhale during the execution of this movement and hold the contraction for a second. SBajoly Bajoer your arms to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Tip: Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and a fixed elbow position (10 degree to 30 degree angle) throughout exercise.

Hombros.name: Cable Shoulder Press
Hombros.instructions:
Move the cables to the bottom of the towers and select an appropriate weight.
Stand directly in between the uprights. Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to press the handles directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Move the cables to the bottom of the towers and select an appropriate weight.
Stand directly in between the uprights. Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to press the handles directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat.
Hombros.instructions_es: Move the Poleas to the bottom of the towers and select an appropriate weight. Stand directly in between the Verticals. Grasp the Poleas and hold them at Hombro height, palms facing forward. This will be your starting position. Keeping your head and Pecho up, extend through the elbow to Press the handles directly over head. After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat.

Hombros.name: Car Drivers
Hombros.instructions:
While standing upright, hold a barbell plate in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended straight out in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rotating the plate as far to one side as possible. Use the same type of movement you would use to turn a steering wheel to one side.
Reverse the motion, turning it all the way to the opposite side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
While standing upright, hold a barbell plate in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended straight out in front of you. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rotating the plate as far to one side as possible. Use the same type of movement you would use to turn a steering wheel to one side.
Reverse the motion, turning it all the way to the opposite side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: While De Pie Vertical, hold a Barra Disco in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended straight out in Frontal of you. This will be your starting position. Initiate the movement by rotating the Disco as far to one Lateral as possible. Use the same type of movement you would use to turn a steering wheel to one Lateral. Inverso the motion, turning it all the way to the opposite Lateral. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Chair Upper Body Stretch
Hombros.instructions:
Sit on the edge of a chair, gripping the back of it.
Straighten your arms, keeping your back straight, and pull your upper body forward so you feel a stretch. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit on the edge of a chair, gripping the back of it.
Straighten your arms, keeping your back straight, and pull your upper body forward so you feel a stretch. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit on the edge of a chair, gripping the Espalda of it. Straighten your arms, keeping your Espalda straight, and pull your upper body forward so you feel a stretch. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

Hombros.name: Circus Bell
Hombros.instructions:
The circus bell is an oversized dumbbell with a thick handle. Begin with the dumbbell between your feet, and grip the handle with both hands.
Clean the dumbbell by extending through your hips and knees to deliver the implement to the desired shoulder, letting go with the extra hand.
Ensure that you get one of the dumbbell heads behind the shoulder to keep from being thrown off balance. To raise it overhead, dip by flexing the knees, and the drive upwards as you extend the dumbbell overhead, leaning slightly away from it as you do so.
Carefully guide the bell back to the floor, keeping it under control as much as possible. It is best to perform this event on a thick rubber mat to prevent damage to the floor.
Hombros.instructions_en:
The circus bell is an oversized dumbbell with a thick handle. Begin with the dumbbell between your feet, and grip the handle with both hands.
Clean the dumbbell by extending through your hips and knees to deliver the implement to the desired shoulder, letting go with the extra hand.
Ensure that you get one of the dumbbell heads behind the shoulder to keep from being thrown off balance. To raise it overhead, dip by flexing the knees, and the drive upwards as you extend the dumbbell overhead, leaning slightly away from it as you do so.
Carefully guide the bell back to the floor, keeping it under control as much as possible. It is best to perform this event on a thick rubber mat to prevent damage to the floor.
Hombros.instructions_es: The circus bell is an oversized Mancuerna with a thick handle. Begin with the Mancuerna between your feet, and grip the handle with both hands. Cargada the Mancuerna by extending through your Caderas and knees to deliver the implement to the desired Hombro, letting go with the extra hand. Ensure that you get one of the Mancuerna heads behind the Hombro to keep from being thRemon off balance. To Elevación it Sobre la Cabeza, Fondo by flexing the knees, and the drive upwards as you extend the Mancuerna Sobre la Cabeza, leaning slightly away from it as you do so. Carefully guide the bell Espalda to the Suelo, keeping it under control as much as possible. It is best to perform this event on a thick rubber mat to prevent damage to the Suelo.

Hombros.name: Cargada And Envión
Hombros.instructions:
With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand or hook grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.
As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom squat position, which will help in the recovery.
Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.
The second phase is the jerk, which raises the weight overhead. Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible.
Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.
At this moment as the feet leave the floor, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible. In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should be split, with one foot forward, and one foot back. Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead. Return to a standing position.
Hombros.instructions_en:
With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand or hook grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.
Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.

Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.

With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible.
Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.
At this moment as the feet leave the floor, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible. In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should be split, with one foot forward, and one foot back. Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead. Return to a standing position.
Hombros.instructions_es: With a Barra on the Suelo close to the shins, take an overhand or hook grip just outLateral the Piernas. Bajoer your Caderas with the weight focused on the heels, Espalda straight, head facing forward, Pecho up, with your Hombros just in Frontal of the bar. This will be your starting position. Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your Espalda angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees. Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the Cargada. As the bar approaches the mid-tAlto position, begin extending through the Caderas. In a Saltoing motion, accelerate by extending the Caderas, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly Espalda, with the arms still extended. As full Extensión is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively Encogimientoging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak Extensión, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a Frontal Sentadilla position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted Hombros, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom Sentadilla position, which will help in the recovery. Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso Vertical and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a De Pie position. The second phase is the Envión, which Elevacións the weight Sobre la Cabeza. De Pie with the weight racked on the Frontal of the Hombros, begin with the Fondo. With your feet directly under your Caderas, flex the knees without moving the Caderas Espaldaward. Go down only slightly, and Inverso direction as Powerfully as possible. Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the Hombros. At this moment as the feet leave the Suelo, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible. In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should be Split, with one foot forward, and one foot Espalda. Receive the bar with the arms locked out Sobre la Cabeza. Return to a De Pie position.

Hombros.name: Clean And Press
Hombros.instructions:
Assume a shoulder-width stance, with knees inside the arms. Now while keeping the back flat, bend at the knees and hips so that you can grab the bar with the arms fully extended and a pronated grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width. Point the elbows out to sides. The bar should be close to the shins. Position the shoulders over or slightly ahead of the bar. Establish a flat back posture. This will be your starting position.
Begin to pull the bar by extending the knees. Move your hips forward and raise the shoulders at the same rate while keeping the angle of the back constant; continue to lift the bar straight up while keeping it close to your body.
As the bar passes the knee, extend at the ankles, knees, and hips forcefully, similar to a jumping motion. As you do so, continue to guide the bar with your hands, shrugging your shoulders and using the momentum from your movement to pull the bar as high as possible. The bar should travel close to your body, and you should keep your elbows out.
At maximum elevation, your feet should clear the floor and you should start to pull yourself under the bar. The mechanics of this could change slightly, depending on the weight used. You should descend into a squatting position as you pull yourself under the bar.
As the bar hits terminal height, rotate your elbows around and under the bar. Rack the bar across the front of the shoulders while keeping the torso erect and flexing the hips and knees to absorb the weight of the bar.
Stand to full height, holding the bar in the clean position.
Without moving your feet, press the bar overhead as you exhale. Lower the bar under control .

Move your Caderas forward and Elevación the Hombros at the same rate while keeping the angle of the Espalda constant; continue to lift the bar straight up while keeping it close to your body. As you do so, continue to guide the bar with your hands, Encogimientoging your Hombros and using the momentum from your movement to pull the bar as Alto as possible. The bar should travel close to your body, and you should keep your elbows out. At maximum elevation, your feet should clear the Suelo and you should start to pull yourself under the bar. The mechanics of this could cColgadoe slightly, depending on the weight used. You should descend into a Sentadillating position as you pull yourself under the bar. As the bar hits terminal height, rotate your elbows around and under the bar. Rack the bar across the Frontal of the Hombros while keeping the torso erect and flexing the Caderas and knees to absorb the weight of the bar. Stand to full height, holding the bar in the Cargada position. Without moving your feet, Press the bar Sobre la Cabeza as you exhale. Bajoer the bar under control .

Hombros.name: Crucifix
Hombros.instructions:
In the crucifix, you statically hold weights out to the side for time. While the event can be practiced using dumbbells, it is best to practice with one of the various implements used, such as axes and hammers, as it feels different.
Begin standing, and raise your arms out to the side holding the implements. Your arms should be parallel to the ground. In competition, judges or sensors are used to let you know when you break parallel. Hold for as long as you can. Typically, the weights should be heavy enough that you fail in 30-60 seconds.
Hombros.instructions_en:
In the crucifix, you statically hold weights out to the side for time. While the event can be practiced using dumbbells, it is best to practice with one of the various implements used, such as axes and hammers, as it feels different.

Hombros.instructions_es: In the crucifix, you statically hold weights out to the Lateral for time. While the event can be practiced using Mancuernas, it is best to practice with one of the various implements used, such as axes and Martillos, as it feels different. Begin De Pie, and Elevación your arms out to the Lateral holding the implements. Your arms should be parallel to the ground. In competition, judges or sensors are used to let you know when you break parallel. Hold for as long as you can. Typically, the weights should be heavy enough that you fail in 30-60 seconds.

Hombros.name: Cuban Press
Hombros.instructions:
Take a dumbbell in each hand with a pronated grip in a standing position. Raise your upper arms so that they are parallel to the floor, allowing your lower arms to hang in the "scarecrow" position. This will be your starting position.
To initiate the movement, externally rotate the shoulders to move the upper arm 180 degrees. Keep the upper arms in place, rotating the upper arms until the wrists are directly above the elbows, the forearms perpendicular to the floor.
Now press the dumbbells by extending at the elbows, straightening your arms overhead.
Return to the starting position as you breathe in by reversing the steps.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Take a dumbbell in each hand with a pronated grip in a standing position. Raise your upper arms so that they are parallel to the floor, allowing your lower arms to hang in the "scarecrow" position. This will be your starting position.

Hombros.instructions_es: Take a Mancuerna in each hand with a pronated grip in a De Pie position. Elevación your upper arms so that they are parallel to the Suelo, alBajoing your Bajoer arms to Colgado in the "scarecRemo" position. This will be your starting position. To initiate the movement, externally rotate the Hombros to move the upper arm 180 degrees. Keep the upper arms in place, rotating the upper arms until the Muñecas are directly above the elbows, the foPosteriorms perpendicular to the Suelo. Now Press the Mancuernas by extending at the elbows, straightening your arms Sobre la Cabeza. Return to the starting position as you breathe in by reversing the steps. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Double Pesa Rusa Envión
Hombros.instructions:
Hold a kettlebell by the handle in each hand.
Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward. This will be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.
Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum.
As you do so, press the kettlebells overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weights.
Return your feet to the ground in a split fashion, with one foot forward and one foot back.
Keeping the weights overhead, return to a standing position, bringing your feet together. Lower the weights to perform the next repetition.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Hold a kettlebell by the handle in each hand.
Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward. This will be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.
Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum.
As you do so, press the kettlebells overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weights.
Return your feet to the ground in a split fashion, with one foot forward and one foot back.
Keeping the weights overhead, return to a standing position, bringing your feet together. Lower the weights to perform the next repetition.
Hombros.instructions_es: Hold a Pesa Rusa by the handle in each hand. Cargada the Pesa Rusas to your Hombros by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you pull the Pesa Rusas towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñecas as you do so, so that the palms face forward. This will be your starting position. Fondo your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso Vertical. Immediately Inverso direction, driving through the heels, in essence Saltoing to create momentum. As you do so, Press the Pesa Rusas Sobre la Cabeza to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weights. Return your feet to the ground in a Split fashion, with one foot forward and one foot Espalda. Keeping the weights Sobre la Cabeza, return to a De Pie position, bringing your feet together. Bajoer the weights to perform the next repetition.

Hombros.name: Double Kettlebell Push Press
Hombros.instructions:
Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders.
Squat down a few inches and reverse the motion rapidly. Use the momentum from the legs to drive the kettlebells overhead.
Once the kettlebells are locked out, lower the kettlebells to your shoulders and repeat.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders.
Squat down a few inches and reverse the motion rapidly. Use the momentum from the legs to drive the kettlebells overhead.
Once the kettlebells are locked out, lower the kettlebells to your shoulders and repeat.
Hombros.instructions_es: Cargada two Pesa Rusas to your Hombros. Sentadilla down a few inches and Inverso the motion rapidly. Use the momentum from the Piernas to drive the Pesa Rusas Sobre la Cabeza. Once the Pesa Rusas are locked out, Bajoer the Pesa Rusas to your Hombros and repeat.

Hombros.name: Double Pesa Rusa Arrancada
Hombros.instructions:
Place two kettlebells behind your feet. Bend your knees and sit back to pick up the kettlebells.
Swing the kettlebells between your legs forcefully and reverse the direction.
Drive through with your hips and lock the ketttlebells overhead in one uninterrupted motion.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Place two kettlebells behind your feet. Bend your knees and sit back to pick up the kettlebells.

Hombros.name: Mancuerna Inclinado Hombro Elevación
Hombros.instructions:
Sit on an Incline Bench while holding a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs.
Lift your legs up to kick the weights to your shoulders and lean back. Position the dumbbells above your shoulders with your arms extended. The arms should be perpendicular to the floor with your palms facing forward and knuckles pointing towards the ceiling. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the arms straight and locked, lift the dumbbells by raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the dumbbells to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit on an Incline Bench while holding a dumbbell on each hand on top of your thighs.
Lift your legs up to kick the weights to your shoulders and lean back. Position the dumbbells above your shoulders with your arms extended. The arms should be perpendicular to the floor with your palms facing forward and knuckles pointing towards the ceiling. This will be your starting position.
While keeping the arms straight and locked, lift the dumbbells by raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the dumbbells to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit on an Banca Inclinada while holding a Mancuerna on each hand on top of your tAltos. Lift your Piernas up to kick the weights to your Hombros and lean Espalda. Position the Mancuernas above your Hombros with your arms extended. The arms should be perpendicular to the Suelo with your palms facing forward and knuckles pointing towards the ceiling. This will be your starting position. While keeping the arms straight and locked, lift the Mancuernas by raising the Hombros from the bench as you breathe out. Bring Espalda the Mancuernas to the starting position as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Mancuerna Recostado Un Brazo Posterior Elevación Lateral
Hombros.instructions:
While holding a dumbbell in one hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.
Position the palm of the hand that is holding the dumbbell in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Now raise the arm with the dumbbell to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keeping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbell to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.name_en: Dumbbell Lying One-Arm Rear Lateral Raise
Hombros.instructions_en:
While holding a dumbbell in one hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.
Position the palm of the hand that is holding the dumbbell in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Now raise the arm with the dumbbell to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keeping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbell to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: While holding a Mancuerna in one hand, lay with your Pecho down on a slightly Inclinadod (around 15 degrees when measured from the Suelo) adjustable bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the Pierna of the bench for stability. Position the palm of the hand that is holding the Mancuerna in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This will be your starting position. Now Elevación the arm with the Mancuerna to the Lateral until your elbow is at Hombro height and your arm is roughly parallel to the Suelo as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keeping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second. SBajoly Bajoer the Mancuerna to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Mancuerna Recostado Posterior Elevación Lateral
Hombros.instructions:
While holding a dumbbell in each hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degrees when measured from the floor) adjustable bench.
Position the palms of the hands in a neutral manner (palms facing your torso) as you keep the arms extended with the elbows slightly bent. This will be your starting position.
Now raise the arms to the side until your elbows are at shoulder height and your arms are roughly parallel to the floor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arms perpendicular to the torso while keeping them extended throughout the movement. Also, keep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

Hombros.name: Dumbbell One-arm Shoulder Press
Hombros.instructions:
Grab a dumbbell and either sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.
Clean the dumbbell up to bring it to shoulder height. The other hand can be kept fully extended to the side, by the waist or grabbing a fixed surface.
Rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand is facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch arms.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Grab a dumbbell and either sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.
Clean the dumbbell up to bring it to shoulder height. The other hand can be kept fully extended to the side, by the waist or grabbing a fixed surface.
Rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand is facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch arms.
Hombros.instructions_es: Grab a Mancuerna and either sit on a Press Militar bench or a utility bench that has a Espalda support on it as you place the Mancuernas Vertical on top of your tAltos or stand up straight. Cargada the Mancuerna up to bring it to Hombro height. The other hand can be kept fully extended to the Lateral, by the waist or grabbing a fixed surface. Rotate the Muñeca so that the palm of your hand is facing forward. This is your starting position. As you exhale, push the Mancuerna up until your arm is fully extended. After a second pause, sBajoly come down Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch arms.

Hombros.name: Mancuerna Un Brazo Remo al Mentón
Hombros.instructions:
Grab a dumbbell and stand up straight with your arm extended in front of you with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight. This will be your starting position. Tip: The dumbbell should be resting on top of your thigh with the palm of your hands facing your thighs.
Keep the other hand can be kept fully extended to the side, by the waist or grabbing a fixed surface. This will be your starting position.
Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbbell as you exhale. The dumbbell should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until the dumbbell is nearly in line with your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbbell, your elbow should always be higher than your forearm. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbell back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and switch arms.

This will be your starting position. Tip: The Mancuerna should be resting on top of your tAlto with the palm of your hands facing your tAltos. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the Mancuerna, your elbow should always be Altoer than your foPosteriorm. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement. Bajoer the Mancuerna Espalda down sBajoly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and switch arms.

Hombros.name: Mancuerna Elevación
Hombros.instructions:
Grab a dumbbell in each arm and stand up straight with your arms extended by your sides with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight. This will be your starting position. Tip: The dumbbell should be next to your thighs with the palm of your hands facing back.
Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbbells as you exhale. The dumbbells should be to the side of the body as you move them up. Continue to lift it until the dumbbells are nearly in line with your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbbell, your elbow should always be higher than your forearm. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
