Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Place a couple of Mancuernas looking forward in Frontal of a flat bench. Sit on the end of the bench with your Piernas together and the Mancuernas behind your calves. Bend at the waist while keeping the Espalda straight in order to pick up the Mancuernas. The palms of your hands should be facing each other as you pick them. This will be your starting position. Keeping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms slightly bent at the elbows, lift the Mancuernas straight to the Lateral until both arms are parallel to the Suelo. Exhale as you lift the weights. (Note: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms Espalda as opposed to the Lateral.) After a one second contraction at the top, sBajoly Bajoer the Mancuernas Espalda to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Seated Cable Shoulder Press
Hombros.instructions:
Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 90 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should also be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together above your head.
After pausing at the top, return the handles to the starting position. Ensure that you maintain tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back off the pad and alternate hands.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 90 degrees to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should also be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, pressing the handles together above your head.
After pausing at the top, return the handles to the starting position. Ensure that you maintain tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back off the pad and alternate hands.
Hombros.instructions_es: Adjust the weight to an appropriate amount and be Sentado, grasping the handles. Your upper arms should be about 90 degrees to the body, with your head and Pecho up. The elbows should also be bent to about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position. Begin by extending through the elbow, Pressing the handles together above your head. After pausing at the top, return the handles to the starting position. Ensure that you maintain tension on the Poleas. You can also execute this movement with your Espalda off the pad and alternate hands.

Hombros.name: Press con Mancuerna Sentado
Hombros.instructions:
Grab a couple of dumbbells and sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs.
Clean the dumbbells up one at a time by using your thighs to bring the dumbbells up to shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbbells up until they touch at the top.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Grab a couple of dumbbells and sit on a military press bench or a utility bench that has a back support on it as you place the dumbbells upright on top of your thighs.
Clean the dumbbells up one at a time by using your thighs to bring the dumbbells up to shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbbells up until they touch at the top.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Grab a couple of Mancuernas and sit on a Press Militar bench or a utility bench that has a Espalda support on it as you place the Mancuernas Vertical on top of your tAltos. Cargada the Mancuernas up one at a time by using your tAltos to bring the Mancuernas up to Hombro height at each Lateral. Rotate the Muñecas so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position. As you exhale, push the Mancuernas up until they touch at the top. After a second pause, sBajoly come down Espalda to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Sentado Frontal Deltoid
Hombros.instructions:
Sit upright on the floor with your legs bent, your partner standing behind you. Stick your arms straight out to your sides, with your palms facing the ground. Attempt to move them as far behind you as possible, as your assistant holds your wrists. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your elbows straight, attempt to move your arms to the front, with your partner gently restraining you to prevent any actual movement for 10-20 seconds.
Now, relax your muscles and allow your partner to gently increase the stretch on the shoulders and chest. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Sit upright on the floor with your legs bent, your partner standing behind you. Stick your arms straight out to your sides, with your palms facing the ground. Attempt to move them as far behind you as possible, as your assistant holds your wrists. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your elbows straight, attempt to move your arms to the front, with your partner gently restraining you to prevent any actual movement for 10-20 seconds.
Now, relax your muscles and allow your partner to gently increase the stretch on the shoulders and chest. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.
Hombros.instructions_es: Sit Vertical on the Suelo with your Piernas bent, your partner De Pie behind you. Stick your arms straight out to your Laterals, with your palms facing the ground. Attempt to move them as far behind you as possible, as your assistant holds your Muñecas. This will be your starting position. Keeping your elbows straight, attempt to move your arms to the Frontal, with your partner gently restraining you to prevent any actual movement for 10-20 seconds. Now, relax your Muslos and alBajo your partner to gently increase the stretch on the Hombros and Pecho. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.

Hombros.name: Sentado Lateral Elevación Lateral
Hombros.instructions:
Pick a couple of dumbbells and sit at the end of a flat bench with your feet firmly on the floor. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing in and your arms straight down at your sides at arms' length. This will be your starting position.
While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Pick a couple of dumbbells and sit at the end of a flat bench with your feet firmly on the floor. Hold the dumbbells with your palms facing in and your arms straight down at your sides at arms' length. This will be your starting position.
While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Pick a couple of Mancuernas and sit at the end of a flat bench with your feet firmly on the Suelo. Hold the Mancuernas with your palms facing in and your arms straight down at your Laterals at arms' length. This will be your starting position. While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the Mancuernas to your Lateral with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the Suelo. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top. Bajoer the Mancuernas Espalda down sBajoly to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: See-saw Press (Alternating Side Press)
Hombros.instructions:
Grab a dumbbell with each hand and stand up erect.
Clean (lift) the dumbbells to the chest/shoulder level and then rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards you as if you were getting ready to perform an Arnold Press. This will be your starting position.
Now start extending your left arm overhead as you rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand faces forward as you go up. Your elbows should come out also as you lift the weight. Simultaneously, you will also be bending from your hip to your opposite side. Tip: If you perform the exercise correctly, is should look as if you are trying to reach for something overhead on the right hand side of your body, but with your left arm. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Once you reach the top position breathe in. Then, with the weight fully extended overhead and you bent over to your right hand side, begin the movement to the left side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Grab a dumbbell with each hand and stand up erect.
Clean (lift) the dumbbells to the chest/shoulder level and then rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards you as if you were getting ready to perform an Arnold Press. This will be your starting position.
Now start extending your left arm overhead as you rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand faces forward as you go up. Your elbows should come out also as you lift the weight. Simultaneously, you will also be bending from your hip to your opposite side. Tip: If you perform the exercise correctly, is should look as if you are trying to reach for something overhead on the right hand side of your body, but with your left arm. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Once you reach the top position breathe in. Then, with the weight fully extended overhead and you bent over to your right hand side, begin the movement to the left side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Grab a Mancuerna with each hand and stand up erect. Cargada (lift) the Mancuernas to the Pecho/Hombro level and then rotate your Muñecas so that your palms are facing towards you as if you were getting ready to perform an Press Arnold. This will be your starting position. Now start extending your left arm Sobre la Cabeza as you rotate the Muñeca so that the palm of your hand faces forward as you go up. Your elbows should come out also as you lift the weight. Simultaneously, you will also be bending from your Cadera to your opposite Lateral. Tip: If you perform the exercise correctly, is should look as if you are trying to reach for something Sobre la Cabeza on the right hand Lateral of your body, but with your left arm. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Once you reach the top position breathe in. Then, with the weight fully extended Sobre la Cabeza and you Inclinado to your right hand Lateral, begin the movement to the left Lateral. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Hombro Circles
Hombros.instructions:
With shoulders relaxed and arms resting loosely at your sides (or in your lap if you're seated), gently roll your shoulders forward, up, back, and down.
Reverse direction. You can do this exercise alternating shoulders or both at the same time.
Hombros.instructions_en:
With shoulders relaxed and arms resting loosely at your sides (or in your lap if you're seated), gently roll your shoulders forward, up, back, and down.
Reverse direction. You can do this exercise alternating shoulders or both at the same time.
Hombros.instructions_es: With Hombros relaxed and arms resting loosely at your Laterals (or in your lap if you're Sentado), gently roll your Hombros forward, up, Espalda, and down. Inverso direction. You can do this exercise Alternando Hombros or both at the same time.

Hombros.name: Shoulder Press - With Bands
Hombros.instructions:
To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles and lift them so that the hands are at shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. Your elbows should be bent, with the upper arms and forearms in line to the torso. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, lift the handles up until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Hombros.instructions_en:
To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles and lift them so that the hands are at shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. Your elbows should be bent, with the upper arms and forearms in line to the torso. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, lift the handles up until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Hombros.instructions_es: To begin, stand on an exercise Banda so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles and lift them so that the hands are at Hombro height at each Lateral. Rotate the Muñecas so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. Your elbows should be bent, with the upper arms and foPosteriorms in line to the torso. This is your starting position. As you exhale, lift the handles up until your arms are fully extended Sobre la Cabeza.

Hombros.name: Hombro Elevación
Hombros.instructions: Relax your arms to your Laterals and Elevación your Hombros up toward your ears, then Espalda down.
Hombros.instructions_en: Relax your arms to your sides and raise your shoulders up toward your ears, then back down.
Hombros.instructions_es: Relax your arms to your Laterals and Elevación your Hombros up toward your ears, then Espalda down.

Hombros.name: Shoulder Stretch
Hombros.instructions: Reach your left arm across your body and hold it straight.
Hombros.instructions_en: Reach your left arm across your body and hold it straight.
Hombros.instructions_es: Reach your left arm across your body and hold it straight.

Hombros.name: Lateral Elevación Lateral
Hombros.instructions:
Pick a couple of dumbbells and stand with a straight torso and the dumbbells by your side at arms length with the palms of the hand facing you. This will be your starting position.
While maintaining the torso in a stationary position (no swinging), lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Pick a couple of dumbbells and stand with a straight torso and the dumbbells by your side at arms length with the palms of the hand facing you. This will be your starting position.
While maintaining the torso in a stationary position (no swinging), lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the floor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Pick a couple of Mancuernas and stand with a straight torso and the Mancuernas by your Lateral at arms length with the palms of the hand facing you. This will be your starting position. While maintaining the torso in a stationary position (no swinging), lift the Mancuernas to your Lateral with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glass. Continue to go up until you arms are parallel to the Suelo. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top. Bajoer the Mancuernas Espalda down sBajoly to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Lateral Laterals To Elevación Frontalal
Hombros.instructions:
In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
At the top of the exercise move the weights out in front of you, keeping your arms extended.
Lower the weights with a controlled motion.
On the next repetition, raise the weights in front of you to shoulder height before moving the weights laterally to your sides.
Lower the weights to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_en:
In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side. This will be your starting position.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
At the top of the exercise move the weights out in front of you, keeping your arms extended.
Lower the weights with a controlled motion.
On the next repetition, raise the weights in front of you to shoulder height before moving the weights laterally to your sides.
Lower the weights to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_es: In a De Pie position, hold a pair of Mancuernas at your Lateral. This will be your starting position. Keeping your elbows slightly bent, Elevación the weights directly in Frontal of you to Hombro height, avoiding any swinging or cheating. At the top of the exercise move the weights out in Frontal of you, keeping your arms extended. Bajoer the weights with a controlled motion. On the next repetition, Elevación the weights in Frontal of you to Hombro height before moving the weights Laterally to your Laterals. Bajoer the weights to the starting position.

Hombros.name: Lateral Muñeca Pull
Hombros.instructions:
This stretch works best standing. Cross your left arm over the midline of your body and hold the left wrist in your right hand down at the level of your hips. Start the stretch with a bent left arm.
Slowly straighten, pull, and lift it up to shoulder height, as pictured. Feel this stretch originate in your back, not your shoulders, and don't pull too hard on the shoulders joint. Switch sides.
Hombros.instructions_en:
This stretch works best standing. Cross your left arm over the midline of your body and hold the left wrist in your right hand down at the level of your hips. Start the stretch with a bent left arm.
Slowly straighten, pull, and lift it up to shoulder height, as pictured. Feel this stretch originate in your back, not your shoulders, and don't pull too hard on the shoulders joint. Switch sides.
Hombros.instructions_es: This stretch works best De Pie. Cross your left arm over the midline of your body and hold the left Muñeca in your right hand down at the level of your Caderas. Start the stretch with a bent left arm. SBajoly straighten, pull, and lift it up to Hombro height, as pictured. Feel this stretch originate in your Espalda, not your Hombros, and don't pull too hard on the Hombros joint. Switch Laterals.

Hombros.name: Prensa Linear de Un Brazo
Hombros.instructions:
Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight.
Raise the bar from the floor, taking it to your shoulders with one or both hands. Adopt a wide stance. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by extending the elbow, pressing the weight up. Move explosively, extending the hips and knees fully to produce maximal force.
Return to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight.
Raise the bar from the floor, taking it to your shoulders with one or both hands. Adopt a wide stance. This will be your starting position.
Perform the movement by extending the elbow, pressing the weight up. Move explosively, extending the hips and knees fully to produce maximal force.
Return to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_es: Position a bar into a Landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight. Elevación the bar from the Suelo, taking it to your Hombros with one or both hands. Adopt a wide stance. This will be your starting position. Perform the movement by extending the elbow, Pressing the weight up. Move explosively, extending the Caderas and knees fully to produce maximal force. Return to the starting position.

Hombros.name: Elevaciones Laterales con Mancuerna
Hombros.instructions:
With a wide stance, hold a dumbell with both hands, grasping the head of the dumbbell instead of the handle. Your arms should be extended and hanging at the waist. This will be your starting position.
Raise the weight until it is above shoulder level, keeping your arms extended. Your torso and hips should remain stationary throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
With a wide stance, hold a dumbell with both hands, grasping the head of the dumbbell instead of the handle. Your arms should be extended and hanging at the waist. This will be your starting position.
Raise the weight until it is above shoulder level, keeping your arms extended. Your torso and hips should remain stationary throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: With a wide stance, hold a dumbell with both hands, grasping the head of the Mancuerna instead of the handle. Your arms should be extended and Colgadoing at the waist. This will be your starting position. Elevación the weight until it is above Hombro level, keeping your arms extended. Your torso and Caderas should remain stationary throughout the movement. Return to the starting position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Trineo Sobre la Cabeza Espaldaward Walk
Hombros.instructions:
Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.
Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Hold your hands directly above your head with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.
Walk backwards, keeping your arms raised above your head. Avoid jerky movements.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.
Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Hold your hands directly above your head with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position.
Walk backwards, keeping your arms raised above your head. Avoid jerky movements.
Hombros.instructions_es: Attach dual handles to a Trineo connected by a rope or chain. Load the Trineo to a light weight. Face the Trineo, Espaldaing up until there is some tension in the line. Hold your hands directly above your head with your elbows extended. This will be your starting position. Walk Espaldawards, keeping your arms Elevaciónd above your head. Avoid Envióny movements.

Hombros.name: Trineo Inverso Aperturase
Hombros.instructions:
Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.
Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Take both handles at arms length at about waist level. Bend the knees slightly and keep your chest and head up. This will be your starting position.
Without flexing the elbow, pull the handles upward and apart, performing a reverse fly with some external rotation. Your palms should be facing forward as you do this.
Return to the starting position, taking a couple steps back to take the slack out of the line.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Attach dual handles to a sled connected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.
Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Take both handles at arms length at about waist level. Bend the knees slightly and keep your chest and head up. This will be your starting position.
Without flexing the elbow, pull the handles upward and apart, performing a reverse fly with some external rotation. Your palms should be facing forward as you do this.
Return to the starting position, taking a couple steps back to take the slack out of the line.
Hombros.instructions_es: Attach dual handles to a Trineo connected by a rope or chain. Load the Trineo to a light weight. Face the Trineo, Espaldaing up until there is some tension in the line. Take both handles at arms length at about waist level. Bend the knees slightly and keep your Pecho and head up. This will be your starting position. Without flexing the elbow, pull the handles upward and apart, performing a Inverso Aperturas with some external rotation. Your palms should be facing forward as you do this. Return to the starting position, taking a couple steps Espalda to take the slack out of the line.

Hombros.name: Multipower Inclinado Hombro Elevación
Hombros.instructions:
Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your shoulders are aligned right under the barbell.
Using a shoulder width pronated (palms forward) grip, lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe out, lift the bar up until your arms are fully extended. Note: The contraction should be felt around the shoulders.
After a second pause, bring the bar back down to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbell at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your shoulders are aligned right under the barbell.
Using a shoulder width pronated (palms forward) grip, lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position.
As you breathe out, lift the bar up until your arms are fully extended. Note: The contraction should be felt around the shoulders.
After a second pause, bring the bar back down to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
Hombros.instructions_es: Place an Banca Inclinada underneath the MultiPower. Place the Barra at a height that you can reach when Recostado down and your arms are almost fully extended. Once the weight you need is selected, lie down on the Banca Inclinada and make sure your Hombros are aligned right under the Barra. Using a Hombro width pronated (palms forward) grip, lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with a slight bend at the elbows. This will be your starting position. As you breathe out, lift the bar up until your arms are fully extended. Note: The contraction should be felt around the Hombros. After a second pause, bring the bar Espalda down to the starting position as you breathe in. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions. When you are done, place the bar Espalda in the rack.

Hombros.name: Multipower Un Brazo Remo al Mentón
Hombros.instructions:
With the bar at thigh level, load an appropriate weight.
Take a wide grip on the bar and unhook the weight, removing your off hand from the bar. Your arm should be extended as you stand up straight with your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, raising the upper arm with the elbow pointed out. Continue until your upper arm is parallel to the floor.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.
Hombros.instructions_en:
With the bar at thigh level, load an appropriate weight.
Take a wide grip on the bar and unhook the weight, removing your off hand from the bar. Your arm should be extended as you stand up straight with your head and chest up. This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, raising the upper arm with the elbow pointed out. Continue until your upper arm is parallel to the floor.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.
Hombros.instructions_es: With the bar at tAlto level, load an appropriate weight. Take a Agarre Ancho on the bar and unhook the weight, removing your off hand from the bar. Your arm should be extended as you stand up straight with your head and Pecho up. This will be your starting position. Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, raising the upper arm with the elbow pointed out. Continue until your upper arm is parallel to the Suelo. After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.

Hombros.name: Smith Machine Overhead Shoulder Press
Hombros.instructions:
To begin, place a flat bench (or preferably one with back support) underneath a smith machine. Position the barbell at a height so that when seated on the flat bench, the arms must be almost fully extended to reach the barbell.
Once you have the correct height, sit slightly in behind the barbell so that there is an imaginary straight line from the tip of your nose to the barbell. Your feet should be stationary. Grab the barbell with the palms facing forward, unlock it and lift it up so that your arms are fully extended. This is the starting position.
Slowly begin to lower the barbell until it is level with your chin while inhaling.
Then lift the barbell back to the starting position using your shoulders while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
To begin, place a flat bench (or preferably one with back support) underneath a smith machine. Position the barbell at a height so that when seated on the flat bench, the arms must be almost fully extended to reach the barbell.
Once you have the correct height, sit slightly in behind the barbell so that there is an imaginary straight line from the tip of your nose to the barbell. Your feet should be stationary. Grab the barbell with the palms facing forward, unlock it and lift it up so that your arms are fully extended. This is the starting position.
Slowly begin to lower the barbell until it is level with your chin while inhaling.
Then lift the barbell back to the starting position using your shoulders while exhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: To begin, place a flat bench (or preferably one with Espalda support) underneath a MultiPower. Position the Barra at a height so that when Sentado on the flat bench, the arms must be almost fully extended to reach the Barra. Once you have the correct height, sit slightly in behind the Barra so that there is an imaginary straight line from the tip of your nose to the Barra. Your feet should be stationary. Grab the Barra with the palms facing forward, unlock it and lift it up so that your arms are fully extended. This is the starting position. SBajoly begin to Bajoer the Barra until it is level with your chin while inhaling. Then lift the Barra Espalda to the starting position using your Hombros while exhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Standing Alternating Dumbbell Press
Hombros.instructions:
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand. Raise the dumbbells to your shoulders with your palms facing forward and your elbows pointed out. This will be your starting position.
Extend one arm to press the dumbbell straight up, keeping your off hand in place. Do not lean or jerk the weight during the movement.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the opposite side, continuing to alternate between arms.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Stand with a dumbbell in each hand. Raise the dumbbells to your shoulders with your palms facing forward and your elbows pointed out. This will be your starting position.
Extend one arm to press the dumbbell straight up, keeping your off hand in place. Do not lean or jerk the weight during the movement.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the opposite side, continuing to alternate between arms.
Hombros.instructions_es: Stand with a Mancuerna in each hand. Elevación the Mancuernas to your Hombros with your palms facing forward and your elbows pointed out. This will be your starting position. Extend Un Brazo to Press the Mancuerna straight up, keeping your off hand in place. Do not lean or Envión the weight during the movement. After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position. Repeat for the opposite Lateral, continuing to alternate between arms.

Hombros.name: Standing Barbell Press Behind Neck
Hombros.instructions:
This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for easier pick up of the bar. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.
Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your back should be kept straight while performing this exercise. This will be your starting position.
Elevate the barbell overhead by fully extending your arms while breathing out.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbell back down to the starting position by inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for easier pick up of the bar. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.
Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your back should be kept straight while performing this exercise. This will be your starting position.
Elevate the barbell overhead by fully extending your arms while breathing out.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbell back down to the starting position by inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: This exercise is best performed inLateral a Sentadilla rack for easier pick up of the bar. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the Espalda of your Hombros (slightly beBajo the neck) across it. Hold on to the bar using both arms at each Lateral and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your Piernas and at the same time straightening your torso. Step away from the rack and position your Piernas using a Hombro width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your Espalda should be kept straight while performing this exercise. This will be your starting position. Elevate the Barra Sobre la Cabeza by fully extending your arms while breathing out. Hold the contraction for a second and Bajoer the Barra Espalda down to the starting position by inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Standing Bradford Press
Hombros.instructions:
Place a loaded bar at shoulder level in a rack. With a pronated grip at shoulder width, begin with the bar racked across the front of your shoulders. This is your starting position.
Initiate the lift by extending the elbows to press the bar overhead. Avoid locking out the elbow as you move the weight behind your head.
Lower the bar down to the back of the head until your elbow forms a right angle.
Lift the bar back over your head by extending the elbows
Lower the bar down to the starting position.
Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Place a loaded bar at shoulder level in a rack. With a pronated grip at shoulder width, begin with the bar racked across the front of your shoulders. This is your starting position.
Initiate the lift by extending the elbows to press the bar overhead. Avoid locking out the elbow as you move the weight behind your head.
Lower the bar down to the back of the head until your elbow forms a right angle.
Lift the bar back over your head by extending the elbows
Lower the bar down to the starting position.
Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Place a loaded bar at Hombro level in a rack. With a pronated grip at Hombro width, begin with the bar racked across the Frontal of your Hombros. This is your starting position. Initiate the lift by extending the elbows to Press the bar Sobre la Cabeza. Avoid locking out the elbow as you move the weight behind your head. Bajoer the bar down to the Espalda of the head until your elbow forms a right angle. Lift the bar Espalda over your head by extending the elbows Bajoer the bar down to the starting position. Alternate in this manner until you complete the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Standing Dumbbell Press
Hombros.instructions:
Standing with your feet shoulder width apart, take a dumbbell in each hand. Raise the dumbbells to head height, the elbows out and about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Maintaining strict technique with no leg drive or leaning back, extend through the elbow to raise the weights together directly above your head.
Pause, and slowly return the weight to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Standing with your feet shoulder width apart, take a dumbbell in each hand. Raise the dumbbells to head height, the elbows out and about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position.
Maintaining strict technique with no leg drive or leaning back, extend through the elbow to raise the weights together directly above your head.
Pause, and slowly return the weight to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_es: De Pie with your feet Hombro width apart, take a Mancuerna in each hand. Elevación the Mancuernas to head height, the elbows out and about 90 degrees. This will be your starting position. Maintaining Estricto technique with no Pierna drive or leaning Espalda, extend through the elbow to Elevación the weights together directly above your head. Pause, and sBajoly return the weight to the starting position.

Hombros.name: De Pie Mancuerna Straight-arm Frontal Delt Elevación Above Head
Hombros.instructions:
Hold the dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms facing your thighs.
Keep your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows but keep them locked. This will be your starting position.
Raise the dumbbells in a semicircular motion to arm's length overhead as you exhale.
Slowly return to the starting position using the same path as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.name_en: Standing Dumbbell Straight-Arm Front Delt Raise Above Head
Hombros.instructions_en:
Hold the dumbbells in front of your thighs, palms facing your thighs.
Keep your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows but keep them locked. This will be your starting position.
Raise the dumbbells in a semicircular motion to arm's length overhead as you exhale.
Slowly return to the starting position using the same path as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Hold the Mancuernas in Frontal of your tAltos, palms facing your tAltos. Keep your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows but keep them locked. This will be your starting position. Elevación the Mancuernas in a semicircular motion to arm's length Sobre la Cabeza as you exhale. SBajoly return to the starting position using the same path as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Press Militar con Barra
Hombros.instructions:
To begin, stand straight with a barbell in your hands. You should grip the bar with palms facing down and a closer than shoulder width grip apart from each other.
Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Your elbows should be slightly bent. This is the starting position.
Lift the barbell up until it is directly over your head while exhaling. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent when performing each repetition.
Once you feel the contraction, begin to lower the barbell back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.name_en: Standing Front Barbell Raise Over Head
Hombros.instructions_en:
To begin, stand straight with a barbell in your hands. You should grip the bar with palms facing down and a closer than shoulder width grip apart from each other.
Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Your elbows should be slightly bent. This is the starting position.
Lift the barbell up until it is directly over your head while exhaling. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent when performing each repetition.
Once you feel the contraction, begin to lower the barbell back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: To begin, stand straight with a Barra in your hands. You should grip the bar with palms facing down and a closer than Hombro width grip apart from each other. Your feet should be Hombro width apart from each other. Your elbows should be slightly bent. This is the starting position. Lift the Barra up until it is directly over your head while exhaling. Make sure to keep your elbows slightly bent when performing each repetition. Once you feel the contraction, begin to Bajoer the Barra Espalda down to the starting position as you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: De Pie Bajo-pulley Deltoid Elevación
Hombros.instructions:
Start by standing to the right side of a low pulley row. Use your left hand to come across the body and grab a single handle attached to the low pulley with a pronated grip (palms facing down). Rest your arm in front of you. Your right hand should grab the machine for better support and balance.
Make sure that your back is erect and your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
Begin to use the left hand and come across your body out until it is elevated to shoulder height while exhaling.
Feel the contraction at the top for a second and begin to slowly lower the handle back down to the original starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Start by standing to the right side of a low pulley row. Use your left hand to come across the body and grab a single handle attached to the low pulley with a pronated grip (palms facing down). Rest your arm in front of you. Your right hand should grab the machine for better support and balance.
Make sure that your back is erect and your feet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
Begin to use the left hand and come across your body out until it is elevated to shoulder height while exhaling.
Feel the contraction at the top for a second and begin to slowly lower the handle back down to the original starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
Hombros.instructions_es: Start by De Pie to the right Lateral of a Bajo pulley Remo. Use your left hand to come across the body and grab a single handle attached to the Bajo pulley with a pronated grip (palms facing down). Rest your arm in Frontal of you. Your right hand should grab the Máquina for better support and balance. Make sure that your Espalda is erect and your feet are Hombro width apart from each other. This is the starting position. Begin to use the left hand and come across your body out until it is elevated to Hombro height while exhaling. Feel the contraction at the top for a second and begin to sBajoly Bajoer the handle Espalda down to the original starting position while inhaling. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

Hombros.name: Standing Military Press
Hombros.instructions:
Start by placing a barbell that is about chest high on a squat rack. Once you have selected the weights, grab the barbell using a pronated (palms facing forward) grip. Make sure to grip the bar wider than shoulder width apart from each other.
Slightly bend the knees and place the barbell on your collar bone. Lift the barbell up keeping it lying on your chest. Take a step back and position your feet shoulder width apart from each other.
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the collarbone slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Start by placing a barbell that is about chest high on a squat rack. Once you have selected the weights, grab the barbell using a pronated (palms facing forward) grip. Make sure to grip the bar wider than shoulder width apart from each other.
Slightly bend the knees and place the barbell on your collar bone. Lift the barbell up keeping it lying on your chest. Take a step back and position your feet shoulder width apart from each other.
Once you pick up the barbell with the correct grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the collarbone slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Start by placing a Barra that is about Pecho Alto on a Sentadilla rack. Once you have selected the weights, grab the Barra using a pronated (palms facing forward) grip. Make sure to grip the bar wider than Hombro width apart from each other. Slightly bend the knees and place the Barra on your collar bone. Lift the Barra up keeping it Recostado on your Pecho. Take a step Espalda and position your feet Hombro width apart from each other. Once you pick up the Barra with the correct grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about Hombro level and slightly in Frontal of your head. This is your starting position. Bajoer the bar down to the collarbone sBajoly as you inhale. Lift the bar Espalda up to the starting position as you exhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Standing Palm-in One-arm Dumbbell Press
Hombros.instructions:
Start by having a dumbbell in one hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Use your other arm to hold on to an incline bench to keep your balance.
Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbell up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arm. Note: Your forearm should be perpendicular to the floor. Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended. This the starting position.
While inhaling lower the weight down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.
Feel the contraction for a second and then lift the weight back up towards the starting position while exhaling. Remember to hold on to the incline bench and keep your feet positioned to keep balance during the exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Start by having a dumbbell in one hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Use your other arm to hold on to an incline bench to keep your balance.
Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbell up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arm. Note: Your forearm should be perpendicular to the floor. Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise.
Slowly lift the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended. This the starting position.
While inhaling lower the weight down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.
Feel the contraction for a second and then lift the weight back up towards the starting position while exhaling. Remember to hold on to the incline bench and keep your feet positioned to keep balance during the exercise.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
Hombros.instructions_es: Start by having a Mancuerna in one hand with your arm fully extended to the Lateral using a Agarre Neutro. Use your other arm to hold on to an Banca Inclinada to keep your balance. Your feet should be Hombro width apart from each other. Now sBajoly lift the Mancuerna up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arm. Note: Your foPosteriorm should be perpendicular to the Suelo. Continue to maintain a Agarre Neutro throughout the entire exercise. SBajoly lift the Mancuerna up until your arm is fully extended. This the starting position. While inhaling Bajoer the weight down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again. Feel the contraction for a second and then lift the weight Espalda up towards the starting position while exhaling. Remember to hold on to the Banca Inclinada and keep your feet positioned to keep balance during the exercise. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

Hombros.name: Standing Palms-in Dumbbell Press
Hombros.instructions:
Start by having a dumbbell in each hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbells up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arms. Note: Your forearms should be perpendicular to the floor. This the starting position.
Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise. Slowly lift the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended.
While inhaling lower the weights down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Start by having a dumbbell in each hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbells up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arms. Note: Your forearms should be perpendicular to the floor. This the starting position.
Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise. Slowly lift the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended.
While inhaling lower the weights down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Start by having a Mancuerna in each hand with your arm fully extended to the Lateral using a Agarre Neutro. Your feet should be Hombro width apart from each other. Now sBajoly lift the Mancuernas up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arms. Note: Your foPosteriorms should be perpendicular to the Suelo. This the starting position. Continue to maintain a Agarre Neutro throughout the entire exercise. SBajoly lift the Mancuernas up until your arms are fully extended. While inhaling Bajoer the weights down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: De Pie Two-arm Sobre la Cabeza Thremo
Hombros.instructions:
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding a medicine ball in both hands. To begin, reach the medicine ball deep behind your head as you bend the knees slightly and lean back.
Violently throw the ball forward, flexing at the hip and using your whole body to complete the movement.
The medicine ball can be thrown to a partner or to a wall, receiving it as it bounces back.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding a medicine ball in both hands. To begin, reach the medicine ball deep behind your head as you bend the knees slightly and lean back.
Violently throw the ball forward, flexing at the hip and using your whole body to complete the movement.
The medicine ball can be thrown to a partner or to a wall, receiving it as it bounces back.
Hombros.instructions_es: Stand with your feet Hombro width apart holding a medicine ball in both hands. To begin, reach the medicine ball deep behind your head as you bend the knees slightly and lean Espalda. Violently thRemo the ball forward, flexing at the Cadera and using your whole body to complete the movement. The medicine ball can be thRemon to a partner or to a wall, receiving it as it bounces Espalda.

Hombros.name: Straight Elevacións On Banca Inclinada
Hombros.instructions:
Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbell up from the floor, keeping your arms straight. Allow the bar to hang straight down. This will be your starting position.
To begin, raise the barbell out in front of your head while keeping your arms extended.
Return to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbell up from the floor, keeping your arms straight. Allow the bar to hang straight down. This will be your starting position.
To begin, raise the barbell out in front of your head while keeping your arms extended.
Return to the starting position.
Hombros.instructions_es: Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an Banca Inclinada. Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the Barra up from the Suelo, keeping your arms straight. AlBajo the bar to Colgado straight down. This will be your starting position. To begin, Elevación the Barra out in Frontal of your head while keeping your arms extended. Return to the starting position.

Hombros.name: Two-arm Pesa Rusa Cargada
Hombros.instructions:
Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.
Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position and repeat.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Place two kettlebells between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt back and look straight ahead.
Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position and repeat.
Hombros.instructions_es: Place two Pesa Rusas between your feet. To get in the starting position, push your butt Espalda and look straight ahead. Cargada the Pesa Rusas to your Hombros by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you Elevación the Pesa Rusas towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñecas as you do so. Bajoer the Pesa Rusas Espalda to the starting position and repeat.

Hombros.name: Two-arm Pesa Rusa Envión
Hombros.instructions: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you swing the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward. Squat down a few inches and reverse the motion rapidly driving both kettlebells overhead. Immediately after the initial push, squat down again and get under the kettlebells. Once the kettlebells are locked out, stand upright to complete the exercise.
Hombros.instructions_en: Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you swing the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward. Squat down a few inches and reverse the motion rapidly driving both kettlebells overhead. Immediately after the initial push, squat down again and get under the kettlebells. Once the kettlebells are locked out, stand upright to complete the exercise.
Hombros.instructions_es: Cargada two Pesa Rusas to your Hombros. Cargada the Pesa Rusas to your Hombros by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you swing the Pesa Rusas towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñecas as you do so, so that the palms face forward. Sentadilla down a few inches and Inverso the motion rapidly driving both Pesa Rusas Sobre la Cabeza. Immediately after the initial push, Sentadilla down again and get under the Pesa Rusas. Once the Pesa Rusas are locked out, stand Vertical to complete the exercise.

Hombros.name: Two-arm Kettlebell Military Press
Hombros.instructions:
Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you swing the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward.
Press the kettlebells up and out. As the kettlebells pass your head, lean into the weights so that the kettlebells are racked behind your head. Make sure to contract your lats, butt, and stomach for added stability.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Clean two kettlebells to your shoulders. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you swing the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward.
Press the kettlebells up and out. As the kettlebells pass your head, lean into the weights so that the kettlebells are racked behind your head. Make sure to contract your lats, butt, and stomach for added stability.
Hombros.instructions_es: Cargada two Pesa Rusas to your Hombros. Cargada the Pesa Rusas to your Hombros by extending through the Piernas and Caderas as you swing the Pesa Rusas towards your Hombros. Rotate your Muñecas as you do so, so that the palms face forward. Press the Pesa Rusas up and out. As the Pesa Rusas pass your head, lean into the weights so that the Pesa Rusas are racked behind your head. Make sure to contract your lats, butt, and stomach for added stability.

Hombros.name: Vertical Barra Remo
Hombros.instructions:
Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip that is slightly less than shoulder width. The bar should be resting on the top of your thighs with your arms extended and a slight bend in your elbows. Your back should also be straight. This will be your starting position.
Now exhale and use the sides of your shoulders to lift the bar, raising your elbows up and to the side. Keep the bar close to your body as you raise it. Continue to lift the bar until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion, and should always be higher than your forearms. Remember to keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Grasp a barbell with an overhand grip that is slightly less than shoulder width. The bar should be resting on the top of your thighs with your arms extended and a slight bend in your elbows. Your back should also be straight. This will be your starting position.
Now exhale and use the sides of your shoulders to lift the bar, raising your elbows up and to the side. Keep the bar close to your body as you raise it. Continue to lift the bar until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion, and should always be higher than your forearms. Remember to keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Hombros.instructions_es: Grasp a Barra with an overhand grip that is slightly less than Hombro width. The bar should be resting on the top of your tAltos with your arms extended and a slight bend in your elbows. Your Espalda should also be straight. This will be your starting position. Now exhale and use the Laterals of your Hombros to lift the bar, raising your elbows up and to the Lateral. Keep the bar close to your body as you Elevación it. Continue to lift the bar until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion, and should always be Altoer than your foPosteriorms. Remember to keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement. Bajoer the bar Espalda down sBajoly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hombros.name: Upward Stretch
Hombros.instructions: Extend both hands straight above your head, palms touching. SBajoly push your hands up and Espalda, keeping your Espalda straight.
Hombros.instructions_en:
Extend both hands straight above your head, palms touching.
Slowly push your hands up and back, keeping your back straight.
Hombros.instructions_es: Extend both hands straight above your head, palms touching. SBajoly push your hands up and Espalda, keeping your Espalda straight.

Trapecios.name: Barbell Shrug
Trapecios.instructions:
Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands in front of you using a pronated grip (palms facing the thighs). Tip: Your hands should be a little wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for a better grip. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbell by using your biceps.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands in front of you using a pronated grip (palms facing the thighs). Tip: Your hands should be a little wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for a better grip. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbell by using your biceps.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Encogimiento de Hombros con Barra
Trapecios.instructions:
Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands behind your back using a pronated grip (palms facing back). Tip: Your hands should be a little wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for better grip. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbell by using your biceps. The arms should remain stretched out at all times.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands behind your back using a pronated grip (palms facing back). Tip: Your hands should be a little wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for better grip. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbell by using your biceps. The arms should remain stretched out at all times.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Encogimientos con Cable
Trapecios.instructions:
Grasp a cable bar attachment that is attached to a low pulley with a shoulder width or slightly wider overhand (palms facing down) grip.
Stand erect close to the pulley with your arms extended in front of you holding the bar. This will be your starting position.
Lift the bar by elevating the shoulders as high as possible as you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at all times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the bar. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the bar back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Grasp a cable bar attachment that is attached to a low pulley with a shoulder width or slightly wider overhand (palms facing down) grip.
Stand erect close to the pulley with your arms extended in front of you holding the bar. This will be your starting position.
Lift the bar by elevating the shoulders as high as possible as you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at all times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the bar. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the bar back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Calf-machine Shoulder Shrug
Trapecios.instructions:
Position yourself on the calf machine so that the shoulder pads are above your shoulders. Your torso should be straight with the arms extended normally by your side. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up towards your ears as you exhale and hold the contraction for a full second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Position yourself on the calf machine so that the shoulder pads are above your shoulders. Your torso should be straight with the arms extended normally by your side. This will be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up towards your ears as you exhale and hold the contraction for a full second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Clean Shrug
Trapecios.instructions:
Begin with a shoulder width, double overhand or hook grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usually by loaded with heavier weight than a clean, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Begin with a shoulder width, double overhand or hook grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usually by loaded with heavier weight than a clean, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.

Trapecios.name: Encogimiento de Hombros
Trapecios.instructions:
Stand erect with a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing your torso), arms extended on the sides.
Lift the dumbbells by elevating the shoulders as high as possible while you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at all times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the dumbbells. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the dumbbells back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Stand erect with a dumbbell on each hand (palms facing your torso), arms extended on the sides.
Lift the dumbbells by elevating the shoulders as high as possible while you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at all times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the dumbbells. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the dumbbells back to the original position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Kettlebell Sumo High Pull
Trapecios.instructions:
Place a kettlebell on the ground between your feet. Position your feet in a wide stance, and grasp the kettlebell with two hands. Set your hips back as far as possible, with your knees bent. Keep your chest and head up. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips and knees, simultaneously pulling the kettlebell to your shoulders, raising your elbows as you do so. Reverse the motion to return to the starting position.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Place a kettlebell on the ground between your feet. Position your feet in a wide stance, and grasp the kettlebell with two hands. Set your hips back as far as possible, with your knees bent. Keep your chest and head up. This will be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips and knees, simultaneously pulling the kettlebell to your shoulders, raising your elbows as you do so. Reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

Trapecios.name: Encogimiento de Hombros con Peso
Trapecios.instructions:
Load the pins to an appropriate weight. Position yourself directly between the handles.
Grasp the top handles with a comfortable grip, and then lower your hips as you take a breath. Look forward with your head and keep your chest up.
Drive through the floor with your heels, extending your hips and knees as you rise to a standing position. Keep your arms straight throughout the movement, finishing with your shoulders back. This will be your starting position.
Raise the weight by shrugging the shoulders towards your ears, moving straight up and down.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then return the weight to the starting position.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Load the pins to an appropriate weight. Position yourself directly between the handles.
Grasp the top handles with a comfortable grip, and then lower your hips as you take a breath. Look forward with your head and keep your chest up.
Drive through the floor with your heels, extending your hips and knees as you rise to a standing position. Keep your arms straight throughout the movement, finishing with your shoulders back. This will be your starting position.
Raise the weight by shrugging the shoulders towards your ears, moving straight up and down.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then return the weight to the starting position.

Trapecios.name: Scapular Pull-up
Trapecios.instructions:
Take a pronated grip on a pull-up bar.
From a hanging position, raise yourself a few inches without using your arms. Do this by depressing your shoulder girdle in a reverse shrugging motion.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position before performing more repetitions.
Trapecios.instructions_en:
Take a pronated grip on a pull-up bar.
From a hanging position, raise yourself a few inches without using your arms. Do this by depressing your shoulder girdle in a reverse shrugging motion.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position before performing more repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Smith Machine Behind The Back Shrug
Trapecios.instructions:
With the bar at thigh level, load an appropriate weight.
Stand with the bar behind you, taking a shoulder-width, pronated grip on the bar and unhook the weight. You should be standing up straight with your head and chest up and your arms extended. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by shrugging your shoulders straight up. Do not flex the arms or wrist during the movement.
After a brief pause return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.
Trapecios.name_en: Smith Machine Behind the Back Shrug
Trapecios.instructions_en:
With the bar at thigh level, load an appropriate weight.
Stand with the bar behind you, taking a shoulder-width, pronated grip on the bar and unhook the weight. You should be standing up straight with your head and chest up and your arms extended. This will be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by shrugging your shoulders straight up. Do not flex the arms or wrist during the movement.
After a brief pause return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hooks to rack the weight.

Trapecios.name: Remo en Máquina Smith
Trapecios.instructions:
To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the middle of your thighs. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may need some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Lift the barbell up and fully extend your arms with your back straight. There should be a slight bend at the elbows. This is the starting position.
Use your side shoulders to lift the bar as you exhale. The bar should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the bar, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Snatch Shrug
Trapecios.instructions:
Begin with a wide grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. You can use a hook or overhand grip. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usually by loaded with heavier weight than a snatch, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.

Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usually by loaded with heavier weight than a snatch, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.

Trapecios.name: Remo Vertical con Mancuernas
Trapecios.instructions:
Grasp a dumbbell in each hand with a pronated (palms forward) grip that is slightly less than shoulder width. The dumbbells should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This will be your starting position.
Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbbells as you exhale. The dumbbells should be close to the body as you move it up and the elbows should drive the motion. Continue to lift them until they nearly touch your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbbells, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Trapecios.name: Remo al Mentón con Polea
Trapecios.instructions:
Grasp a straight bar cable attachment that is attached to a low pulley with a pronated (palms facing your thighs) grip that is slightly less than shoulder width. The bar should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This will be your starting position.
Use your side shoulders to lift the cable bar as you exhale. The bar should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the bar, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

The bar should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This will be your starting position.

Trapecios.name: Remo Vertical con Banda
Trapecios.instructions:
To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles using a pronated (palms facing your thighs) grip that is slightly less than shoulder width. The handles should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This will be your starting position.
Use your side shoulders to lift the handles as you exhale. The handles should be close to the body as you move them up. Continue to lift the handles until they nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the handles, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, keep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the handles back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
